Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Arik G
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in this hotel. The staff welcome us very warmly. The rooms were extremely comfortable and was cleaned and organized more then once a day. special thanks to Maria who heard that we are celebrating 30 years of marriage and sent us a bottle of champagne to our room. The quality of service provided by all the staff is extremely high. Excellent location next to the Metro and in walking distance from some of the main attractions. If you need a taxi, you order from the bell boy and you get it within a few minutes. Nevertheless, the variaty of food in breakfast is not too big and this is the only thing we found that need to be improved. We felt extremely comfortable in this hotel and next time we are in Rome we will definitely choose Exedra Boscolo hotel again. Ilana & Arik

Reviews.Title: “Bella Roma”
Reviews.Author: Eser
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Exedra with my family btw 21-24 March for 3 night and all of us agreed that Exedra is one of the best hotels in Rome . We booked double deluxe room for 3 adults . Knowing the hotel rooms in Europe , I was a little bit hassitating but then ... surprise ! The room was more than enough for 3 adults. Bathroom was amazing with Etro amenities. Hotel location and the building was facinating . The staff was very friendly and helpfull . What we didnt like much was the roof terrace and the breakfast. It was "avarage " , I recomend this hotel without a breakfast package. It was not worth 35 € /person. We loved Roma , We loved Exedra ...

Reviews.Title: “Spacious!”
Reviews.Author: Jakub D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so spacious! It is so big for Rome! The rooms are big, the bathrooms are big, reception is big, everything is big! Very nice! The we have those comfy beds! Brilliant! Great classical system of filling a paper in the evening. Then you put this paper on your door. And at the morning, on time which you have chosen, breakfast arrives, so you can eat it in your spacious room! Very good! Plus they clean your room very neatly! They even organized my clothes! Briliant! Boscolo Exedra is located in middle of Rome, so it is very easy to move around! But to the Boscolos downsides... You can not make your own coffee on your room... You have to wait for room service... And then it is very vast, so from my room it was 5 minute walk. But that is all what can I think of. So Boscolo Exedra means loads of space and briliant service in middle of Rome. Enjoy your holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but very nice and centrally located!”
Reviews.Author: cyoung0329
Reviews.Content: I was here four nights last week. I was a solo traveler. The view from the single room was not nice but as I only slept there it was OK. Mini bar and hotel restaurant were hugely expensive but many stores are close by as well as restaurants and wine and coffee bars. I was within walking distance of the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, National Art Museum and a quick bus trip to the Colosseum, Roman Forum and other monuments. The train station is very close (regular train and Eurostar). There is an ATM very close by. I found the staff very pleasant and helpful (concierge even inspected my shoes to make sure they were appropriate for side trip to Pompeii!) It also has a spa if you want a post excursion massage! The area is very safe for exploring during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Rome fantastic - hotel good but not central”
Reviews.Author: lux-chill
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal and the rooms were great. We didn't eat at the hotel lovely little restaurant behind the hotel with good prices, and some great ones around Rome. Make sure you visit armando al pantheon fantastic restaurant opposite the pantheon to the right when facing the entrance - do not be put off by the exterior - proper traditional food amazing! Also another tip tourist buses are great mon-fri but crazy annoyingly busy on weekends. Anyway the hotel is 3 mins walk from terminus (train station) but is near the banking district so well away from most things tourist and central Rome. Plus is swimming pool but was unused and cold due to weather when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: HScuba
Reviews.Content: Location very close to Termini was a plus. Rooms ok but not really 5star, Internet access was kind of slow.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: VIESSE
Reviews.Content: I've been 4days in this hotel for work, tour leading a group of people. The hotel has got many things to fix for a 5stars category hotel. Cons: very slow internet access, just one concierge at the often busy desk, not so luxurious furniture overall and poor restrooms in the lobby (plastic soap dispenser, no hand towels or hand dryer but just some kleenex). Pros: helpful and kind reception staff, good position 5mins walking from stazione Termini. Eventually, i wouldn't recommend this hotel for the price/quality ratio. Consider it just as a big 4stars hotel, nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “BITTERSWEET, MORE BITTER EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: A M
Reviews.Content: Should have done this before but never got round to it; My sister and I paid for a long week-end for my catholic mother's (who'd never been to Rome) 60th birthday with my Dad. Room wasn't ready when they arrived and staff took 2 hours to rectify. No refreshments offered. Hot water temperature not hot in room, never rectified in the 4 days they were there. Paid for fruit basket & champagne on arrival in room. Not done til we called our parents that night to see if they arrived ok and were having a good time. Paid for hotel but no breakfast as parents wanted to go out for breakfast each day. 1 day they didn't and wanted breakfast in hotel, they refused to charge to room and demanded payment there and then rather than add to room, embarrassing my parents as other clients aroun them at the time. We booked free limo take them back to airport when they arrived - as I was told when booked. On the morning, limo not available but actually sitting outside for another client. Folks had to pay silly money to organise a fast taxi to then get them to the airport on time. When my parents talk about this much looked forward to, 4000 pounds/4 day tripp (which they don't know the cost), they mention what a fantastic time they had in Rome but always comment on the hotel as above. A bittersweet experience for the trip or my mothers dream; courtesy of Boscolos Exedra, Rome and 2 very P***ed off sisters who paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic 50th Birthday Break for 4 days.”
Reviews.Author: daisyhall
Reviews.Content: We booked Boscolo Exedra for my 50th Birthday as we were very excited to see the picture of this stunning hotel in the brochure. We thought this hotel was striking because the shape of this hotel and the beautiful fountain at the front of the Piazza de Republic. The concierge was absolutely beautiful a wow factor when we arrived we were greeted by a lovely gentleman called Salvatoire at the concierge desk who later helped us with many queries every day apart from the last day. We had a fabulous bedroom the Classic room huge Queen size bed , lovely opulent decor marble bedside tables full minibar and lovely marble bathroom. Flowers were ordered as a surpriseby my husband arrived at the same time as we entered the room. We had a good size room and fund everything to be immaculate. We had a great location as the Metro and bus terminal was in easy reach. The main road takes you to the fantastic White Palace the "Wedding Cake" at the Palazzo Venezia.Colosseum is on the left rearside of this palace. We were extremely disappointed the next day that we had to have breakfast on the terrace restaurant as in the brochure it was indicated we were in a beautiful restaurant in the 1st floor. We were not informed about this. However we did enjoy the lovely breakfast selection until the Saturday morning when there were new waiting staff serving.We had cold cooked food and confusion with our menus wrong food was cooked and we waited almost 45 minutes before food arrived it was quite cool on the terrace in the morning and tablecloths were stained. Milk was the main probelm with our teas waiting staff appeared to not understand we need milk with English tea. The evening after sightseeing we would come back to the bedrooms to have a shower/bath and found the hot water tap ran warm water even after filling the bath we still found the water was cold which was not good either. This was a bit disappointing especially when we have spent money for 5 star service for luxury we didn't feel the breakfast deserved 5 satr status maybe 3 star! We made a formal complaint to the manager called Clare who was very nice and the problem was rectified and a letter of apology was sent to our room that day. We did have a fabulous service from the concierge gentleman called Salvatoire who was courteous, kind and very, very helpful towards helping us with a vase for my flowers and organising times for us with transport to airport and directions. He deserves a gold star.I had a sealed letter with wax sent to our door to confirm times and he organised everything we asked of him. On our last day in Rome we had a fantastic meal in the Tazio restaurant 4 courses of various choices and it was a gourmet delight very generous portions the chef deserved Michelin star. Thoroughly recommend everyone tries the food here fine dining excellent ambiance and we were the last to leave had a lovely chat to Mario the head waiter/manager there which sealed our approval and rounded off my birthday perfectly. We managed to see everything we wanted in Rome and we enjoyed our stay at the Exedra very much the staff were lovely and very helpful and kind and took to our complaints very seriously which is all we can ask if you stay 5 star. Thank you Exedra for a lovely stay. A personal thank you to Salvatoire too for all your kind help. Andrew and Maggie

Reviews.Title: “Great location but terrible internet access”
Reviews.Author: Rydel100
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 8 nights at this hotel for both a conference and to celebrate my husband's 50th birthday. The location was fantastic - easy walking distance to many tourist attractions and public transport directly outside. From the exterior of the hotel it looked very luxurious - as did the and lobby area. The breakfast was very good and most staff (especially the concierge) were very helpful. However, our room was very dark and didn't let in much light. When we asked to change rooms, another room was found that was slightly lighter but also much smaller. I would have expected that as we were staying there for 8 nights and they knew we were celebrating a special birthday, that they would have attempted to give us a nicer room. We spoke to other people staying for the conference for a shorter period of time that received a better quality of room. Overall I would say the rooms were quite average and not worth the price - they needed upgrading. Our TV hotel information wasn't working, and although we reported this twice, it wasn't repaired. Our shower also leaked quite badly and the airconditioning seemed to be on hot all the time, even when we turned it off - which made the room very stuffy and difficult to sleep in. The main issue with the hotel was the free wireless internet access. It was incredibly slow and constantly dropped out. It was very frustrating. We eventually found that access was best on the 5th floor away from the street side. We have since stayed at two other hotels in Italy which were at least half the price, but double the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: HammadHassan
Reviews.Content: The best thing is the location of this hotel. In the sqare near main Termini and accessable to all nearby attractions. The hotel was good as well. But not that luxerious as per its 5 start status.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in Rome's Crown”
Reviews.Author: devviebabe
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights there, running a workshop for two days and stayed on for the Rugby! Hotel looks fabulous...largely all good...service a little slow at times, but friendly staff. Meeting room fascinating in that the floor is made of glass to expose the archaeological diggings below. Bar shuts a bit early (midnight) and "you'll have to get it off room service...in the room...doesn't quite work for a party of eight! however a quiet word with reception conjured up a night manager who bought champagne to the hotel foyer, which did the trick. Breakfast a bit hit and miss with service...food offering was great, but staff a bit tetchy when one asked for more coffee or toast. Free wi-fi but you have to log in afresh everytime you close the iPad...very annoying. First time it snowed in Rome for 30+ years as every taxi driver told us...managed to watch the rugby nevertheless

Reviews.Title: “Central location, 4 star overall”
Reviews.Author: SouthernGeordie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short walk from Termini train station and is located at the top of the Via Nationale. We stayed 3 nights and had 2 interconnecting rooms. Our rooms were fab: spacious (our double was L shaped and included a small dedicated office area), our son had a twin room which was equally large, the beds were really comfortable, decor was good, and the rooms were very clean. The bathrooms were on the small side but totally fine. We did have a bit of walk to get to our room but the standard of the rooms made up for it. The consierge Salvatore was fantasticly helpful and really made our stay special - he helped out with dining suggestions, was able to get us football ticket for the same night (not an easy task) and was a generally all round lovely guy. Breakfast was included in our package - through BA and just as well - you wouldn't want to pay €35 per person. Breakfast was a bit hit and miss - our first morning we'd invited 2 people to join us only to be told 'the kitchen is not working today!' We helped ourselves to the cold buffet of meats, bread, fruit etc but beware that as soon as something has gone it isn't replaced. The hostess is a little frosty and hasn't got a great grasp of English. The waiting staff are more pleasant but not brilliantly attentive. We did manage to get cooked breakfasts on the days following but they weren't great, everything was very oily and looked nothing like the photos in the menu - with pancakes/muffins missing from a breakfast showing bacon eggs and muffins! The Full English: eggs potatoes and sausages had only the one thumb sized sausage! The experience would be greatly improved if you could help yourself to more fruit juice and coffee or tea instead of waiting to flag someone down. We chose not to eat any other meals at this hotel based on our breakfast experiences. Note there is also a €3 per person per night tax payable at the hotel. So overall 4 stars based on some aspects being brill and others being decidedly average - however we would stay again happily.

Reviews.Title: “Theatre of Absurd”
Reviews.Author: SNGV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Exedra with colleagues for a conference. Needless to say that I had quite some expectations, and was looking forward to staying at this 5 star posh hotel in the heart of Rome. But there were so many absurdities about this hotel that my experience with it appears to be quite confusing. The room was absolutely clean. The sheets and towels and gowns were changed every day. I was never disturbed in the room (unlike in other hotels, when personnel tries to fill the minibar or clean the room). Sleep quality was also not bad. The air conditioner was a bit noisy, but it did not interrupt the sleep. The things that I found to be absolutely absurd about the room are: In the bathroom of my room there was a standard set of toiletries including facial soap, shampoo, bath foam and bath salt, etc. The question is: why would anyone need bath foam and a bath salt in a SHOWER? The shower was leaking by the way, and every time after a shower I had a pool of water in the bathroom. There was also a crack in the shower tub. There was not waste basket in the bathroom, only one in the room. Needless to say that it is a bit awkward and inconvenient to use the room waste basket for all the trash. The hairdryer: the room was supposed to have an installed hairdryer (on the bathroom wall there was a part of an old hairdryer, the one that is normally stuck to the wall). However there was a regular travel size hairdryer instead. The problem with it was that it did not fit the size of the socket. And it was quite a challenge to plug it in every day (for some reason the cleaning lady was pulling out every day as well). I had to repeat this exercise a few time and it was quite annoying. When I needed to call the reception it took me a few attempts. I would normally expect that in a 5 star hotel someone would always pick up the phone if you need help. The food was also good. But for my liking there were way too many sweets. I guess their food would have benefitted if they provided more meets and less pastry. During breakfast they would offer you a variety of breakfasts (English, American, continental, etc.). But then the some of the staff do not speak English good enough to understand what you are ordering. The Breakfast also has a buffet. I would say that the variety of food in the buffet is good for a 3 or maximum 4 star hotel. But not impressive for a 5 star. Anyway the food was good and you would not leave hungry. One thing that struck me (in a positive way) is that when we were trying to call taxi from the hotel to the airport, concierge first offered us an option with the hotel car (some luxurious sedans) and voiced the price to us strait away (EUR 55). (A side note: in Rome a standard taxi rate from the hotel to the airport and vice versa is EUR 40). As in my experience hotels would most often just give you their own car and then overcharge you for the ride, I was pleasantly surprised that I was warned about the price and was offered an option of hotel car and official taxi. I guess any traveler would appreciate it if he/she is not being taken advantage of. As to their conference (convention) center: The hotel has a number of conference rooms and halls located in the basement. It seems impressive how the hotel has preserved the basement and the fundament of the building. In some places you would find glass floors showing you specially lit results of diggings and ground works. The air-conditioner there however is a real pain. It makes a terrible peeping and squeaking sound. And without the air conditioner it gets really stuffy.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant ease”
Reviews.Author: Snootyroo
Reviews.Content: As you walk into this hotel there is a definate feeling of style and elegance! The furnishings are all of the highest standard and the ambience of the hotel is of calm! The rooms are beautiful , the bathrooms too with beautiful robes and towels!the front desk and concierge were very helpful and polite and it was very easy to walk from the hotel to several places of interest and also to get a taxi within a couple of minutes, The downside was there was no indoor pool and the spa only had a jacuzzi and Turkish bath which you had to make an appointment for! Also, the catering , although we only had breakfast, was lacking in atmosphere and momentum! However, we would definitely return on a bed and breakfast deal as the hotel itself was gorgeous and in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “5-star in need of à review on custom relationship”
Reviews.Author: SaladaVerde
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. The rooms are of good size with high ceilings. The rooms faci g the streets are very noisy, so choose à room towards the inner courts. Breakfast in My opinion had little choice of fresh fruits.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful stay”
Reviews.Author: Babydoll03
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very imposant from the moment you walk in in the lobby. Friendly and helpful staff at the reception and concierge desk. Room very nice, spacious, clean and practical decorated. Rome is very busy at this time of the year so we went daily to the pool, so nice and refreshing, all the way on the roof top. Although this is a city trip destination, it is still Italy so the roof is a perfect getaway when there's a moment you have enough of this so busy city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting in a fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: scottyland
Reviews.Content: Fantastic, central location in an impressive looking building. Lots of restaurants and bars scattered around the area of the hotel which migh make a nice diversion from paying 12euros for a bottle of beer in the hotel! If you go down the basement level then you can see some old Roman street ruins through a glass floor. Nice touch. Made for a memorable meeting environment. Very clean rooms which got serivced at least twice a day. Wifi codes available when you check in and the business centre staff are also very helpful. i was on the annex of the second floor which had a terrible view of the back car park, so if a room with a view is important to you then make sure you enquire first.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: acro1000
Reviews.Content: If you want to go to Rome to sight see, you need to think about location , and this is it at the Piazza de Republicca . Very good location and many sight seeing locations all in walking distance ( 1 - 5 km ) . Even the night clubs , restaurants and cafes were just around the corner . We stayed for 2 days only but had a very pleasant stay . THe only problem I have with this hotel is , some rooms have absolutely no view at all and if you don't see the room before hand you could end up with a bad view . Its always a fine line between a good holiday and these small things that kill the experience. But if all goes your way , you will be happy with this hotel . Good Food too , never a problem in Rome .

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: sapamire
Reviews.Content: We won a trip that included a five night stay here. When I walked in, I thought "Boy, this place is really fancy and nice." It really was. Here are the pluses and minuses of the hotel. Pluses Location is remarkable. It is right off the Republica subway and right across the street from the bus stop. It is also very close to the Termini station where you can catch regional trains to visit other areas of Italy. Our rooms had a balcony and were very spacious. Housekeeping did an excellent job keeping the room very tidy. The hotel roof had a swimming pool, albeit it was essentially a lap pool. It also had a bar and restaurant up there. But it is very expensive- $10 sodas. Although one of the concierge staff seemed like he had a stick up his butt, once you chatted with him, he was very helpful. They were helpful to give you directions or to make reservations for you. They had a fitness center that was minimal, but sufficient enough to get the job done. If you are willing to walk, we walked to the Colliseum and Spanish Steps. One day we walked back from the Vatican. It is a long walk, but if you like to roam around, it is very doable. If not, the subway or bus can take you to all the major places. Minuses It is pricey. If you stay here, you will pay good money for this place. If you did not get the breakfast included with your room, you will pay a lot for breakfast. However, the buffet was very good for a European country. The traditional American breakfast was not that good - the kids ordered them. But when in Europe, eat like a European. The shower had a half glass. So when you showered, water splashed everywhere on the floor. I think if the price does not bother you, then I would recommend this place. The location and amenities are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Until The Last Night”
Reviews.Author: NavyAllan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a very nice 5 Star located in a great safe location close to everything. We selected the hotel through United Vacations. The rate was good and included breakfast. The hotel had easy access to all points of Rome. Only 20 minute walk to the Forum and Coliseum. There is a metro stop is located just outside the hotel. The hotel lobby was impressive and the front desk and other hotel staff we found were very customer orientated especially a woman named Olga the Customer Relations Specialist. The night we checked-in I told Olga and the staff at the front desk it was my birthday and within an hour after we checked-in the hotel brought me a birthday cake to our room. That was a first for me and a very “Nice un-expected touch” to great customer service. The room we had was an upgraded room. They gave us an upgrade at a very good price. It was large, nice and clean. We were on the 4th floor with a great view of the fountain. All places to eat and see recommended by the hotel were good. They made all our dining reservations and gave great touring recommendations. The interior of the room was very nice with a massive comfortable bed. It have everything we look for in a nice well equipped 5 star hotel room except an alarm clock, iron and ironing board for light pressing and coffee maker or hot water kettle. Also there was a turn down service at night but no chocolate was left on the pillows. We missed that touch. The TV channels were limited and bad just like all other hotels in Europe. It had only 4 to 5 English speaking channels including CNN International, Sky and BBC that gets old real fast. The internet was being changed over to wireless so we had to go to the 1st floor or lobby to get access to the internet. Business Center/VIP Lounge located on the 1st floor has computers and printers for printing out boarding passes. No charge if you don’t print more than 10 or so pages. The breakfast was OK but not great. It had a limited breakfast menu. The hot food was ordered off the menu not buffet style. It took only a few minutes to get our hot food. All fruits cold meats and breads were offered in the typical buffet style. The restaurant staff was polite and very customer orientated. The only negative experience we encounter was our last night in the hotel. There was a party or something going on the 5th floor of the hotel. The music was very loud and annoying. The bass vibrated throughout our room rattling the pictures on the wall making it impossible to sleep. It started around 9:30 PM and lasted to 12:00 AM. We called the front desk twice. Once @ 11:00 PM and were told it would quit within 5 minutes. It didn’t. We called again around 11:20 and were told they were going upstairs to investigate why the music was still playing. It quit close to 12:00 AM. We didn’t expect this type of noise problem in a 5 star hotel. We loved the hotel, location and staff but due to the loud noise problem on our last night in the room we would have to rethink staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, poor value for money..”
Reviews.Author: T1m-L1z
Reviews.Content: Excellent central location with all main attractions within (comfortable) walking distance. Taxi's are also easily available immediately outside hotel. Really nice building, with this extending to the inside, with the decor and especially high bedroom ceilings giving the 'grande' feeling. We found the staff OK, although the dining experience was considerably short of the mark you would reasonably expect for the country, let lone the expensive tariff. Internet in the bedroom was only via cable and for a hefty charge (20 eur per day), alternatively in the VIP lounge there was free WiFi which worked well although sometimes was very busy with limited space.. Best about the hotel was definitely the location, and the (external) appearance, with almost everything else coming up way short of the billing. I stayed there on a business travel for business in the hotel , i would consider staying again, although not on my private spend!

Reviews.Title: “luxury hotel,”
Reviews.Author: jillmr
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an Impressive interior, we had a great room with a massive comfortable bed. Good location, the metro is just outside, handy if it is raining. We only had breakfast at this hotel, the food was very good but the staff were not very flexible with set breakfast menus. Nice hotel and room but overall it lacked personal touch.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh luxury, foul service, good location”
Reviews.Author: TrophyCollector
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the Boscolo Exedra because it was the official hotel of a charity event. The overall appearance is that of a good luxury hotel alternative in Rome. For example, the arrival area and the lobby have a certain grandezza. Architecture and decor are fresh and new everywhere, especially given we are in Italy where one must prepare for a lot of dust and deranged furniture even in "the best" hotels. I liked the roof top pool and bar and even the outside arcade cafe, being a cigar smoker. However the overall positive impression was seriously affected by the lazy and arrogant staff, even though I was prepared for low service standards in Rome, which has become one gigantic tourist trap (has it become worse? I had the feeling.) I am not willing to educate the staff through tips or threats, especially if I am only there for a night, so I will not return to this hotel. On the positive side, the location is perfectly in the centre and 200m from the train station without the touts and bad crowds visible. If you arrive by train this is the most convenient luxury hotel in town. Also makes sense rom Fiumicino airport which can be more than 1 hour by taxi and at least 60 Euro away from Rome Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Recent visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Valerie D
Reviews.Content: The Exedra is very centrally located - we stayed there last month (October). Beautiful decor, large rooms and looks opulent. The service however is extremely poor. We had to wait over an hour to be served a meal in the restaurant that was not busy; we had to ask for the room to be cleaned as they had forgotten to do so; the following day the room was cleaned but with no towels or toiletries; the reception staff were elegantly turned out but oh, so uninterested! We will be visiting Rome again but I don't think we will be staying at the Exedra ever again. Disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “Good, centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: rdadd33
Reviews.Content: The Boscolo is a good hotel with good food (but expensive). There are several "family" restaurants in the area with excellent food at reasonable prices. The hotel is centrally located, near the main Rome transportation hub, for both buses, trains, and taxies. There is also a Metro (subway) station at the hotel entrance. A walking tour of the main sites in Rome is possible if you like to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - but too expensive to eat or drink at.”
Reviews.Author: pgtv
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal through Expedia for rooms that on the day would cost £350 for just £150. The hotel wanted 35 Euros for breakfast, but next door is McDonald's. This McDonald's has proper coffee making machinery and fresh croissants. Breakfast for five was just 20 Euros. Rooms were enormous. Hotel is central. Hires a scooter from behind the building for 40 Euros for 24 hours. Fantastic way to see the city, all dolce vita.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: LOVE2TRAVELERS
Reviews.Content: Had spotted this hotel on a prior visit and told ourselves our next stay in Rome should be at the Boscolo Exedra. GREAT location in the heart of Rome but away from the Colosseum. If you can get a room on a higher floor with the view of the fountain in front, it's great! Staff all dressed in black looked more like sercret service, but very helpful and courteous. Concierge was great with recommandations. Rooftop pool is tiny and prices outrageous! With a few children in & around the pool, feels more like a playground than a relaxing terrasse. Rooms classic, very old school look. We stayed at the Boscolo in Milan and it was VERY different! But loved the very spacious room and bathroom with double sink!!! Rare commodity in Europe!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Ernesto A
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located at just a few steps from the Train & Sub stations, and while it may be perceived as a "Las Vegas Sized" hotel, our stay here was great and very pleasant. We did no use any of the food or business service on our stay, and cannot imply any good or bad things about them. Rooms are huge, with lots of space (Although very old TV's) to relax after a long walking day in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Totally overpriced though nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nadineabc
Reviews.Content: So the hotel is fine- its actually a pretty nice, grand looking hotel. We had paid extra for a bigger room with a balcony and view of the fountain, in total around 320E/night, but having seen one of the smaller rooms it was certainly not worth the upgrade (.... you also cant really open the windows anyway since the outside traffic is too noisy). The room was nicely decorated, comfortable, huge and with a great bathroom with 2 sinks, a bath and a shower. The service was fine- pleasant staff and a wonderful concierge, Salvatore, who made some brilliant recommendations and bookings for us. The location is pretty good too, you can get to many of the attractions on foot or getting a cab is easy. Its also near the station. However, for your 320E a night you dont get much else! Breakfast was 35 E pp and not included. We only wanted coffee and since there were no facilities in the room for coffee we had simple/bad black filter coffee in the breakfast room.... unbelievably it cost 5 E pp!!! It wasn't even a latte!!! Although there is some free wifi in some areas of the hotel to use in the room was really costly. The pool bar area was closed at least one of the nights we were there, for a private function, so we couldn't enter it. Drinks in the downstairs bar were consistently over-priced, in keeping with our experience of the hotel. If you get good rates its probably worth a trip. But its nothing out of the ordinary and while it may be a 5 star hotel, for what you get it felt like 6 star prices!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Shehina
Reviews.Content: Breathtaking hotel, in a good location and with wonderful rooms! :) I felt great there and I warmly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fab base for visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: gingping
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome for three nights with my Dad and choose to stay at the Exedra after finding a deal on Expedia. We were not disappointed with our choice. The hotel itself was superb, fantastic location and both the public areas and the room were grand and very well kept. The staff seemed very friendly and we were given some local information at the concierge desk. At 8am after the first night, we were awoken by drilling and banging, after 10 mins of continual noise I called reception who said they would investigate. They called back and informed me that som building works outside the hotel was taking place. After another 20 minutes the noise had gotten louder and being pretty sure that it was in fact coming from inside the hotel, I called back down to reception where this time I was told that they were carrying out a refurb in one of the rooms above ours and that the noise would stop in 20 mins..... It did not. I then went down to reception where the FOH manager apologised and said we could move rooms. As he said that they would not carry out works at this time in the morning again I said I did not want the hassle of moving rooms but I having had the first night of the stay disrupted I asked that they look into what they could do about it and the chap said he would speak to his manager and get back to me. I did not hear anything more from them on the matter and as the next two nights were un interrupted I did not chase them up. This was the only bad thing we experienced during our stay, but didn't expect this from a five star hotel. Having said that my dad is desperate to go back to this amazing city and I think we would stay at the Exedra again, despite the noise issue as it is such a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location, Hotel and Decor”
Reviews.Author: sleeplessINct
Reviews.Content: We spent our last night of our honeymoon in this hotel. Just one night - but it was worth it! The room was HUGE - ceilings that reached to the skies and a great view of the fountain. I agree with the others - stay away from the minibar - and again, why would you wanna eat anything from the bar anyways?! YOU ARE IN ROME, PEOPLE! EAT OUT! Thanks for a great stay and superior service!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer_2012_travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Exedra for 5 nights in Sept 2011. The hotel common rooms and guest rooms definitely had a luxurious feel. Our room was big we loved the high, sloping wood beamed ceiling. Very clean. Only complaints were that there was no clock in the room and that WiFi was expensive, but you can use the nice business center downstairs. The rooftop pool was wonderful (though it is hard to find through a set of unmarked glass doors) and so was the very good breakfast in the morning. However, I probably would have not eaten breakfast here if I had not been getting it for free because it was way too expensive, even for as nice as it was. The hotel was in a convenient location for getting around. My main complaint about the hotel was the poor service by the staff at the front desk and the concierge desk. For such a high end luxury hotel, I expected so much more. The concierge desk only suggested big touristy restaurants and tour groups (that seemed to clearly be linked to the hotel) and were not so helpful if you were not interested in that. The front desk staff was just cold. You always got the sense you were bothering them. Also, we arrived after a long international flight and they could not even check us in an hourearly. I know this is in part a function availability, but for all the traveling I have done, most nice hotels can get you in a little early. And at least try, which I did not think the front desk did.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL, NOT SO NICE STAFF”
Reviews.Author: Girlie410
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well kept. It's also in walking distance of buses and train station. Rooms were very nice and very quiet except for the party they had at the pool and the music was way too loud. The staff wasn't very nice though. They expected a tip everytime you looked at them or they wouldn't help you. Very arrogant concierge staff. They wouldn't even help me locate a mailboxes etc or shipping location. They wanted me to use their high price courier service. Wifi only worked in the guest computer area. We needed to use their computers one night and the room was closed to a private function. They made no other accomodations to help us.Breakfast was included in our stay and it was very nice, but the wait staff was also not very friendly. They took forever to take your order and they would talk about the other guests in Italian while they were still sitting there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice luxury hotel, attention to detail to improve”
Reviews.Author: Sito_Journey
Reviews.Content: The 19th century building housing the Boscolo Exedra Hotel is beautiful and so is the surrounding area. Overall the location is also good and one can walk to many of Rome's great monuments. During our stay we found the breakfast to be very good with both the buffet and ala carte items on the menu being a mixture of international and italian style food. On the weekened we were there the breakfast was served in a semi open area on the top floor of the hotel which made it nice but unfortunately the buffet food attracted quite a few wasps which took a particular liking to some of the meats on it. This part was obviously not a good point. The pool which is located on the top floor is nice but relatively small, I guess on a hot summer day it can be refreshing. Overall facilities in the common areas of the hotel were fine and staff were generally nice. Room wise we liked the size of the junior suite we stayed in, we found it generous and one of the largest we stayed in. The bed was comfortable and we liked the pillows, for some reason a lot of hotels rooms we stay in come with very soft pillows which sometimes feel like you are sleeping on a thin fabric and not on a pillow. Internet in the room was available only through a wire connection, unlike most luxury hotels today (at least in Asia) where rooms have a wireless connection. Internet connection in the business center is free and there are two computers there also with free access which is good but the connection was interupted while I was there using one of the computers. During our stay also there was an issue with hot water and we received a note in our room to advise us of this. We had to have a couple of showers with inadequate hot water. Overall we found Boscolo Exedra to be a nice luxury hotel but for the price it demands for the type of room we stayed in, it needs to improve a few things. This is especially relevant if the traveller is from Asia where 5 star luxury hotels usually provide great facilities and service at this price point.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: vastjourney
Reviews.Content: Travel with children often entails swimming, at least for us. It was especially important, then, to find a hotel with a pool. We knew that our Roman holiday would involve long walks through hot, hilly streets and winding up the day with a swim would be appreciated. This led us to the Hotel Exedra, one of the few hotels in Rome with a swimming pool. Perched on the rooftop, the pool is not a large one, but pleasant, with a sensational view of the city. A nice surprise: take the elevator to the basement. As you exit, you will find yourself standing on a glass floor, above the ancient Baths of Diocletian. The hotel is conveniently located, near Termini train station. A subway is just down the street as well. This is a spectacularly beautiful hotel; the photos on its web site do not lie. I did find it slightly cold, however, without many comfortable lounge areas. Nevertheless, one does not travel to Rome to lounge in a hotel lobby and this establishment is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasctic hotel, brilliant location, be careful of hidden charges though”
Reviews.Author: adeelakhan
Reviews.Content: we spent 4 nights in this hotel. Perfect location to get to all the tourist attractions walking or by taxi. The vatican city is a maximum of 40 mins walking and the walking is no chore. The cobbled winding streets to get there are beautiful and the time just flies by. The hotel is very luxurious, the decor exudes understated class. The staff are extremely helpful when it comes to local attractions and eating places and seem to have very good knowledge of all the intricacies of the city. However, we would say to be careful of hidden charges and make sure you ask if this is included in the original room price. An example of this is ironing, the hotel does not lend out irons, but provide a laundry service for this. One assumes this is free if health and safety regulations do not permiss service of iron to the clients room. On checkout we realised there was a charge of 9 euros per item of clothing ironed!. Apart from this we were very happy with the hotel. Make sure you visit the roof top swimming pool as the views are lovely. Overall, well located, luxourioius, "make you feel special" hotel. Would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbunti
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights on a tour. Very nice room and bed. Shower is on the small side. Our room had a view of the A/C unit and was very quiet. Never found the pool. Very nice breakfast. Did not have any other meals at the hotel. No Iron in room, only services.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel, just watch out for the extras.”
Reviews.Author: Wozza2404
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a romantic weekend, and even with a last minute "bargain rate" deal, it was still well over £500 for two nights... A lot to live up to. The room was stunning. No other word for it. Spacious, marble bathroom. Huge bed. Big chairs. Nice view out over 'real' backstreet Rome. Electronic mini bar, where a bottle of Coke will cost you a fairly reasonable... Hang on... Surely that doesn't say... Wow... Yep, a bottle of Coke in the hotel mini bar... £7. Same for a bottle of water. £8 for a beer. Suffice it to say, we didn't touch the mini bar. I also steered clear of the Room Service menu, as despite the fact the food sounded lovely, there were no prices in the menu. You know what they say, "if you have to ask..." Staff at the hotel, however, were excellent. I know people have had bad things to say about them on here, but they were nothing but pleasant to my wife and myself. Granted they are Italian, and therefore naturally a little aloof, but (and this may shock some of you) Rome is in Italy. On check in, I requested a price for a late check out on our day of departure, and the very helpful gentleman informed me that whilst a 3pm check out (as I'd asked for) would be charged, he could offer us a 2pm check out free of charge. A nice surprise. The hotel itself is in the perfect place. Surrounded by history, bars, cafes, shopping, and within walking distance of the Colloseum, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, Forum, etc. etc. The Vatican City is an 8EUR taxi ride away. In a nutshell: Stay here, enjoy the opulence, but don't touch the mini bar and eat whilst you're out and about - But then again, why would you want to eat in the hotel when you could be eating next to the Trevi Fountain?

Reviews.Title: “Bestes Hotel in Rom!!!”
Reviews.Author: anique1337
Reviews.Content: Schon von aussen sehr beeindruckend und wenn man erst einmal in die Zimmer kommt, weiss man, dass man in einem Palast ist! Unbedingt ein Zimmer zum Piazza hin nehmen, die Zimmer zur anderen Seite sollen sehr klein sein. Wir hatten insg. 3 Zimmer, alle zur Piazza raus und diese waren wunderbar gross und schick und hatten unglaublich bequeme Betten. Auch der Service im Hotel war sehr gut, alle Mitarbeiter waren sehr bemüht und nett! Einziger kritikpunkt: Der Pool auf dem Dach ist kleiner als er auf den Fotos scheint aber dennoch ein Hingucker. Vom Pool aus schaut man auf die Piazza Venezia mit dem Monumento Vittorio Emanuele II. Traumhaft! Die Lage des Hotels ist top! Man kann zu Fuss zur Piazza Venezia gehen und dort fängt auch die Einkaufsstrasse Via del Corso an, die man dann bis zum Piazza del Popolo hochlaufen kann. Insgesamt würde ich das Hotel absolut empfehlen! Es wird seinen 5 Sternen gerecht!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: daniele_n
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Exedra in July for 3 days before a cruise. It was a very nice hotel and our room was large, especially for the European standard. The staff was welcoming and very friendly. We had breakfast included every day as part of our package. The restaurant and bar downstairs are very pricey (18 euro for a drink?). However, the location is superb. We could walk everywhere from here and find our way easily back to the hotel. Something odd was that there is a group of homeless people who set up camp each night right outside the pricey outdoor bar. Having my 18 Euro drink while watching a bunch of homeless people set up their cardboard beds is beyond surreal. Hotel was pricey but we were on a fabulous trip and didn't really mind too much. I am sure you can get something a little less expensive but check room size.

Reviews.Title: “Excedra A let down”
Reviews.Author: RUFFEE
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel to have poor service. Let me start by saying a very wonderful clerk allowed us to place bags early before check in. Grazie. Upon check-in, bags took hours to be located. We booked to have rooftop restaurant, and closed for private event with no suggestions as to where one my find suitable alternative. Male concierge the worst. With long line, he walked a tpurist through entire guide book without ever recognizing he had guests with simple questions-obviously an ego loving the attention from telling his tales while we all walked away. Call front desk and no answer. What can I say? Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel & Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: monikam1977
Reviews.Content: Boscolo Exedra is a very impressive hotel. Our check-in was very quick, but the room they gave us must have been the smallest room ever with the view of the air conditioning units. We spoke to Adrianna at the front desk and she was very nice to give us a room with a balcony. It was a very beautiful and spacious room with a great view. The staff was very nice and was always willing to help. Its a beautiful luxury hotel..we would love to stay here again when we visit Rome next time.

Reviews.Title: “medium hotel for a five star ...!!!”
Reviews.Author: maninblackthe1
Reviews.Content: its a luxury hotel , but since arrival the receptionist even we arrived tired from travel they ere very rude and they did not give the room but after 2 hours and thy needed for each day stay a 100 euro insurance,,,!!! any way the room is ok breakfast is ok in total although no wide varieties for a 5 star hotel ,,,,!!1 in total i give it max 12 over 20 rate....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Upscale, But Caters to Business Clients”
Reviews.Author: Katie N
Reviews.Content: My good friend and I stayed at the Exedra for a week in Rome and, while we found the hotel itself just as beautiful as it was depicted on its website, the staff seemed always to be preoccupied by some more important matter, regardless of whether we needed a restaurant recommendation, a cab or to find out whether the pool was open. It's the kind of hotel that every time we walked in the door, there would be a table set up with name tags and directions for whatever conference was being hosted there that day. We just got the feeling, we weren't the "important" guests. Several times, at the hotel restaurant, we had to go inside to find a waiter to order drinks. Huh? It's kind of a place to be for certain people, but since the management doesn't charge mere mortals any less for their rooms - it's kind of a bummer to be ignored by the cocktail waitresses and the people behind the desk. That being said, the rooms were quite lovely and the hotel is nicely situated.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the Location”
Reviews.Author: zgabster
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights with my wife & we loved it. Silk dressed walls, extra comfort KING bed & deluxe bath (-: I highly recommend this hotel for romantic getaways (mind you the roof top pool was smaller than my tub).

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MozandCaz
Reviews.Content: Good location. Don't eat or drink anything in the hotel, ridiculous prices. We ate out for every meal, even breakfast. Rooms very comfortable. Pool huge disappointment, more like a bath!

Reviews.Title: “Opulent accomodations, acceptable service/ammenities, conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: jwfromSF
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Boscolo Exedra for two nights. The desk staff was courteous if not solicitous.The room was large, clean and very well appointed. Neither ice makers on our floor was functioning but otherwise everything at the facility was very serviceable. The hotel is a five to 10 minute walk to the Rome Termini and a Metro station is literally steps away from the front door (Republica stop on the metro A line). The immediate area around Termini is a bit sketchy but the immediate area around the Boscolo felt safe and enjoyed a lot of foot traffic even late into the night. The hotel has a pool but the hours were impractically short (10AM to 6PM). The charge of 20 euros for 24 hours of internet access seemed excessive. I did not opt for the 22 euro breakfasts nor did I try the hotel restaurant. There are many good trattorias and pizzerias nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good, not perfect”
Reviews.Author: cac1005
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel hours before check in, and despite having beentold that we would be able to check in early front desk would have no hearing of us checkingin a minute before the actual check in time. What was more frustrating is that they kept telling us, "maybe soon..." so, because we were exhausted from our flight, we waited in the lobby. Had we known they were actually going to check us in late (because they allowed the guest in our room to check out late), we would have found a better way to spend out first day in Rome. Some staff were excellent however, some staff behaved as if they were perfectly aware that they were doing a service to you by being there. The hotel was very nice. Our room was small, with a view of a wall, and other than it making the room appear to be very dar, it was very typical of they city and we did not have any complaints about either. The lobby and food were nice and the location was ideal. Getting to and taking the termini was very easy, and there were enough shops nearby that we didnt have to go far for anythignwe needed. It was clean, and comfortable, andI would stay again, but would hope that they could work a little with some of the staff on their service.

Reviews.Title: “Most beautiful hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: DuraMater
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome on a business trip but brought the family along. The Boscolo Exedra was not only very beautiful, it was very conveniently located to the Metro and train station so getting around the city and the country was EASY! The Concierge's were incredibly helpful and gave us great directions. The only negative was noisy park across the street. We wanted to keep our window open during the night, but there was just too much activity going on over there. Luckily, all that was drowned out by closing the window.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely looking hotel, badly let down by staff”
Reviews.Author: jumbobum
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the hotel was lovely. Initially the staff were very helpful. Got to the room with a view over looking the piazza & fountain. The room was clean & the bed was fresh & very comfortable but the wall coverings & carpets were very worn. The bathroom was clean but the bath, fittings & tiling were 'tired'. I asked for another room but on viewing this one, we decided to stay put. The second room had no window & was very hot with the air con not really effective. Everything at the hotel was very very expensive. I know Rome is an expensive place but we had very little trouble finding many many reasonably priced cafes & restaurants. Breakfast was £32.00 pppd. I looked in at breakfast & must admit I was none too impressed with the food on offer. There's no tea/coffee making facilities & no iron/ironing boards available, as Italian law 'apparently' states this as being too dangerous for visitors to use. It cost £17.50 to get 1 of my wife's dresses ironed! Tea & coffee from room service is around £7.00 pp. We took a travel kettle but forgot the adapter & the hotel would not supply one to us. A small beer costs around £11.00 in all the hotel bars & a basic salad in the cafe bar outside is around £30.00. It's really difficult to rate the hotel, as the building is beautiful, the rooms although a little tired are very large & the bed we had was fabulous. I should say it's a 5* building, with 4* rooms & 2-3* staff. However, this took nothing away from the holiday overall. We had a fabulous time in the city, an open air museum with, on the whole, the people not being able to do enough for you & around every corner another fabulous surprise awaits you. Within a few minutes walk of the hotel there are many street vendors selling ice cold drinks, fresh fruit etc & along the Via Internatzionle there's a Spar shop selling most things. (NOT plug adapters though!) Do book as many tours as you want to go in advance if you can. Queing in that heat is pretty traumatic! We went for 4 days & can't wait to return sometime in the future. There is so much to see & do. Spending the evenings exploring the streets & piazzas, we felt vey safe & the atmosphere everywhere was fabulous. If you're thinking of going to Rome - DO!! But please, choose your hotel wisely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SaraG52525
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in July 2011 for eight nights and we loved it! Our room was super clean. Very friendly staff, nice lobby, nice and clean pool on the roof top. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant, but the menu looked really good. Small tip: if you don't want to pay 12 euros for a bottle of Heineken on the roof top while sun basing, bring your own refreshments. They wouldn't mind.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: TashaCupcake
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in lovely location, good rooms and facilties and very friendly staff. Personally I wouldn't have paid the £250 a night but as it was our honeymoon my husband spoiled us. Roof top swimming pool, lovely day spas, and lively and vibrant square.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: bmoruzzi
Reviews.Content: We were able to check in early which was fantastic and the hotel is very impressive looking from the outside. Inside there is a nice sitting area with A/C and a restaurant/bar. We never ordered any food or drinks from the hotel as the prices were outrageous. It was 7 euro for a coke. When we got to our room we weren't as impressed. The hallway leading to our room was extremely dark. Inside the room, we had a window with no view (or a view of the wall with a skylight) where we couldn't see anything. There was a hole in the sheets. The shower didn't work properly. We asked four times for someone to come look at the shower. It wasn't until the last time when I asked to switch rooms that someone finally came to fix it. The ice machine in the hall was also broken. When we asked for ice to be delivered to our room we first got ice in a bucket with bugs. The second time we asked for ice they said they didn't have any in the hotel. The TV was also broken. At first it wouldn't shut off so we had to unplug it from the wall. Then we couldn't switch the channels. Stay away from room 412. The pool on the roof deck was good to cool off after walking around the city all day in the 90 degree heat, but it was only 3 ft deep all the way across. So, you couldn't swim in it but it was good to just sit and relax in. Overall we were very surprised by this "5 star" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and the service. One of the best in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: mella2007
Reviews.Content: I honestly cannot understand some of the negative reviews about this property on TA. We stayed here for 2 nights and had an unbelievable time! Background: I chose this hotel after reading both good and bad reviews. As someone who doesnt believe many people that post 1 review and its a negative to their credit, I pushed on and booked the Boscolo and got an excellent rate through TA and Agoda. Location: The hotel is located in Piazza della Repubblica which is a safe and well populated part of town. Literally a 3 min walk from Termini Station and 5-7 mins in a cab to the Vatican, Trevi, Patheon and all the major sites. The open top Hop on/Hop off bus stop is a one min walk from the hotel and a great way to see the sights of Rome. We mainly used cabs to get around town (as the heat was stifiling at times!) and cost usually around 6 euro per time. Service: We arrived at 8am after a 24 hour trip. They were more than helpful and pleasant at reception, however couldnt give us our room on arrival due to a totally full hotel, however it was ready at 11am which was terrific. Concierge was one of the best I have ever had, with Salvatore proving an absolute highlight and pleasure. He lent us a mobile phone charger, walked us to ATM's, provided good choices of food and shopping and even organised sim card a short 2 min walk away. I would return for his service alone. Room: We had booked a Deluxe and also ended up with a balcony and view over the Piazza which was simply fantastic. So lovely to leave the balcony doors open for fresh air later on at night. We had two twin beds joined together and the beds were comfortable, however the pillows were quite flat and feather which i dont like. Room was very big, one of the largest in Rome and also had 2 comfy chairs and small coffee table, flat screen TV (which we didnt watch and all but one channel in Italian), a desk, area for luggage, mini bar, cupboard and spacious bathroom with separate bath and rain shower, toilet and bidet, 2 sinks and great lighting. Yes there is no tea/coffee facilities, but with so many things close by including their own cafe and McDonalds, it didnt bother me. Room Service: Had room service on one occasion of Pizza and a coffee...hot and delicious though the 10 euro room service charge was ridiculous. Hotel cafe/Bar: At there quite often and the service was the wait staff especially Evan was terrific. Lots of choice on the menus...lovely surprise was ordering coffee and getting complimentary cakes to go with it. Prices were good for euro standards and the atmosphere of comfortable chairs/tables and the view of the Piazza was great. DaySpa: Had organised a massage on the day of arrival for 10am. Arrived at 9:50am and told I was too early and to come back right on 10! Massage therapist was great, a really good way to ease the tension of the flight and for 60 euro for 1/2 hour, i thought it was excellent value. Pasquale even brought me espresso while I was waiting which was a nice touch. MiniBar: Had the usual choices and the prices were expensive as most minibars in good hotels, however the fridge was cold and there were no stuff ups on departure due to costs or anything. Lobby: was relaxing and really lovely feel to it. Very quiet and some magazines etc Porters were attentive and appreciated any sort of tip, though Concierge refused any tips saying it was their pleasure to help. Business Centre: 3 Acer computers in the Business Centre as well as magazines, refreshments. It was open to any guests and a nice big space. Pool Area: one of only 30 hotels in the Rome area with a pool, quite small but does the job and great views over the city. 8 or 9 lounge chairs, 2 lifeguards and also an area to sit and have drinks and the bar. It was on the rooftop and was never crowded which was great. Lifts: 4 lifts and always opened straight away. They are tiny however. Internet: No free Wifi, which many hotels in the world do charge for, however we had data on our sim cards which did the job. The internet access in the business centre was free so we could upload photos and print boarding passes etc. Problems: Our minibar wasnt working, however someone was sent up within 5 mins, as were requests for more towels etc. Service was always quick and never a problem. All in all, this is a high quality hotel (ask for a Balcony room) with excellent staff and a terrific Rome location. 5 star quality does vary throughout the world, however the building, amenities, ambience and room size are up with the best of them.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: roadrunnner7691
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a work event . The location is excellent for most of the main attractions, station bus and train and there is a metro connection right outside. The room was well furnished, the phone in our room didn't work and there was no facilities guide, no iron or ironing room either and the hotel charge €9 to iron one shirt, so be prepared. The appearance of the hotel is very nice but not a 5 star, 4 maximum. Breakfast was included for our stay, if this isn't included it can be quite expensive, so best get a inclusive deal. We had a problem on the first night, with the person in the next room, they came in and put their IPod on full with the door to the passage way left open and the noise was unbearable, as the phone in the room didn't work I had to get up get dressed and go down to reception to ask for security to go to the room, this took about 20 minutes and two trips to reception for myself. Whilst I was in Rome I thought I'd go to the Common Wealth War grave (CWWG) where a relative is buried, when I asked the concierge for directions, he didn't have any idea where it was and appeared to be unaware that there were even CWWG in the in the city. As I had a rough ideas from the map, I managed to find them myself. Internet connection is chargable Not impressed wtih the hotel and certainly wouldn't stay here if I was paying myself, the plus was the location

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Lovely Pool, service ok,”
Reviews.Author: Jamied78
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I went to Rome in June, I arranged this as a suprise for my girlfriend/ fiance. We booked in to a Deluxe room which had a fantastic balcony and view of Piazza Republica, the room was beautiful, large, airy, comfortable and had large double doors leading on to a small but beautiful balcony. Check in staff were very polite, friendly and helpful which is nice when you arrive after a long journey. Room service was pretty poor- had to call 4 times and wait over 1 hour to get someone to open our mini bar so we could have a cold drink....when they did come the fridge was like an oven and only cooled down enough on the last day....:)) not a huge problem but our room was not cheap so it should be fixed...i did say to them but again no one came to fix the problem. Apart from this the hotel was great...pool is an absolute life saver on a scorching Rome day...we have been 5 times to Rome to visit friends/family so were not out sight-seeing all the time...had the pool to ourselves most of the time. Barstaff/waiters on the roof bar were very nice/ professional and kept the prosecco flowing. All in all a great hotel. perfect location, service ok, 30 euros for breakfast is far too much and we never ate there...too many great restaurants to chosse from where qaulity will be much higher. But I definately reccomend this hotel and I would stay again - just hope the management sort out the few problems and it will be even better.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: RaulSlater
Reviews.Content: This is a grand hotel with all the expected services, room and bathroom size, and all amenities you would look for in a US location. However, you face the same problems with slow room service, lobby lineups, and perfunctory guest service. Thus, there is nothing realy wrong with this hotel, but you are not going to remember it. What you do get by staying here is the Metro station right outside your hotel entrance. I'm talking 10 feet away! And after the amount of walking you will do this is invaluable. By the way, across the street and around the corner, there is a gallery full of stores. Walk half way and there is an excellent coffee shop to start your day!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, location & room could be better.”
Reviews.Author: Jtlewis0808
Reviews.Content: I don't have the heart to gives this hotel 3 stars because it is so beautiful and because it does provide good service and amenities. I feel that the location is not great, but that is made up for by the fact that the Metro station is right outside the front door. Out room was not big at all (for the price) and and our view was terrible, but I am sure they have some beautiful rooms with great views, too. Overall this is a solid hotel and we were not unhappy with it, but I think we will try a different one when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of room amenities, impressive building”
Reviews.Author: LandmarkAmman
Reviews.Content: The building is beautiful. The location is good. No free wifi, wired is 20 euros per day for one computer. Breakfast is very expensive 35 euros a person. No affordable dining options. The TV was from prehistoric times with NO English channels, except BBC that only came on for a few hours. No coffee/tea machine in the room. No mini bar either. Mattress is good. Room was big. Bathroom was fine. Concierge service was erratic. One guy was excellent, two women were awful. A little noisy, but expected in a city like rome.

Reviews.Title: “luxurious, quiet and confortable”
Reviews.Author: stefano p
Reviews.Content: i think it's one of the best hotel you can choose in rome. it a five stars hotel but the price is reasonable and smaller than others.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Everything High End - Location, Services, Staff...!”
Reviews.Author: bigpawsCanada
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 days from April 6th to 11th 2011. We were there to attend a reward trip and celebrate our company’s success the previous year. This hotel was absolutely high end in every respect, the rooms were exquisite and luxurious, the staff incredibly accommodating, the location was ideal for anyone wanting to be central to all that is Rome. Everything was in walking distance, the Pathenon, Pizza d’Spanga, The Termini, the Trevi Fountain, Shopping, Trattatorias, Gelato café’s, even the metro/subway was right next door to the hotel and a single stop to get to the Spanish Steps! The food, café, and dinning were fantastic and you simply couldn’t find a better hotel in the heart of Rome. We’d stay there again in a heartbeat. Our only complaint is that the bed we had in our room was super firm (almost like sleeping on a board). We slept fine, but are not used to such a firm mattress. Didn't matter with all the jet lag and late nights, but just one of those things when it comes to hotel rooms. Perhaps other bed rooms are better than others etc. There is no question, you get what you pay for, and this establishment lives up to and exceeds expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Not great for business”
Reviews.Author: rjohns13
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a wonderful location, a metro stop at its steps takes you to where ever you want to go in Rome. Surrounded by many very good restaurants. Service in the hotel is only adequate. They bring you what you ask but you have to ask many times for things like another cup of coffee or hand towels. There will be no hot water in the morning, no water kettle in the room, no ice but they will bring some to you for a fee. Internet is NOT wireless in the room and they charge for each piece; laptop, ipad, iphone, etc. and they use the MAC address to do this with so you cannot get around it with a wireless bridge. NO real business facilities as far as printing, etc. So nice place, great location, but not easy to do business from.

Reviews.Title: “Way to overrated”
Reviews.Author: Johansen1163
Reviews.Content: The most positive to say about Boscolo Exedra is the location being in walking distance to the major sights and shopping areas, and that is pretty much it! We had to wait 2 hours to get our room even though is was mid afternoon before we arrived and the receptionist was arrogant and close to being rude. The room it self was ok and rather quiet apart from the sound of the aircon or what ever it was (as we had a room at the backside of the hotel), but this hotel is not 5 stars compared to other 5 star hotels. The breakfast was average and the service very slow.

Reviews.Title: “La Dolce Vita”
Reviews.Author: cruiserking
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boscolo Exedra and absolutely adored it. From the moment your cab pulls up and you walk under the lengthy canopy towards this stunning building you will feel like royalty. The lobby is sumptuous and elegant with high ceilings and soothing shades of cream and white upholstery on the comfortable sofas and chairs are very conducive to relaxation. Room: Our room was beautifully appointed with handsome striped wall paper, large bed, soft carpeting and a fabulous large bathroom with double vanities, separate shower and bathtub and every counter top beaming in slick, dazzling marble. Also the various shower and bath amenities soaps and shampoo were first class. The room was quite large for Europe and afforded the right amount of space to enjoy our little haven away from the busy streets of Rome. Outdoor Cafe: We took advantage of every opportunity to sip coffee from the gorgeous outdoor cafe that curves like a giant smile and faces the Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore. Here we enjoyed first class service, delicious cappucino and lovely cookies and pastries served on a three tiered tray. This is a wonderful spot to soak in the hustle and bustle of Rome, people watch and relax. Restaurants: We enjoyed dinner at Tazio on our final night and thought the food and service were absolutely top notch. From the amuse bouche to the delectable dessert it was an excellent meal. This is a great place to for lunch as well. The Ham and cheese with the crusts cut off was very memorable. There is another restaurant that serves breakfast. It is cool and inviting with sleek white marble walls and back lit photographs behind glass that glow in soothing tones throughout. The food here was quite tasty but I agree with another reviewer who mentioned the service as being disinterested. Concierge: Extremely helpful and knowledgeable. He took the time to offer us advice and tips and greeted us in a friendly manner when we walked by his desk throughout our stay. Rooftop Restaurant:: We only sipped drinks here but, the view of Rome is quite beautiful. It is a lovely and romantic spot to unwind before dinner at Tazio or on the town. We were only in Rome for two nights following a 17 day transatlantic voyage. With it's beautiful interiors, first class service and exquisite food the Boscolo Excedra was the highlight of our visit to Rome. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome it provides a wonderful oasis from a busy day of touring and every day at the Excedra was a tonic.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service- 1 Star is Too Many”
Reviews.Author: jschiff
Reviews.Content: The service was horrible. Whenever there was a problem the staff would dismiss it with a cursory answer that nothing could be done at the moment. Problems included: no hot water for over an hour ("nothing we can do about it"), no access to movies ("no engineers on duty"), had to call 'guest services' multiple times for the same request. They even tried to charge us 7 Euro for bringing up a pot of hot water!! The front desk gave us the most disdainful look when we asked to remove this charge from the bill. No wi-fi in the rooms, in what is supposedly a five star property.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: irivamon
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome at 7am and our originally booked room at another hotel was not going to be ready until 2pm. Tired and severely jet lagged, we were desperate for the first available room and the Exedra was the only one available. We were grateful for the room and the help, but was it worth the nearly $700 for that one night? Nope. The room itself was nice. High ceilings and a large window overlooking the busy Opera House area of Rome. The furnishings were antiquated. The bathroom set up did not make any sense to me, but it worked. The locks to our door did not work properly. The TV was ridiculously small and straight out of the 1980s despite it being a high-end hotel. And the bed was super hard, but after being so tired it didn't matter to us. There are better places in Rome to stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: CosminRo
Reviews.Content: It is not what you would expect. The location is very nice but service is low quality. Wi-fi Internet is not available in the rooms or lobby. Parking is 35 E / night and breakfast is 25 E / person / day. The rooms are tear out and the air-conditioning is not working properly. Also it is very noisy at night even when you shut it off ! The TV in the room is an old fashioned TV set , you would expect at least a small LCD at 300 Euros / night. Also staff is very rude and they act like they own the hotel and you are there because of their kindness. Overall a bad experience , would not go there ever again !

Reviews.Title: “faux smiles with nice big helpings of pomposity, I've felt more welcomed at a Days Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Themalemutekid
Reviews.Content: After an eight hour flight, we arrived to the hotel at around eight thirty in the morning. We were somewhat jet-lagged & in need of some rest. Turns out that our room was not ready due to the fact that check out is at noon & our room was still being used. We were told that check in was at two in the afternoon, but that they would give us another room or we could wait for our original room, it would be our choice. Waiting for the original room was not an option due to our state of grogginess, so we opted for another room. At this point we were told that our new room would not have a king sized bed , it would have two twins that they were going to push together for us. We were also not going to have a view of the fountain, but one of the side street looking towards the termini. We felt that this new room was a downgrade. We were paying top price for five star accommodations & we felt that we were being put out. They said we can have another room but it was an upgrade and would cost more money!! After lots of talking & a visit from a manager, we were given an upgrade to a front facing room at our original rate. But it still wouldn't be ready for a few hours. I suggested that they give us any room of any size so that we can clean up and rest. That turned into another ordeal. As I stated before, we felt very put off & awkward during our check-in. To be honest I've felt more welcomed at a Days Inn!! As for the hotel itself, it was truly beautiful. Our upgraded room was huge & the view was to die for. The location was great too, we were steps from the metro and Via Nazionale a nice boulevard to shop.Another good thing about the hotel was the cleaning staff, they kept our room impeccable throughout our stay. The porters out front were also very attentive. The physical location & accommodations were five star all the way. Wish I could say the same about the staff at the front desk. Most if not all wore faux smiles with nice big helpings of pomposity. Good traits for a velvet rope at some club in a big city, but not for people in the hospitality field. Bottom line, stay at the St Regis Grand on the other side of the fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a very nice location”
Reviews.Author: lindyjkh
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to this 5 star hotel as the hotel we were supposed to stay at wasn't finished with it's renovation. I'm sure we had a better price at about $200 a night than if we'd actually booked it originally. However, it was a beautiful hotel several blocks from the train station, across the street from the subway, and right by one of the sightseeing bus stops. Our room was in the back and was quiet, beautifully furnished and we had a nice free buffet breakfast every morning. Additionally there was a huge McDonalds at the end of the building where we sat and people watched.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rwoehst
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights while in Rome. The rooms are gorgeous and huge. You can walk from Termini and there's a metro stop directly in front. The staff were helpful with reservations / recommendations etc. Plenty to do / see in the immediate area as well. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location - shame about the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Meesh80
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Rome fro my 30th Birthday so we wanted it to be special hence booking a 5* Hotel.
