Upon arrival, bearing in mind they knew it was my birthday when the booking was made, not one mention was made :-( The check-in process also took a good 20-30 minutes, and although we weren't in a rush this was far to long in my opinion. We were shown to our room, all excited about the delights we may see, wrong! We we given a room we an extremely rubbish view of some dirty roof tops, Poor day light in the room due to the small window, on the plus side the bed was large and comfortable. Bathroom was what I would describe as bijou for a 5*. One night we had room service - waited 30 minutes! yes 30 minutes! for someone to answer the phone! and they charge you a set 12% surcharge for all room service! The food itself was not that great, and was expensive in my opinion and I have stayed a a fair few hotels. The day of check out I dared to phone reception to double check the time I was to check out, again this took 20 minutes for someone to answer the phone. When they do answer the phone they are short and unfriendly which I didn't appreciate. I used the VIP Business lounge twice, one of the 3 computers wasn't working and only one has a printer so you may have to wait some time if you want to print off your boarding pass. One of the things that made me pick this hotel was the fact that its one of the very few in Rome with a swimming pool, so you can imagine how disappointed I was to find out that 2 of the 4 days we would be there it would be out of bounds along with the upstairs bar. This was due to a corporate function and a wedding. When i did get a chance to test out the pool I managed to put one foot in before jumping right back out again. Although it was 90 degrees during our stay this did not heat the unheated pool at all. It was freeeeeezing! So I didn't dare go near it again! The hotel on some plus sides: Location, you couldn't ask for more central! everything is a short bus/taxi ride away and its walking distance from the main train stain which takes you direct to the airport for 23 euros for 2 people verses a 60 euro taxi ride. The hotel was also clean. I can't comment on any of their restaurants as we choose to eat out as it was considerably cheaper. Overall, I think there are much better hotels in Rome for far less money! But Rome is a must - fantastic city!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay - would return there again.”
Reviews.Author: Zoe84Lee81
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Boscolo Exedra for three nights with my wife and extended family in late September. We arrived at the hotel at 11:30am but because they were fully booked we had to wait for our room to be cleaned. As a result of this we didn't get a room allocated to us until the third time of asking and it wasn't the room initially given to us. However, the staff were apologetic and professional. The room was by far the best and biggest that we have ever had. It was light bright and spacious with a view looking out towards the Termini Station. The bathroom was also spacious and impeccably clean. The hotel is located approximately 30 minutes from Fiumicino Airport on the opposite side of Rome so it is not centrally located. You can walk to the Trevi Fountain from here if you fancy the walk but it would be a good idea to take advantage of the Metro stations located directy outside and across the road from the hotel. There is also a couple of tour bus companies that stop outside that help you see the sights. Best thing - the hotel's Champagne Bar Worst thing - no iron was available in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Very grand hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Scott_and_Amanda
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very large and clearly has made an effort to appear luxurious. The staff were friendly in a formal kind of way and our room was absolutely gorgeous, huge with a massive bed and one of the highest ceilings I've ever seen in a hotel room. Got a cocktail in their bar which was very nice. BUT their swimming pool is a joke - its more like an ornamental pond! Nice to sit beside of an evening with a glass of bubbly but not really suitable for swimming! However, all being said I liked it , it's in a great location and is very comfortable. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, sumptuous decor but absolutely no substance....”
Reviews.Author: MikeW2008
Reviews.Content: Have just checked out from a 1nt stay at the Boscolo Exedra for a short business trip. On the surface the hotel is very impressive - opulent surroundings and very exclusive feel. However, that is where the likeness to 5* ends. My room (at €420/nt) was on the second floor and whilst nicely decorated was looking tired with stains on the carpets. Like most European hotels, the room was on the small side. Similarly, the bathroom was cramped and the shower leaked. Water pressure was good, but temperature lukewarm at best - even after running for some minutes. The quality of room service at the Boscolo Exedra is dire and I would recomend anyone staying there to not pay over inflated prices for what is such poor quality food when there are so many fabulous places to eat in Rome. I arrived late and ordered a Beef entree with a Pannacotta dessert. Both were very poor quality - the Beef chewy and somewhat tasteless and the Panncotta still frozen. Rooms in the hotel do not have wireless internet, you are required to connect the 'original' way via a network cable - but the speed is still tiringly slow. Similar to other reviews, I had requested an iron in my room to press a shirt for the following morning only to be told it is not possible 'due to security' in the hotel. Instead, I had to pay €9.00 to have someone collect my shirt and iron it for me. Had I not been on business, the hotel may have met my needs more readily. It really is a gorgeous looking place, but true to its 'luxury' branding - horrendously overpriced. For the money, I'd expect far, far better service. Not 5* in that respect at all.

Reviews.Title: “You want me to pay for what!?!?!”
Reviews.Author: markbmw007
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel had a great location, clean rooms, and one of the nicest hotel beds ever. That the only things going for it, here comes the bad... -The only reason we booked this hotel was for the rooftop pool which we didn't find out until we got there that it opened at 10a and closed at 6p. For the 450/night I spent who has ever heard of more ridiculously short pool hours. -The door the the bathroom wouldn't close all the way. -The toilet ran all day and night. -I wanted to iron my shirt and there was no iron in the room. We called guest services and they said, "it's a security risk. We can't give you one." It's no security risk... I opened the closet and found a price list: 11 euro to press a shirt. -We were led to beleive on the site we booked that airport transfer was included as well as an American breakfast. No such luck. Airport transfer 60 euro and the NON-complimentary breakfast was 25 euro per head. -the room service which is a ritual for us, the prices were insane!!! 6 euro for one egg, not including tax and tip. Everything was hugely expensive because they could charge it. I don't know about you but if I'm paying VERY good money to be close to the train station and have a nice room I expect there to be some perks with it. We would have rather stayed at a Comfort Inn. At least there you can have an iron at $50/night.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars and worth the price - a true ROME Holiday”
Reviews.Author: snayyar
Reviews.Content: Boscolo is gorgeous. It is situated in the Piazza Republicca which if you are lucky enough to arrive at night will take your breath away. The stunning fountain and arced hotel makes for a truly dazzling welcome. The hotel is a 5 Star in terms of accommodations. The elaborate ceiling, LV trunks and classic Italian fabrics adorn a sweeping lobby - a great place to grab a drink if you don't mind spending 8 euro on a 8 oz diet coke. Let me repeat that... If you sit in the lobby or al fresco and order a coke, they will charge you 8 euro. You've already paid 300 euro for the room, so when in Rome... The hotel is huge, so specify if you want a room near the elevator and or a room with a view . Emailing the hotel ahead of time is a great idea and the front desk does appear to try their best to fulfill these requests. LOCATION: Stay here... it is beautiful and you feel like moving to Rome after spending a couple days in your perfectly located new home. 6 minute walk from Termini. The A Metro line is right outside your door. 10 minutes to the Spanish Steps or Colosseo by foot. Transit Tip#1 - while most taxis tack on an extra 10 euro for being "called" to a hotel, the Boscolo sits in a piazza with a taxi stand. That's an extra 10 euro in your pocket (or another diet coke for your wife !) Transit Tip#2 - 6 minutes to termini means that you can save about 60 euro and half an hour by taking a quick train (Leonardo Express) from FCO to Termini and then a quick 6 min walk to the hotel. STAFF: The concierge was extremely helpful and happily conversed in English. But remember, you aren't in NYC... so if you need a dinner recommendation you need to ask (as I always say... this is not the Ritz Carlton) ROOM: The bed was really comfortable, and the rooms were spacious for Europe. There was a couch, desk and ample space to waltz even in the "regular" rooms. The room was clean and the bathroom had double sinks, a shower and a bathtub. The shower leaked and I genuinely questioned if I was the first person to ever shower in it. I really just laughed it off as I mitigated the effects by just placing a few extra towels on the floor. No biggie ... the key to travel is to adapt! And moreover... I wasn't planning on spending more than 2 seconds thinking about that! The water pressure was awesome - and the bathroom was well lit (perfect makeup lighting). FOOD: The breakfast room was plentiful albeit the service was a bit disinterested. I suggest skipping it. No big breakfasts in rome. It is too hot and you have too much to see! Did Caesar stop for a snack?! No need to eat or dine in this hotel. The best food is found elsewhere during lunch... Bertizelli is a primo pizza place about 5 minutes away. Amongst dozens others. Have a drink one evening at the outside bar -its a beautiful scene - but you're in Rome so go out for your meals! Ok, don't laugh, but there is a McDs right next door that serves brioche in the mornings and has, what i estimate to be, a $30k cappuccino machine. Check em out - and save yourself the expensive breakfast in the hotel. The coffee is really out of this world. TIPS: Get the doorman to snap a great picture of you in front of the hotel when you return from dinner or drinking one late evening. Your friends will be impressed - the place really is a stunner. If you go to Rome, stay at the Boscolo. Drink a lot of vino and eat lots of Gelato (San Crispino if you're looking for the best!).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful exterior, sumptious lobby but poor room and service”
Reviews.Author: MegandTimC
Reviews.Content: On our arrival in Rome we spent a week at the Inn at the Spanish Steps which was wonderful. On departure for Venice we saw the Boscolo Exedra and later on booked it for the one night we had back in Rome a couple of weeks later as it looked lovely. The expression don't judge a book by its cover spings to mind in the opposite sense if you know what I mean. It was like falling down a rabbit warren to get to the room which was small, we had asked for a king bed but it was two singles pushed together and when I rang the front desk they said this is the way all king beds in the hotel were. The pillows were appaling something you might have found in a derelict boarding house I imagine. We had to make an early start for the airport for the long haul back to Australia via Heathrow but woke to found no hot water in the bathroom. We rang the front desk and they sent someone up to take us to another room to shower, it was sureal running from one side of the hotel to the other in bathrobes. Unbelievealy we found this room to be slightly larger and nicer and yes I checked the bed and it was a true king, so they would rather lie to us and let this room go begging than give it to us in the first place - not smart but then again I guess they thought they would never get caught out. Oh and by the way the water in this room was only just luke warm. There was no offer when we checked out to discount the bill for all the inconvience and the explaination was maintenace staff would not be in until later, unbelievable that in such a big hotel they do not have them on call. This is not even close to being a five star hotel, very dissapointing. All I can say is thank goodness we were flying back to Australia first class with Qantas and the showers in the first class lounge at Heathrow were suburb and yes the water was hot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Tired Property”
Reviews.Author: Luigismommy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a perfect location for walking around to the all the sites. The lobby was incredible but the room and the rest of the hotel seemed kind of tired. The room had dirty walls and some of the furniture could use fixing. The "tube" television was something you don't tend to see these days in a 5 star property. There was no wifi in the room. You have to go down to a business center to log in. The rooftop "pool" closes at 6pm and was more like a wading pool than a swimming pool. It was filled with kids at 5pm. It was only a 5 minute walk to Termini train station which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - service, not so much!”
Reviews.Author: classyluxury
Reviews.Content: The person checking us in spoke great english and was really helpful, and took us up to the room herself. Our bags arrived shortly after. We were impressed with the decor - quite opulent yet modern and the room was a really good size. There were dressing gowns and slippers in the bathroom and some nice bath products (although I'd not heard of the brand), and a nice big wardrobe and dressing area. Everything was immaculate all throughout the hotel. It would have been nice if the TV was flatscreen and had more english channels, but it didn't matter much as we didn't have the TV on much. We had drinks in the champagne bar but they weren't the best and were expensive and the service was slow. We ate in the restaurant one evening and we told them we had to leave by a certain time but they did not get the courses out on time. However, the waiter was apologetic and let us come back after our evening out for the final courses and even gave us a complimentary glass of wine. The pool area was small but really nice, with some sunbeds on the terrace (be warned, it can get busy!) but the drinks were extortionate! But all was forgiven when we saw the hot lifeguard!!! The thing that let the hotel down the most was the inconsistent service. As mentioned, the person checking us in was great, but we did think it a bit odd when we asked her if the pool was open during our stay and she did not seem to know. And when we were leaving, we called for someone to collect our bags. We waited 15 mins and no-one came. So I complained when we were checking out and the woman on Reception had the cheek to ask the bell-boy if it was true that we had actually called! I think she thought if she said it in Italian we wouldn't know what she said! She wasn't very apologetic. Also, we had to wait for ages for the chauffeur to come out to the car to take us to the airport. Having said all this about the service, it's not that different to what we experienced in other places during our stay in Rome. In all, we had a really nice stay, the hotel was modern, clean and in a good location, and it was really good value for money as we good a good deal on Expedia, though I might not have been so happy if we'd paid more.

Reviews.Title: “If you dont have anything nice to say!!!”
Reviews.Author: AggieBristol
Reviews.Content: Start with the good the hotel is in a great location and looks very nice, on checkin the place was empty but it still took forever, we asked the guy if they were busy & he said they were empty but there was still no one to take us to our room or help with the cases but a lot of staff hanging around. Got to the room which was quite nice but lacking anything extra, no tea/coffee facilities, no iron, no bottled wate, no pen or paper no hotel or city info, no CD/DVD or MP3 connector, a very old square TV and if you are English just 2 channels, no in house movies definitely no way a 5 star room.No glasses to drink from rang room service & they wanted to charge 5 Euros to bring the glasses, they also charge for ringing room service so please check your bill, all the ice machines on every floor are broken which they know when you report it, we also tried in vain to get a light bulb changed in the bathroombut gave up, over to the next guest. The real massive problem here is the front of house staff, I have read oter site reviews which say the same but you rally have to experience it to see how bad it is. The attitude of everyone of the is the worst you will come across everything is too much trouble, from reception to waiting staff bar staff and management, there is no Concierge so you have to use reception and the staff there do not want to be bothered having to speak to you, even trying to check out and pay them some money is really too much effort. You complain to the management who says we know & are trying to improve, well they really need to try harder. If you work in the service industry try to offer some service if not move on but dont spoil people's holidays. We booked the hotel for its swimming pool, dont do it, if you want a proper 5 star hotel across the road is the Sy Regsis Grand Hotel, and dont waste your money & effort staying at the Boscolo Exdra, life really is too short. Someone else said it is as though the staff are waiting to be discovered for better things believe me with teir attitude and personal skills its never going to happen, and just a point of interest no member of staff wears a name badge or will give you their name, good job I didnt have anything nice to say about anyone and wanted to pass it on to their manager.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant/Reception - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: celestep
Reviews.Content: My family ate at the restaurant here after having poor experiences with our hotel concierge's recommendations. We were not staying at this hotel, but we wish we had. When we came into the lobby on a Sunday night, we were just looking for a good restaurant. We did not know we were going to get such a wonderful meal with such good company. The receptionist walked us over directly to the restaurant's host and we were seated swiftly. That is a sign of good service, when the reception does not just direct you and point you the right way, but actually walks you over to where you want to be. Dinner was exquisite, and my whole family enjoyed. Along with our orders, we got to taste chilean sea bass, compliments of the chef, and we were also given two pastry assortments for dessert. We stayed until we were the last people on the patio. The servers and the restaurant manager came over to talk with our table often, and they made us laugh and feel very welcome, joking with the children and everything. It was refreshing, and next time I am in Rome I will consider staying at this hotel. If the restaurant service is anything like their hotel services, then I'm sold.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: MarakiOttawa
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to this staying at this hotel as I had visited it on another trip to Rome. It looked very elegant and the location was good. However, I was disappointed in the service. The concierge could barely speak English and did not recognize any of the highly recommended restaurants that I wanted info on. When we finally chose one, she confirmed that the reservation was made. When we showed up, they did not have our reservation and told us the hotel never called. Everytime I called for room service, it took way too long for them to show. I requested some hot water to drink, and they told me it was a $5 service charge! Again the decor of the hotel is lovely, the suite was large and clean, but they failed on the service.

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing to shout about”
Reviews.Author: LondonHannibal
Reviews.Content: The location is reasonable but one feels a little out of the real hubbub of Rome, however the overwhelming feeling is that it falls way short of a 5 star hotel. I frequently stay in Four Seasons hotels and they remain my benchmark. The reception staff are friendly but lack that polish found in the best hotels...they talk amongst themselves when serving and don't seem to be au fait with the reservation system on their computers. The rooms are large and comfortable and the bathrooms are spacious but the toiletries are not of 5 star standard and the bath was way too small. The aircon controls were broken and so one couldn't get the very loud noise to go off at any time. The pool is very, very small and the terrace and pool were out of bounds one day because of a wedding. Overall a feeling that this was not a top grade hotel.

Reviews.Title: “worst ever - like a super model with no brains”
Reviews.Author: Josh096
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as it was one of the only hotels in Rome that was a five star with a swimming pool. We based our decision on that the pool would keep our kids happy after hot days out sight seeing. We booked the junior suite for around 700 euro. When we arrived at the hotel our first impression was that it was well located and beautiful although there was no one to help us through the doors with our luggage. Once inside the receptionist was less then enthusiastic. She showed us to our room. The room was a large two story suite but the carpet was filthy. The bar fridge was half empty and after she looked inside she said someone would come and fill it up. No one did in the four nights we stayed there even though we asked several times. To make matters worse our kids were tired but their beds were not in the room. We asked the receptionist where they were and she seemed confused then dismissive. She said that our 4 year old would sleep on the sofa and she would get our daughter's sent up. My husband said that our son would not fit on the sofa and in our correspondence we were told it would be a sofa bed not just a sofa. She seemed annoyed and left the room to check her email. She called back 30 mins later to say a bed was on its way and that another would be supplied for our son but that the person making the booking made a mistake. In the hour that it took to get our beds our terrible club sandwich came up an hour after we ordered it. To make matters worse, housekeeping put a sheet on with a hole in it and left it on. Tired, hungry and less then impressed we thought we'd make the best of it and not let it ruin our day. We went up to the pool. The pool was dirty and there is no service after 430PM so we couldn't even order a coffee. That night we were woken up by sensor lights that went on in our bedroom every time we moved in our beds. They failed to mention that these were on the stairs in our room or how to turn them off. The next morning we went to the breakfast room. The eggs were disgusting. I think they were powdered. Still we didn't complain. The final straw came when 2 days in a row the pool was shut. First day as there was a wedding and the second as it was closed for maintenance because it was filthy. Management failed to tell the guests at the hotel and that's when my husband finally lost it. He went to speak to management but he wasn't the only one. Seems a lot of the guests were just as upset as us. My husband explained to the manager he expected more from a five star hotel and that the only reason we stayed was that it had a pool that ironically we couldn't use. We checked out one day early. In summary, beautiful hotel but the wrong people running it.

Reviews.Title: “5stars exterior ... but interior ?”
Reviews.Author: Paiam
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this luxury hotel for 4 nights . The hotel is in a very strategic place in the heart of the Rome reachable by subway line A. I can say eveything was positive except : 1- I had ants in my bed and that is definitely a NO NO NO ! 2- The tub in the bathroom was not clean ! 3- 20€ for 1day internet is a bit expensive ! but for other things, it was a real 5stars hotel, interior, breakfast, room decoration, pool and staff . So you can decide, better the aspect of hotel or having a clean bed ?

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, good location”
Reviews.Author: movin_around
Reviews.Content: When in a city like Rome, location is essential. Exedra Boscolo has a great location, close to the train station and near supermarkets, pharmacies, other restaurants, short bus ride away from major tourist attractions. But that's about it. When i arrived at the hotel, the check in was smooth but i realized the pitfalls when i checked into the room. The room didn't have wireless internet which was quite surprising, as most 3-4 hotels offer the service, let alone 5 stars. Reception didn't answer the phone when you called, it rang at least 7-10 times before someone picked up and even then, they were curt in their responses. Good luck if you needed a shirt ironed (because apparently, in Italy you cannot use iron's inside the rooms) as the front desk said it might take two hours for the laundry service to pick up my shirt, IF they could.. Don't bother with room service, prices were terrible. It's easier to get something from the local supermarket e.g. water, chips, etc. Although I didn't stay in the room long enough , as i was out exploring the sights everyday, to experience other services I was not really impressed with the hotel's staff in my short dealings with them. Wouldn't recommend this hotel if you're one of those tourists that spends an equal amount of time in the room as you do exploring the sights. If you're just looking for a place to relax during your daily trips to Rome's sights, then surely, there are cheaper places available.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GTosh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing, went for a delux room and got one on the 4th floor with a balcony overlooking the fountain in the Piazza

Reviews.Title: “Initially disappointing....but the manager managed to change our first impression!”
Reviews.Author: TravelAndWrite
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our wedding anniversary. We had the same experience as one other reviewer - EmpireState. We were initially given a small room, without a view, with a broken shower, and we were made to wait 30 minutes for check in although we arrived at about 3:00pm, and then later waited for another 30 minutes for our bags. As we have paid so much for the rooms, we insisted on seeing the manager and to our surprise, the manager was very professional and friendly. He upgraded our room to a deluxe room, and our stay from then on was nothing but excellent. He even offered a free drink a the bar. The upgraded room had a beautiful view, spacious room, comfortable bed, and clean and spacious bathroom. The hotel was conveniently located. We were also surprised for the money we paid, internet access was not free. We learnt later that we can access the internet in the business centre for free. Something to remember. So if you know what you want, please ensure you request for a spacious room to avoid disappointment, especially in the peak seasons.

Reviews.Title: “The Location matters...”
Reviews.Author: ceaders
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family at the Exedra for a week between June 20th and June 27th, the hotel was as expected, elegant and charming and on the Piazza della Repubblica which is a walking distance (15 min of beautiful walk) from the Spanish steps, Trevi fountain, Via Venito, and the coliseum. and its 3 min away from the Train station. The hotel have an amazing outdoor coffee shop/terrace over looking the Piazz's beautiful fountain- Amazing view, just sit & relax, watch people passing by and admire rome.. The coffee shop is not cheap at all, average drink is Euro 15... Dont forget to visit the church accross the street from the hotel, its surely worth the visit.. The rooms where HUGE, we had 2 connecting rooms, 305-307 the only semi connecting rooms in the hotel, each room was like 6x6 meters with high ceiling and a beautiful view. i guess our rooms were the largest in the hotel. Bed was bigger than a king size, WC had a shower and a bath yet the room it self had the BASIC amenities. OLD 21" TV, do not expect any high tech amenities, even to call the reception you dial 8174 (4 digits!!!) yet whatever we asked for they used to get ASAP, so if whatever you want is not there in the room just ask for it & they will nicely arrange it!! The breakfast was British, scrambled eggs, bacon, fruits, cakes, juice, cheese and a lot more... True you can be closely located to the center of Rome but the view and the space you have in this hotel no other hotel can offer. Other 5 stars hotels are squashed between building and some had no space even for your taxi to pick you up from!! From the Excedra u can pick a cab or the bellboy will call them and they will be there in a min, or go on the "Rome by Bus tour" which stops directly in front of the hotel and i highly recommend to do on your first day in Rome. Next to the hotel there is a pharmacy, Mc Donald's, Banks, mini markets, coffe shops, restaurants etc almost everything you need, trust me, stay in Rome as long as you can, its amazing…

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic, classy, luxurious hotel”
Reviews.Author: viajeroUKLondon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Rome a few times on business, and once on please, and this is by far the nicest hotel I have experienced. It is a substantially sized hotel, so may not suit people looking for a more personal, familiar level of service but the rooms are spotless, beautifully decorated and I have always found the staff courteous. Downsides are expensive drinks, not a massive TV and fairly limited channels - but these are personally things that I can live without.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and centrally located hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: AnnLee2306
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Exedra during my incentive trip to Rome. The hotel is very centrally located in ancient Rome. It is easy to get walking to major sightseeing spots. I loved the neo-classical decor and felt comfortable when stayed there. Very courteous and competent staffs.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: empirestate72
Reviews.Content: I had my boyfriend visiting me in Italy so I decided to take him to Rome since I love Rome. I decided to book a 5 stars hotel because it was a very special occasion for me. I saw here all the comments but my experience was very different and that is why I am giving a comment . When we arrived with the taxi I was amazed about the massive building with its fontain. The valet guys opened the door of the taxi and I felt like a movie star. We wanted to take the luggage inside but the gentleman told us to leave there and that they would take it directly to the room, they gave me a ticket. Check-in. Once we got in I saw this marvellous lobby with high ceiling and everything very luxury. We went to the reception desk in order to check-in and I felt like disturbing all the receptionists there. Then I approach to a young lady (thought she was busy with the computer) and told her that we wanted to check in. She was really rude, she took us in the middle of the lobby and told us that we had to wait till the receptionist came. We were CONFUSED After 30 minutes waiting, another lady came and asked us to sit in one of the horrible tables in the middle of the lobby. I've never seen such an unpolite receptionist, she was rude and mad, very dirty and nervous. While doing the check-in I thought she wanted to break down the computer which made us feel so bad and uncomfortable. She took us to the room which was very far! we had to take the elevator and then some other stairs to get there. The ceiling was in wood, very dark and horrifying. We got into this room with no natural light and a balcony facing a wall. I immediately told the lady that for 430 euro I was expecting a little bit more and she told me that standard rooms had no view. I was really dissapointed and told to myself never to come back. Luggage.- After 20 minutes waiting for the luggage we called guest services and there was a busy tone. My boyfriend and I had to go all the way down to ask for our luggage. The girl told us that it was coming and in fact the luggage came but it wasn't ours. After 2 hours of struggle we managed to have our luggage. Telephone-They told us the problem of the telefone would be resolved and in 3 nights it never did. Rooms- very dark, hairdryer didn't work at all and even if the told us they'd bring one they never did. Mirror and walls dirty. The room wasn't cleaned well during our stay: same towels and same hairs in the shower. If you want to take a shower in the morning or afternoon you will have to do it with fresh water because there is not hot water. Breakfast- it was ok but the hostess and people there don't have a clue about luxury, respect and service. Restaurant- Food was ok, expensive for what it was but ok. People at the bar and restaurant were very unpolite and I think even bored. I felt so frustrated that I wanted to go away and ask my money back. We met another couple in the hotel, we realized that they had a deluxe room, big one with nice view paying 100 euro less than what we payed. It is just not fare.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but expensive”
Reviews.Author: LuxeryHoliday
Reviews.Content: Nice big room and bathroom. Good view from room onto fountain at front of hotel. Staff not the most friendly or helpful with directions or suggestions. The bar downstairs was nice to enjoy a glass of wine or cocktail at the end of a long days sightseeing. Overall a good hotel but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Rooms - Service???”
Reviews.Author: TravelerTrish
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay at the Exedra this time because we love the location of the Piazza Repubblica - Right near the train station and subway. You cannot beat it! They upgaded us to a Deluxe room after we had got a prepaid deal on Orbitz - It is still crazy expensive thought +$450 a night, Not sure it is worth that much - oh well when in Rome. The check-in was very good and they showed us to our upgraded room - WOW _ great style and ambience. The hotel employees are all very young and model looking very chic. I felt like a frumpy traveler. The bed was a bit week for a 5 star hotel though - thin duvet - hard matresss - not what you would expect - good enough though. The bathroom was great - no small washcloths though????You have to use big hand towels? Is this a Italy thing?? We had them at the St. Regis - NIce bathroom amenities. The Exedra is a very large Hotel but is looked very empty during the week - so we were perplexed that when we called down to guest services 9/10 we got a busy signal? A couple of times we had requests and they never called us back - hmmmm. I would go back though.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly bizarre ostentation, comfy, but not much seemed to work”
Reviews.Author: D50
Reviews.Content: The acres of polished marble and gilding everywhere was dazzling, room was almost comically over the top in its bling decor and ostentation which - presumably - appeals to a category of American, Arab, Asian and maybe some European tastes. Everything was perfectly acceptable, dining area surprisingly cramped, staff friendly if rather sleepy...but so much didn't seem to work. Massive chandelier had blown bulbs which rather let the side down. Calling reception on the phone raised...nobody. Trying to set a wake-up call time on the TV produced...no result. All rather odd. And decidedly NOT five-star standard. The place seems to show Italy at its most typical, warm, friendly, unorganised, with a naff sense of 'sophisticated' taste. Felt more like a stereotyped movie set than a real-life attempt at a five-star hotel. Can't knock it too hard - that would be unfair - but should definitely TRY HARDER!

Reviews.Title: “oh i love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: nycfashionlover
Reviews.Content: 5 star lobby, love the location, very convinient, close to metro. we had the triple room so it is spacious and the room is very clean. i couldn't ask for more. one night that i stayed, harry potter were having their event outside the hotel. fancy and interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Five star lobby, 3 star rooms, generally poor/snobby service”
Reviews.Author: purewaves
Reviews.Content: I was expecting great things from the Boscolo Exedra, but I was quite disappointed on a few counts: The rooms, while clean and comfortable, are not at all close to a 5 star standard. They were plain and small with cookie cutter designed features. They also had outdated amenities like a low quality no-name 19" tube TV's that had just basic Italian channels. Not even CNN or BBC. The bathrooms are small. Additionally, the showers have poor hot water levels...luke warm at best even when you run it for a while. In room internet service, while good, was 20 euros a day...not per room, but per computer! Yes, 2 people with a laptop each have to pay a total of 40 Euros a day to get online. Room service charges a 10 Euro service fee to their already bloated prices. They wanted to charge me 6 Euros for a coffee (OK, 5 star hotel prices) but also the 10 Euro fee for room service. 16 Euros for a cup of coffee?? Come on! The staff can be very hit and miss. Some of the front desk staff are very nice and helpful, however the oafish valet goons with their plucked eyebrows and fake tans leave a lot to be desired. They wander the lobby, overbearingly looking to help with something in order to get a tip. They also give you filthy looks if you aren't wearing a 3 piece suit with fancy sunglasses. The staff in the breakfast bar are pushy and rude. They don't seat you but then again they also wont let you choose where to sit in a nearly empty dining room. We sat down, started having coffee and were asked to move to a smaller table, despite the place being 95% empty. Calling Guest Services can be a chore. Most of the time they don't answer, and even when they do it takes a good 10-15 rings to get someone. The security is incredibly lax. Street vendors are allowed to set up shop outside the hotel where they harass you to buy umbrellas or dolls. There was even a shady looking guy soliciting "anti-drug donations" about 5 meters from the front door and he was there from morning to night. Hotel staff just ignored him. Each day we were there we had to deal with this when exiting the hotel. The street valets are useless if you need a cab. You can basically walk to Natzionale and get your own in 1/4 of the time. The wireless internet in the VIP lounge didn't work for our entire stay. Also, the room is frequently left unstaffed with the lights off, so you may have to search for someone to come up to the first floor to turn everything on. That's about it really. If this was a 3 star hotel charging 100 Euros a night, I guess it wouldn't be so bad. But at 300 Euros a night with a five star reputation it was a really substandard experience to say the least. I give it (barely) 3 stars as far as purported 5 star hotels go, mostly due to their location and cleanliness level. Not recommended. Pros - Not many. Splendid lobby, interesting hotel exterior, good location. Cons - In general this is hotel is not up to a 5 star standard. Poor value, small rooms with outdated features, generally poor and inattentive service, attitude and dirty looks from some of the staff, bill padding on room service and internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected surprise”
Reviews.Author: loves2travelnearly40
Reviews.Content: Myself, my husband and my 10 year old daughter booked a week originally with the Boscolo Palace on the Via Veneto on line. However, on the way to our Hotel by taxi we passed this amazing hotel and I thought to myself "wow, I'd love to stay there". When we arrived at our hotel we were told that there was a problem with the water Hydraulics and had to be put up in their sister Hotel, yep you guessed it the same hotel we had just passed. Needless to say they did not have to apologise for any inconvenience caused, we had just been upgraded from a 4 star to a 5 star. I can only describe the Boscolo Exedra as plush luxury. The outside alone is just magnificent with its stone columns and elegant entrance. The rooms were not absolutely huge but beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean with two double doors with the smallest of balconies (standing room only) overlooking the city. We had the biggest bed ever which was just as well as we had our little girl with us. I had originally booked the other Boscolo because of its location, the swimming pool and because we got a good price. The location of the Exedra while not exactly as central as our other choice was only 10 minutes from the Via Veneto and you could walk to nearly everything from it and it's just a short walk from the train station. The reason I wanted a swimming pool was because of our daughter (walking around historical sites, monuments etc. can be tiring). The pool was on the rooftop overlooking the streets of Rome with the most amazing Restaurant and bar. I thought I had died and gone to heaven. On saying that there were a few complaints, the staff especially the bar staff (at the time) weren't the friendliest, because it is a 5 star the Restaurant and the bar were frightfully expensive. It is just as well that we had already paid for our breakfasts or we would have had to go elsewhere. All in all an amazing trip which I shouldn't really complain about considering the luck we had in getting it in the first place. I would go back again (if I won the lottery).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fab rooms, but a lacking a good bar!!”
Reviews.Author: MD-NLG
Reviews.Content: Third time at the Exedra - ask for a room to the front, much nicer than the the wing or rear facing - Good size with seating area and small walk out balcony, beds huge and really good cottons - bathrooms all marble and a bit dated but very functional. the reception /public areas are very quiet and the bar is more of a cocktail bar - would be nice if they opened it up a bit and created additional seating in the main space which is stunning. staff very pleasant and concierges out front on the ball and good knowledge -watch hotel booked taxis 50/70% more expensive and always worth a bit of banter with the drivers before getting in!!

Reviews.Title: “Average for the Price”
Reviews.Author: TiredTravelerHK
Reviews.Content: Had high hopes for the hotel before arrival but was turnoff by the efficiency and attitude of the hotel staff. Tried to ask for a new set of towels but was unable to reach the guest services operator after numerous attempts, no answer for over 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in the Middle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: WORLDSCITIZEN68
Reviews.Content: Really a Luxury hotel with nice location, the room is big and elegantly decorated and furnished, the staff were gently and the breakfast delicious, as we were in a group, i don't know if our breakfast were the same of the others guest because we had in a separeted room. The hotel is just few steps from the subway and if you lik, You can go to visit some historical atractions just walking

Reviews.Title: “Timeless beauty in Rome”
Reviews.Author: holidayoptions
Reviews.Content: Having stayed with the Boscolo family owned Hotel in Nice we just had to try Rome. Great value for city centre location. Good size rooms and classic feel of quality throughout hotel. The chef in the main restaurant left nothing to be desired. Presentation and quality of food worthy of Michelin stars. Afternoon tea and pastires a must.

Reviews.Title: “very very nice!”
Reviews.Author: ZENetherlands
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay in Rome! The position is very convenient if arriving by train. All the main attractions are within walking distance however not exactly around the corner. You can easily walk to the Colloseum, Spanish Steps, Fountain and near the bus to Vatican city, etc. The rooms are very large, comfortable and nice. We found all of the the staff to be polite and extremely helpful. We enjoyed our stay very much and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Exedra”
Reviews.Author: Kim-Nashville
Reviews.Content: The Boscolo Exedra Rome is a wonderful hotel. The only drawback is it is a very large hotel so you can get a litte lost finding your room, but its worth it. We had a deluxe room which had a large bathroom with shower, tub & bidet, a long hall as you walk in with a large closet & bar, & finally you step into the bedroom area itself which was quite roomy with flat screen TV, leather chairs & headboard, desk , small balcony (sadly looking out over the garbage in this case), & chandelier. A large breakfast buffet was included in our rate with lots of choices to start the day. The hotel is located near the Basilica Degli Angeli on Roman ruins of Diocletians Baths. Just across from the hotel is a Catholic church, or 1 block away St. Susanna, the American Catholic church & is just off the Via Venito with fabulous shopping. Be sure to check out the view from the rooftop terrace & pool area. The staff if friendly & very much willing to help. I will deffnately return to this hotel on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Simply a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: BardieParis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to celebrate our anniversary in beautiful surroundings. Rome became the destination and the Exedra the place to stay. Everything from the roof-top pool to the extremely helpful concierge made our stay exactly the way we wanted it - beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Disapppointing”
Reviews.Author: TravelladybugLondon
Reviews.Content: The Exedra was a bit of a disappointment. Arrived late on a Friday past midnight and hungry. No menu in the room and after the menu was delivered we got a reheated piece of dry pizza with a few slices of ham on top as an overpriced 'prosciutto pizza'. Also, although the room had high ceilings it was still very small - especially given the fact that I had called the front desk in advance to ask about differences in rooms and was told: "All our rooms are very big, starting at 30m2 so there should not be considerable differences in what you book". The worst part was the deplorable breakfast service where, as someone mentionned, the staff seemed to be 'bothered' to have to serve/set tables for people walking in. Although my experience at the front desk was pleasant enough, the hotel definitely does not live up to its 5* rating in terms of service.

Reviews.Title: “Very Rude Respetionest and very unprofessional avoid hotel”
Reviews.Author: inpetco
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay in the hotel, and thought at the first time maybe it was summer and that is why they were not their standard , but apprently this is their typical behaviour When arrived , they put us in a small room, which was not what we booked, after 1/2 discussions they changed the room to another with a horoble view, facing hotel machines. Any time you get to the breakfast room, they look at you and stay arround as if they just want you to leave, Resptionest very rude, and very unhelpfull.I would not stay again and will not recommand it

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste the money!”
Reviews.Author: paoloI
Reviews.Content: I've been to Rome at least 10 times and always stay at the cheaper mom-pop hotels near termini. This time I wanted a little luxury so I stayed "5star". I booked in March and got a "deluxe" room for half price. When I was checking in the person at the desk seemed a bit puzzled by the price, but said it was a deluxe room. What they gave me was a filthy room overlooking the delivery dock. I went back to the desk and said this was not "deluxe", they gave me another room but they were charging me 175euros more. When I got to that room it had no air conditioning . (I should note that I used English upon check in and the staff had no idea that I speak perfect Italian... so the entire time they were talking in Italian about what to do about me and the low price I had paid.) When I finally "blew-up" , in perfect Neopolitian-italian, the head consierge took over and gave me an exceptable room at the original price at which I had booked. Moreover, the breakfast was a joke compared with other hotels I've been to in Italy and the staff in the dining room seemed in a daze... more over the majority spoke little or no Italian and very bad English. My advice, stay at the smaller hotels and you'll enjoy your stay the Roman way.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: twyford_tiger
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location - rooms are excellent, very spacious and luxurious. Food and drink also excellent - v highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Classic grand hotel befit for an ageless city”
Reviews.Author: Arvida99
Reviews.Content: Exedra is set in a beautiful piazza. Its elegant entrance and smiling staff combine to assure the traveller his/her stay will be very pleasant. Rooms are very spacious and well appointed. This hotel was designed with class to fit its location. Nicest Roman hotel I've been to in my three trips there.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: gourmetwashington
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Exedra after a long flight from Seattle. Although tired and haggard looking, we were treated very kindly. The room given to us was incredibly beautiful. It was a large room and they had set up - what seemed like a full sized bed for our son. All the beds were made up in the same fashion - and very elegant. The bathroom was large - with a separate toilet area, double walk in shower, double sinks and luxurious soaking tub. The lobby was beautiful and the food great. If you are looking for a beautiful hotel with good sized rooms, the Exedra is an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, beautiful hotel with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: mfanefile
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Exedra Hotel during my July holiday in Rome. The hotel occupies a prime location at Piazza della Republicca LOCATION; Close to Termini station and positioned one level above Repubblicca station. All the buses stop adjacent to the hotyel, if you buy a tourist card you will find transport at your disposal. RECEPTION: I like the hospitality and courtesy of the hotel as the receptionist leaves everythin to attend to your needs. He/She will escort you to your room after check-in. ROOMS: The rooms are spacious and the bathroom are beautiful. For turndown, they make sure they visit your room and in-between check if you need anything. Wonderful experience at the Exedra hotel. Bellymen are all over the foyer and even outside wearing a smile. I liked their appearance as ig they were bodyguards.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking beauty and luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shatomargo
Reviews.Content: Neoclassical elegance rooms with high ceiling, design furniture. Situated in the center of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to a 5 star rating!”
Reviews.Author: alfsr
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nites at this hotel at the end of April 09. I had seen some negative reviews but wanted the location near Termini station. Our room was on the second floor overlooking a side street, it was large with tall ceilings and a marble bathroom to die for. Breakfast was both hot and cold selections and a variety of different beverages more than ample. The staff was attentive and helpful. The concierge(s) were world class. We went to Venice for a week and stopped in after the train ride back for a beverage and several staff members called us by name. I was impressed to say the least. Regards

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: tripsAAA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Exedra for four nights as part of our Honeymoon trip. I have to say that it was an amazing experience. I was a bit apprehensive, because I had had some problems prior to arrival with being double booked on a non-refundable rate. Long story short, I ended up having to file a credit card dispute and got my money back. Needless to say, I was prepared for a lukewarm welcome. When we arrived, it was exactly the opposite. The staff at Exedra made amends by upgrading our room to a room with a wonderful view of the Piazza della Repubblica and the fountain in the middle. They also gave us a dining credit at Tazio (the hotel restaurant) for a meal worth up to 261 Euros. I was shocked and it was a great start to the trip. Although the restaurant had a very limited menu, we thoroughly enjoyed our free meal. Several times, we left the room briefly in the morning or afternoon for a quick meal and put the "please make up the room" sign on the door, and every single time the room was made up when we returned. One time, we were gone only 15-20 minutes, and the room was still completely made up. We appreciated this prompt service. The rooftop pool was wonderful and relaxing, giving great views of the city from above. The one complaint I have is that it was FREEZING. A heated pool would be nice, as I could barely sit in it for an extended period of time. Not many hotels in Rome have a pool, period, let alone one on top of the roof! Finally, I have to say that the concierge desk was probably the highlight of our trip, always ready and willing to help and providing us with valuable information on the surrounding area and restaurants. Definitely take their recommendations for restaurants in the area!! The concierge went above and beyond what is required of them several times and I was very thankful for that.

Reviews.Title: “Hated this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mooms77
Reviews.Content: Rude staff, very unhelpful, roof pool closed and we weren't advised prior to the trip, and a small pokey room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - dreadful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: EmPalmer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Exedra for 2 nights in May 2009. The location is great – the hotel forms almost all of one side of a giant square with a fountain in the middle. The McDonalds next door dampens the grandeur slightly, but overall it’s pretty special. The rooms vary in size; on the fourth floor there are large rooms with small balconies overlooking the Piazza, but other rooms are smaller and overlook other back walls. All the facilities you would expect of a 5* hotel – although only 1 English language TV station which, even in Italy, is unusual. The mayor highlight: Roof top infinity pool overlooking the city, surrounded by a bar and “chill-out” areas with squishy oversized white sofas and candlelight at night. Friendly bar staff make great drinks. The biggest disappointment: Breakfast was appalling. Two kinds of fruit (sliced rock-hard pineapple or oranges), stale pastries (dried out croissants), three soggy cereals and juice form a carton. Oh and a salad bar with limp lettuce and tomatoes. The coffee was percolated, slow and bitter and so was the service. Dreadful! Would expect a better breakfast at a 2* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “VERY disappointing ......”
Reviews.Author: LincsPauline
Reviews.Content: Impressive exterior and sumptuous room, located within a 5 minute walk of Termini station. Reception staff are completely disinterested although housekeeping do a good job. Late May and there is no swimming pool available, there is no hotel guide in the room to outline what facilities are available. Gym is very small - as is breakfast choice - food isn't replenished and coffee is a long wait. For an apparent 5 star rooms lack iron and ironing board (although there is allegedly a pressing service - but not much use if you have a business meeting and need to iron on arrival! There are no facilities to make drinks and no water - there is a mini bar but no prices ...... No pen or notepaper, no bath robe - or any of the other touches one might expect from a 5 star. For corporate choice - meal portions are small, bar is closed early - and forget EVER getting coffee! I wouldn't have been disappointed if this were a 3 star hotel - but was left VERY disappointed for a 5 star - with most certainly 5 star prices!!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Hotel centrally located”
Reviews.Author: cvhjr
Reviews.Content: We had a truly memorable stay at the Exedra this past March. The hotel lived up to its rating. The friendly efficient staff was outstanding and the hotel had all the "upgrades" expected in an outstanding facility. The hotel is fairly new and it shows. Modern comfortable rooms and sleek baths the ancient Roman's would have died for ( across the street) . The attentive concierge(s) were world class in any language. They arranged private guides, tours and saw to our every need. I'd return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5* Hotel - Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: LondonDuncan
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with high hopes for a nice romantic weekend away and I was left very disappointed. Firstly, the staff were totally uninterested and bordering on rude on check-in. They failed even to mention at all that the pool and roof bar were closed, which was very annoying as this was one of the main reasons I booked it. Eventually they gave the excuse that it was down to the weather but this is total rubbish as the building works had been going on for a while. Secondly, the room itself was well below average for a hotel of this price. It was small and contrary to their website had no view at all. Again, when I queried this they informed me that the hotel was full and it was tough luck. This was totally untrue as was made pretty obvious by just walking around it. Also, twice I ordered room service, once it took over an hour to arrive and the other never arrived at all with no explanation! I did complain about my stay and to be fair the travel agent did give me a partial refund but the hotel itself refused to apologise and offered me a discount on a future stay - something I won't be taking up! On the plus side, the entrance to the hotel is nice and the location is ok - but is just a bit too far to walk to most attractions. Overall, even if you get a good deal on the net, I would avoid this hotel. There are far better than this in Rome for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Luxury but something missing out”
Reviews.Author: Destichado
Reviews.Content: The hotel is definitely a center point, the evening we arrived, there was a promotion of the Sex in the City movie and a new Mercedes GLK in front of the property. Lots of tuxedos and splendor to impress. Front office staff however spoiled the entire experience, seemed cold and so busy with the PC keyboard.The valet services and bell boy were welcoming though. The concierge was a top professional who replied to all our questions, some of which quite long. We were given a room, that was far from the lifts and although large enough, I couldn't help disappointment for the rate of EUR 400 per night plus. I won't touch the topic of the window view at all, although I probably should. The bathroom was great, amenities were generous. Breakfast was served in a sort of darkish saloon, service and menu left a bit to be desired for this class of hotel. Nevertheless the hotel is very clean, corridors are spacious and bright, lobby is grand, the lifts are quick and nice. Location is excellent, within a minute from Termini Station and 10 minutes walk from most interesting shopping spots. Perhaps I expected too much from the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality Hotel if a little tired some areas.”
Reviews.Author: TonyAFC8
Reviews.Content: A very attractive hotel in a great position within the city walls, the reception is of a very high standard and the staff were very friendly and willing to help. The rooms are a good size with double hieght cielings and a good standard of furnishing, the carpet was a little tired and could do with replacing. The bathroom facilities were of a good standard and very clean at all times. The best thing about the hotel was the breakfast, the standard was exellent on ever visit and left me needing no lunch on the 4 days we spent at the hotel. Good Value for money and a great base for a trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but lacked personality”
Reviews.Author: KenmarAnnapolis_Md
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, but lacked personality. The room was big and clean; however the rugs were worn. The bed was comfortable and the water was hot - two very important things for me! The staff was polite, but not overly helpful. I am not sure if it was the language barrier or just their attitude, but they didn't have many helpful recommendations. The rooftop bar is closed for renovations. The downstairs bar is expensive and lacks any real appeal - although the service was good. The hotel is located right next to a subway stop, which is helpful if you plan to use the subway. The main train station,Termini, is within walking distance. If you want to be in the heart of Rome though I would recommend staying near the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps or Piazza del Popolo. We didnt eat at the hotel restaurant, so I cant speak for the food. I liked Rome, but 6 days was too much. If I had to do it over, I would have split up the trip between Rome and Florence (perhaps a day or two in Umbria or Tuscany).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hov50
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness and comfort of the hotel. The front desk staff was always helpful and very friendly. We used the concierge service for a few recommendations for restaurants and such and were again very pleased. The only problem we had was with the restaurant food there. Breakfast, lunch and dinner were completely inedible. Our first night we decided to do room service since we were exhausted from the flight and the time change. Our group had 5 people with 3 rooms. Not one of us ate our dinner. It was truly disgusting. I am not sure why such a nice hotel could have such bad food in a country that is known for it's cuisine. The location is pretty central to most of the attractions and cabs are in abundance for the more distant places. Cab rides are not to be missed. They are heart stopping and exciting.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: dinninwi
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very good. We had two rooms and they gave us adjacent rooms as requested. They upgraded the second one to DeLuxe which was a nice touch. The rooms were large and well equipped in terms of bathroom/bar/storage space. You wont find flat screen TVs but we werent here to watch TV. Service was good from reception and concierge. Happy to recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & Very Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: lbasora
Reviews.Content: We started our European Vacation at the Exedra. This was the nicest and most luxurious hotel that I have ever stayed at. (I travel a lot for work and usually stay in nice resorts). The hotel was pricey but worth every euro. We arrived at the Exedra at 9am from a redeye from NY and they allowed us to checkin and rest. The service from the Concierge (Salvatore) was wonderful and very helpful. We liked all of his recommendations. Breakfast in the morning had a wide arrange of food.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking Soul”
Reviews.Author: Foodie1947
Reviews.Content: I should have listened to other reviewers. I was captivated by the external appearance of the Exedra - it looks wonderful from the outside on the internet and in reality. My husband and I liked the location and used the metro from time to time, which was located near the front of the hotel. However, from the moment we arrived at the front desk it became apparent the hotel lacked personality. I have never encountered such an indifferent reception person as the chap who dealt with our booking. No smile, no welcome, just a curt 'next' and that was as warm as it got. Questions were answered with a minimal response and insufficient information. When we arrived in our room I went straight to the window to see if we had the same view as some of the Trip Advisor posters and sure enough I was confronted by a view of the airconditioning system. I immediately phoned the front desk and asked for a room with a better view and was told that we had already been upgraded and it would cost more to have a view. So be warned, if you want to look at anything other than a wall or an airconditioning system, you will have to pay extra. Obviously I wasn't as forceful as other posters, so we stayed where we were. In fact, we weren't in our room long enough to look out the window anyway. The room was very comfortable and the bathroom a good size - it was all very nice, however, try as we might it was almost impossible to find any information on amenities in the hotel, restaurants, bars or the pool area. My husband asked reception for a mini bar price list, which after a three night stay, failed to eventuate. We came to the conclusion their policy must be - if you have to ask, you can't afford it. We stayed at the Exedra prior to an organised tour around Italy and when we moved to the Bernini Bristol which was part of our tour, the reception was totally different. The staff were lovely, showed us to our room, couldn't have been more pleasant or helpful. The rooms at the Bernini were not as large as the Exedra, but I would trade a large room in a heartless, cold hotel for a smaller room in a place with warmth and personality any day.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for Rome”
Reviews.Author: Rickylionel
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights after cruise. Room good quality, but hopeless telephone system as others have commented on. You can not contact reception! Odd sort of ground floor restauarant and basr area, with tables outside adjoining a cinema complex and a few yards from a McDonalds which tends to distract from its five star tag. The ground floor reception is, as seen on website, very impressive. However no chairs for guests to relax on if you have to wait for anyone and the whole area seems a bit sterile which is a pity. It has potential but no warmth or atmosphere at all - shame. Walking distance to most attractions although possibly not as central as some other five star hotels. taxi's were easy to get even though the door men at every opportunity tried to sell us the hotel limo's service to take us but at greatly enhanced rates compared to a normal taxi. In all, not one of the great five star hotels of Rome but a reasonable choice for a business or short stay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: IImatty_c
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay in Rome! me and my girlfriend stayed for four nights in September 08 in a deluxe room. The only reason for not giving it a rating of 5 is because no hotel is ever perfect! well I haven't found one yet anyway. but the exedra is close enough. The exedra has a metro station right outside the door which is perfect for travelling, and just around the corner is the main train station from the airports so no need to worry about expensive taxis or getting scammed. also this is great because it doesn't actually matter where the hotel is (even though its in a great location in the centre of Rome) in Rome there is two metro lines which take you to every location/hot spot and even have everything in English for you (signs, ticket machines etc...) The room I stayed in with my girlfriend was great! it was cleaned twice a day (mid day and once if you wanted in the afternoon to get your room ready for when you got back so you could go straight to sleep! even the curtains being shut for you) the hotel is in great condition and staff are very very helpful, every member we come across talking English. The food and drink is expensive but only if your not used to paying these kind of prices! for the quality and service you get I would say that it was about right. the food is cooked to perfection in the restaurant and from room service. They will make anything all you have to do is ask.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KandPSouthsea_UK
Reviews.Content: We wanted somewhere nice and luxurious for our stay in Rome as we were getting married. We chose the Exedra because we really wanted a hotel with a pool as we knew it was going to be hot. Hotels with pools are limited in Rome. Although it was much more than we had ever paid for a hotel room before we splashed out because of the occasion and we were not disappointed. We got a rate through emailing the hotel which included breakfast (the rates we found on various websites didn't offer breakfast) We advised at time of booking that we were getting married and asked if we could be considered for an upgrade if available. We got the train from FCO airport to Romes Termini Station. Very easy and much cheaper than taxi. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Station. On arrival we discovered that we had been upgraded to a bigger room with a view out onto Via Nazionale. The bathroom was luxurious (although small chip in the bath)Slippers, bath robes and lovely toiletries. The bed was big enough for 6 people. A lounge area with sofa and a really high ceiling with huge chandelier. The room was decorated beautifully. When we arrived we immediately checked out the pool area. Small but adequate, with great views - (it got quite crowded at times) On returning to our room we found a bottle of bubbly had been left for us. Later, that evening when we got back we found red rose petals in the shape of a heart left on our bed with our slippers either side of the bed on a mat. Nothing was too much for the staff at this hotel. The reception staff, concierge, porters, cleaners were super polite and helpful. We cannot wait to spend our 1st anniversary here next year. I cannot rate this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jill09
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during a work related conference. The location is fabulous, about a 10 min walk if that from the central train station. In addition you can easily walk to the Colliesum, Spanish Steps, etc. The rooms are very large, ours had at least an 18 foot ceiling. Breakfast was included which was one step up from a continental one. I would stay here again if in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: whereyougoingnext
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that this is a 5 star hotel. If you are expecting to be pampered and fussed over by the staff you will be dissapointed. The staff are very professional and they pride themselves on being discrete. When you need them they are available and helpful. We stayed here for 7 nights in August and had no complaints about the room, the service or hotel facilities. The hotel gave us an upgraded room from a standard to superior room when we checked in. We met the hotel manager on at least 4 occassions around the hotel and each time he enquired if we were having a good time and if our room was good. He gave us his business card the first time we met and remembered he had met us before on the other occassions. The air condidtioning was the best we have experienced in any 5 star hotel, easy to alter and kept a constant temp with very little noise. The pool is deceptive on the hotel images (smaller than) and quite shallow. There is a forced water jet that is designed to swim against (like an excercise bike, you don't go anywhere) it's clean, not busy and not too cold, it's not a critism,of the hotel just don't expect too much and you will be happy with the set up. There are approximately 10 beds around the corner to sun bathe and we managed to secure 2 everyday when we returned from sightseeing without any problems. So for a city center hotel you have spacious, clean, cool rooms, a pool and somewhere to sunbathe. Many options for eating and drinking, although with the exchange rate and food costs rising- it worked out expensive. Via Veneto is 10 min walk away for guaranteed quality food every day. Environmentally friendly (for a 5 star) lights were all energy saving, the key system turned everything on/off as appropriate. Shampoos etc... were not thrown away everyday, new ones were left when necessary and the usual with towels. We had a superb experience here and would recomend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Exedra”
Reviews.Author: BFC333
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Exedra prior to a joining a Med cruise. The hotel is ideally situated and all of the major sites are easily accessed either on foot or using the metro located adjacent to the hotel. Our party had reserved three rooms and all were allocated upgraded delux rooms on arrival with myself allocated a junior suite. What can I say - all of the rooms were perfect in every way being clean and comfortable whilst the suite was totally luxurious! We found all of the the staff to be polite and extremely helpful, despite our lack of the Italian language - although we did try with the basics. There is something for everyone at the breakfast buffet - all served in relaxed surroundings. The roof terrace bar made for a very pleasant and relaxing evening after touring the sites. We were able to enjoy another perspective of Rome by night whilst enjoying a cocktail (or two) - although the prices are not cheap they are worth it for the atmosphere alone. Overall a very enjoyable stay and well worth the price we paid - would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “What can you expect from a 5 star hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Getgerald
Reviews.Content: What can you expect from a 5 star hotel for more than 300 Euro/night? I staid there for 4 night from July 27-31. There are a couple of good things about the hotel. It is very close to the train station and everything else is in close proximity or can be easily reached. Let's first start with the rooms... the room I got and the other ones did not look any better are just small (room 281) and just fits the bed, 2 nightstands and a desk with chair. This is still acceptable (same as the minibar prices: Small coke & euro), but I am expecting a little bit more from a 5 star hotel than dirty/damaged faucets or a chipped porcellain soap holder. Ok, the funny thing was the toilet. I am 6'4" and unfortunately had to sit a little bit sideways on the toilet, because it was directly built next to the sink. Ok, and it would have needed a Houdini to reach the toilet paper :-)). That's the room. If you look a little bit outside your room and do not use the elevator, you will notice that the carpet on the stairs needs urgently either to be exchanged or deep cleaning. Dirty cups, glasses and half eaten Croissants sit in the VIP Lounge for hours without being noticed. Overall, it is a nice hotel, but there might be better hotels for that money

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Camella5
Reviews.Content: The reviews have always been mixed about the Exedra, so we were a little leery. We had stayed there once before about three years ago and it was nice, but it was a short stay and we didn't use many of the services. This time, we stayed for three nights and had a lovely junior suite overlooking the fountain of Piazza della Repubblica and the Baths of Diocletian. The room was wonderful and the bath was spacious and clean. We had a little trouble regulating the thermostat at first, but then figured it out. The staff was professional, courteous and efficient. The breakfast, which was included, was very good and plentiful. We found the location great because the Rome metro is right outside the hotel, so getting around was quick and easy. We enjoyed our stay very much and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: VivienTO
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 335 the first week of April this year. I was bracing myself for a cramped room for four nights. Thank goodness, the room was spacious enough for two adults and a teenager. I liked the separate bath and shower areas. The room was accessed through a meandering hallway from the elevator. The room-elevator distance was enough to help burn a few calories from the fresh mozzarella served in the breakfast buffet. I must commend the guest service staff for patiently explaining the Rome weather forecast to me. I was insisting on being given a probability percentage of rain. Location wise, it was perfect. Practically all major sites were within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Lets put the record straight”
Reviews.Author: lmaldives
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first visit to Rome. A gift for my husbands 50th birthday and included a first visit to the opera to see/hear Andrea Bocceli. The hotel was grand, the staff polite and yes they did answer the telephone and greated us with a smile. The reception were totally on the ball! we were checked in immediately and guided to the lift etc. Our room was not the largest and there was a view out of the back of the hotel. This was perfect for us as it meant it was quiet ! the air conditioning worked beautifully which was needed in the 30 degree plus heat! The bed was fabulous and the bathroom and bedroom were spotless, with great gowns, slippers plus laods of towells. Dont use the mini fridge as this is expensive - as you would expect in a 5 star hotel. The information desk were more than helpful and advised us of the best times etc to visit places such as the Vatican and also gave us maps. I cannot imagine who would not like this hotel it is 5 star. I have travelled accross the world and this hotel along with its staff were up there with the best. My only complaint is that the pool is not a pool but more of a pond. There are people eating and drinking in very close proximity and would take a stronger woman than me to disrobe in front of them. Please dont book this hotel thinking that you can cool off in the pool - stay in the room turn on the air con and relax. PS try est, est, est for pizza it is the best. PPS Hotel can't be that bad as Andrea Bocceli was staying there - we saw him!

Reviews.Title: “Hard beds, missing menus, no answer at front desk”
Reviews.Author: garyfong
Reviews.Content: American Express Centurion travel recommended this hotel to me two years ago, and the stay back then was awesome. I had a great room overlooking the Piazza Republicana. The hotel is opulent, in a grand building, and everything has a freshness of new construction mixed with old world charm. On the surface, it approaches five star opulence. The electronics in the room are dated (regular TV's, about 15" in size) and the lights are all environmentally correct fluorescent - which makes the room have a "classroom" type of ambience due to the strobing of the lighting. Here's where it falls short: 1) the beds are rock hard and very uncomfortable. Sleeping on it makes you feel really beat up in the morning, and you find yourself shifting around a lot to get comfortable. 2) The menus were missing. When I called room service to ask, they said that "they didn't have enough for the whole hotel", and he offered to read me each menu item one by one. I asked for a menu instead, and he said they would have to search vacant rooms to find one, and this would take a while. So we just winded up ordering club sandwiches, and they were very good. Secondly, the front desk never answers. There are two buttons on your phone - one is for "guest service" the 2nd is for room service. Guest service never answers, and room service can't help you because there are no menus!
