I wound up calling from an outside line using SKYPE to see if I could get anybody to answer (as in - prospective guest) and there was no answer. Tried for hours - no answer. This hotel is very spread out so to walk down to the front desk would be a drag. I can only imagine if there was a flood in the toilet or something, what would you do? I'm sure this is a temporary thing, but there is construction in the lobby with a lot of hammering, and it is very very loud. Oh also - it took about 45 minutes to get the bags to our room. The nice lady at the front desk took our claim check, so we couldn't find a way to tell them which bags were ours. It is a shame because this hotel is so beautiful. It could probably be one of the nicest hotels in Rome if it had really good hospitality management in place.

Reviews.Title: “La Dolce Vita”
Reviews.Author: tululah
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite swanky! Honestly it lovely. Our room was just beautiful - the decor was opulent with out being EltonJohn and the staff were very helpful and spoke English which is a bonus if you get tongue-tied trying to speak Italian like I do! I thought we would be slightly away from everything but the Metro station is right outside the hotel and the bus service is fantastic too. The only problem, and it is not the hotel's fault is that the taxis tended to take us the wrong/long way round to get back there of an evening. I'm not sure if this is a regular trick for tourists or just if you are staying at a 4* or 5* hotel but it is probably worth while keeping an eye on them.

Reviews.Title: “Just Amazing”
Reviews.Author: cecastella
Reviews.Content: Amazing Palace classic architure, with lavish lobby and superb room. Top location on the Piazza della Republica, with a lovely view on it from our room (with balcony). Spa center is very good, managed by a very professional and nice team, with private steam room and jacuzzin if needed: I just regret not having enjoyed the pool on the roof but view from it was, again Amazing. Once again, service and kindness of the people was on top level and I've particularily appreciated how they could arrange a booking in one of the most sought after Roma's restaurant on a Saturday evening: good job guys ;-) I was already fond of Roma before, now I'm turning absolute fan...

Reviews.Title: “Bravo Exedra and Salvatore!”
Reviews.Author: stevemoschetta
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as the last leg of Italy tour. Absolutely first-rate accommodations - very, very luxe. Staff was attentive and friendly. The concierge, Salvatore, is to be especially commended; he made us feel very welcome and treated us warmly no matter our request. The hotel is well located near the metro which made sightseeing easy. The hotel is located at the Repubblica Nazionale which is a very, very impressive location, but unfortunately (and this is not a fault of the hotel) the plaza needs better upkeep from the city - it could be cleaner and free of transients at night. If not for this, my rating would be excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Port827
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and the location perfect. There is a metro station right next to it, and some of the must-see sites in Rome are nearby. But the hotel staff were unfriendly and uncaring, especially at the restaurant where they served breakfast. I even met one who was rude and impolite. I was carrying my luggages on my way out of the hotel to get a taxi to the airport, and the lobby staff did not even bother to offer any assistance. I have stayed in other five-star hotels where the service was excellent and the rates were more reasonable. This hotel is definitely not worth its price, and I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but not very cozy/warm...”
Reviews.Author: PiggyLvr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an easy 10 minute walk from the Termini and it's out of a movie as it rests on the historic Piazza del Reppublica. The lobby is gorgeous and the staff friendly. The complaint would be that the beds were hard as rocks and our entire corporate team dreamt of chiropractic visits! It also was not easy to navigate if you were not placed in the main section of the hotel as some. We were placed in a wing that required a lift to stairs and then along a corridor that resembled a barn - very odd, yet still breathtaking (not easy with suitcases though). The bathroom was spacious with a bidet, shower and separate soaking tub (spent many post-tourist days in that fantastic tub!), but while the room was large it was very dark and even with all of the lights on, found it difficult to work or read the paper. Our balcony was an odd four-walled cement prison like patio. The walls were 8-10 feet high (so no view), just am opening o the sky - again, odd and not expected. No way to really enjoy that ... not sure for the money that we would stay there again, but it definitely was not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Not so keen”
Reviews.Author: Lucyluu
Reviews.Content: 3rd stop on our honeymoon tour and we weren't so keen. The receptionist girl was amazingly miserable. Room big but no hotel info at all - we were kept awake on one night of the three by a party they were having in the rooftop gardens. There is no phone no. for reception anywhere. Eventually by guessing we found it and they couldn't have cared less that we couldn't sleep for the pounding music. The location is convenient but, as with most cities, the station area is far from the most salubrious in town. The hotel pool is a nice change but it was small, busy with views over residential rooftops and satellite dishes. Restaurants were average with not-ideal service; we struggled to get some wine on one lunch. If you want something that looks glam, then this is it. If you want something that is actually glam, it isn't. I will steer clear in future. Breakfast was perfunctory and pretty average. Nicest thing was that the cleaning staff left a lovely petal heart on our bed with some candles.

Reviews.Title: “A Great break”
Reviews.Author: Birchdene
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend to watch the rugby. The hotel is ideally situated in a beautiful but busy piazza. The Metro is just outside as is a large taxi rank. The taxi drivers were always helpful and pleasant although the driving is an experience!. Rooms are very spacious and with ours facing the rear of the building it was very quiet. All staff were excellent friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good with a varied offering. We did not eat at the restaurant but bar drinks were expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: dckfree
Reviews.Content: Amazing stay. Staff is polite and caring. Rooms are huge, hotel is beautiful, close to everything. Pure Luxury. Made our stay in Rome just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaneyJaneEngland
Reviews.Content: Felt I just had to write and say what a brilliant time my husband and I had whilst staying at the Boscolo Exedra in Rome. The room was amazing, the bed large and very comfortable, the marble bathroom clean and with lovely toiletries. We always like the start the day with a hearty breakfast and the Exedra allowed us to do that, plenty of choice, excellent quality, we even found ourselves eating mozarella, rocket and tomatoes for breakfast (delicious), topped off with champagne. The concierge (Nico) was most helpful with his advice on how to get to the Vatican. All in all, one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. Great position, great food and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: OrganizedTourist
Reviews.Content: My husband, my parents and I loved the hotel. The rooms are spacious, clean and very nice. It's located in a great area near some good restaurants and the outside of the hotel is beautiful! The concierge was friendly but I wouldn't recommend going on any of their guided tours. They use a company called Green Line Tours which wasn't that great and they kept taking us to places to "shop" so we wasted a bunch of time not really seeing the sights. We actually found better tours just waiting in line in front of the Colosseum with someone asking us if we were interested in joining. It was a little shady but it turned out to be better than the tours that the hotel recommended. And the concierge also recommended a great restaurant in terms of food but horrible service. The food at the hotel was not good. We had breakfast there and paid 30 Euros per person. It was super expensive and not worth it for the money. The dinner was also extremely expensive and the food was not good, definitely not worth it for the price. The service was slow for both housekeeping and room service. It took an hour for us to get coffee, tea and desserts and another hour for us to request for a roll of toilet paper. Overall, I think it's a great place to stay just not a great place to eat at or to expect great service. I would still stay there again if I ever go back to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but definitely not perfect”
Reviews.Author: sjp27
Reviews.Content: The Boscolo is a luxury hotel with a prestigious name. During my stay I was treated very kindly and was impressed with the hotel lobby, location, and reputation. However, and I'm not sure if European plumbing is to blame, but the water during my shower kept turning really hot then really cold, etc. It was so annoying. Also, the carpeting in the room was a little aged. The gym was really small and lacked equipment and was only open limited hours. Overall, it was a great stay but I would stay someplace else next time; however, the Exedra has a reputation like no other.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best”
Reviews.Author: hogmonay
Reviews.Content: I have spent some time looking at different views on this hotel just thought i would add mine i was lucky enough to stay on 07/01/07 and i thought it was one of the best hotels i have ever stayed in .and i have stayed in some of the best in the world inc st george and ritz paris excelsior and hassler rome I think diffrent people get diffrent things out of hotels first if its a honneymoon or birthday ect your expections are very high but as with all hotels you have to tell them they do not read minds.second a lot of people book through agents who not only offer the moon but charge you 20% extra for it and dont tell the hotel your special requests so first tip book direct with hotel 2nd remember what you pay ie i have taken prices for a test date in january Hassler 450 euro de Russie 390 euro Excelsior 341 euro EXEDRA 270 EURO a diffrence of 180 euro per night again the exedra comes out very good value for a 5 star hotel next the staff I think you get what you ask for instance if you thank them when thay give you directions ect it would help i have watched people tell staff ;; get me a taxi;; with no please or thank you or walking up to the desk and butting into a conversation between staff do you never think that they may be dealing with a costomer on the phone again i have wittnested this so be pleasant it payes in the end by the way my job I organising conference' s and eventsall over the world just out of intrest Im staying in the exedra for 1 week in january again so i would as they say be putting my money where my mouth is m watt

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - a bit too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Radchap
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! The service is great too. Although please make sure you ask for a better room. The initial room that they gave us was too small. My only problem during the stay was that the Internet connection sucked. How can someone not have a wireless internet and steady service in this day and age? That too at 20euros a day. ( its free , fast and excellent at Radisson SAS next door). The hotel was a bit too lavish and expensive. If you are happy with a reasonable luxurious place with good service, there are other cheaper but decent options in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Classic”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrotterYYZ
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Exedra for two weeks. We really enjoyed it! The room was large, clean and very inviting. The bed was superb! The staff were amazing - especially Roberta at the front desk. We were treated (and felt like) royalty. We were greeted by name everyday (small but very important touch!). The pool was a delight and the bar staff was more than a pleasure to deal with. Everyone was extremely helpful and made our Roman holiday the best we've ever had! I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. Our only regret was having to leave. We will ONLY stay at the Exedra should we decide to visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeeLee76
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Experience. The hotel is beautiful on the inside and outside. The staff was very attentive and helpful. The 'hotel manager' made sure we were well taken care of. We arrived early and our rooms were not yet ready. They apologized and treated us to drinks and snacks while we waited. The rooms were nice. The beds were comfortable. There were some stains on the carpet, but nothing you really paid too much attention to. Besides the stains, the rooms were kept clean. The roof top terrace was very nice with heaters. The breakfast was fine. The location was good. We had no A/C, but we kept the windows open at night. We would definitely go back and definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Honeymoon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GreenStarfish
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights on our honeymoon. It's a great location - just a 10 min walk with luggage from the train station and within walking distance to most major sites. It's a gorgeous hotel and really makes you feel special. The downside is that because you're in Rome, you're rarely in your room long enough to enjoy it. We stayed in a rather small room though - but it was quiet and secluded. Go across the circle to see the plain looking building -it's a church designed by Michaelangelo. I'd likely not stay here again though since it is rather pricey for how little we were in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Really 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: znarf
Reviews.Content: Everything perfect. Deluxe Room - understating design, clear, stylish colours and decor. Large bathrooms. Very high minibar prices. Tiny but beautiful lobby, friendly staff at reception. Tazio restaurant very friendly staff, excellent but expensive food. good wine list. Perfect location for a walk in the historic centers. What do You want more? PS: Ridicolous pool area?!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, couldn't have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: Kimmy1982Uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel in August this year with my boyfriend and it was a truely fantastic experience. Room was gorgeous, huge comfortable beds, beautiful marble bathrooms. Not once did we see the cleaning staff but they came in everyday...fantastic. Didn't eat at the hotel as expensive but lots of great resturants surrounding it. Also heard breakfast is abit of a rip off so I'd suggest you head next door to Maccy D's and grab a coffee and a pastry for 5 euros (this is for 2!!) Perfect location for exploring Rome, everything is about a 10-15 minute walk away. Suggest getting the open top buses, brilliant and get to see so much more. Only quibble was the roof terrace...beautiful and pool perfect for a dip so you can cool down, but you can never get on the sun loungers. It would have been nice to relax in the sun but everytime we went up there they were taken, have to point out there are only 8, so you end up having to sit on chairs which aren't very comfortable. This really isn't a big deal in the grand scheme of things. I have no compliants about this hotel whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: HonestJohn99
Reviews.Content: Got a good rate in this hotel and was very satisfied with standard and lcoation. Walking distance from train station (roma termini) which is very handy and is ideally situated to explore the rest of the city. Only stayed for 1 night but got to see Collesium (also walking distance from hotel). Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Great location, Very Average Service - Here are my tips...”
Reviews.Author: SWestonSW1
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome for a Bank Holiday Mini Break. Good hotel, great big room with huge bed. Fabulous finish to the room, and we really felt like we were in Rome thanks to the sympathetic decor. Excellent location as we were able to get the train from the airport to Termini Station and walk from there. Was much faster at 30mins transfer and approx £10pp. We were also pretty much able to walk anywhere in Rome from the hotel (not in heels though!) The roof area is 'bijou' shall we say. The pool and sunbathing area are very small and I wouldn't recommend this hotel if sunbathing is a big part of your agenda. Perhaps the Radisson Es might be more appropriate. Though it is nice that they have this space if you did want to catch a couple of hours in the sun/pool. You might have to wait a couple of hours for one of the 8 sun loungers though. (There are also some chairs and cabanna sytle seats available) My breakfast tip would be: Do not order breakfast here at 30 Euros pp, instead wander down to Tazio which is still part of the hotel, sir outside and order a couple of cappucinos (or any coffee or tea) and they bring a little dish with mini croissants and pain au chocolats. Plenty to fill a hole until lunch! Service frankly is abominable. But then it's not exactly super high in the rest of Rome either. Leave your temper at home, bring a patience cloak and do as the romans do... When in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Almost a 5 star...”
Reviews.Author: jacktripper
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights at the Exedra on August 25. I have found what a previous review said to be true. The carpet in the hotel is filthy. It gives a negative impression. However, I thought our room , (a superior) was beautiful. It had great linens, high ceilings with lots of architectural details. The bathroom was large and beautiful..all the bells and whistles. The prices at the hotel for food are astromonical though. The breakfast at 30 Euros was a joke. A glass of juice, small pastry and coffee. That's it. Oh, and If you order it through room service, tack on another 8 euros service fee. RIdiculous. We had a package in which this was included and we were still annoyed by it. All in all the location was fantastic...a short walk to Termini station if you would like to take a train back to the airport, or just explore around Rome. My advice would be to book through the hotel direct and try to get some type of package which includes the dinner and lunch and breakfast. It was worth the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great 5-star hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: case29
Reviews.Content: The Boscolo Exedra was the last stop in our italian honeymoon before heading back to the US. We only stayed 2 nights/3 days but this was our third trip to Rome. Our room was a deluxe room with king-size bed and a great view of the plaza in front of the hotel. Hotel staff was very helpful and made really great recommendations for restaurants within walking distance to the hotel. One of the things that sold us on this hotel was the rooftop swimming pool. It was great taking a swim with Rome as your backdrop. The pool was small (more of a lap pool rather than full-size), but when we went (late afternoon swim post sight-seeing), only 2 other people were in sight. The location made it easy to walk to several famous landmarks and shopping. Afternoon tea in the lobby was nice after a day on the town.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel but…..”
Reviews.Author: Tradewinds09
Reviews.Content: It’s really a great Hotel & the location is just perfect but some aspects really need to be improved: Customer relation management: We celebrate my Birthday at the first day of the stay: no wishes during check in from the staff. A bottle of wine had been delivered to our room after check in, but from who?! Family, Hotel, Friends?? No one from the staff could answer the question, one day later they found the compliment card from the friend who ordered the bottle!! If you don’t want the service staff coming into your room at 09:00 am to check the mini bar or at 5:00 pm to prepare the bed for the night put the sign do not disturb at the door!!! Breakfast It’s definitely not a 5* level, for that price 30 €… it’s not worth Rooms We had a deluxe with a wonderful view, the standards & the superior can have a limited view. Wall to wall carpet in corridor & room should be changed Swimming pool on the terrace Small but cute, the terrace for sun bathing is a disaster, broken chairs, no parasol, the gazebos curtain are broken & dirty. Definitely not a 5* level Suggestions for you Rent a Vespa a the back of the Hotel (Bici&Baci)& experience the real Dolce Vita feeling, Visit Fontana di Trevi at 07:00 am, without tourists…what an experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “By far the nicest in Rome”
Reviews.Author: kdburns
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day stay at the Exedra in Rome. Truely a five star hotel. Breakfast was awesome (30 euro) pool refreshing after a hot day of walking. Staff very friendly and accomodating. Only downside is that it is pricey, but definitely worth it. Treat yourself.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT in Every Respect! My best visit!”
Reviews.Author: worldtravel15825
Reviews.Content: My 4th stay at the Boscolo Exedra. I came this trip with my spouse, and we booked the Love & Romance package. This included a Mercedes from and to the airport, early checkin (great for flights from the USA), upgrade if available, champagne and roses in the room, one dinner for two on a three-night stay, a three hour limo tour (Mercedes S-class), and in room continental breakfast. I have to say I enjoyed my prior visits to Exedra, but this visit blew me away. We were upgraded from our reserved Deluxe room (400 sq. feet - I've stayed in these at Exedra before and they are very lux and comfortable) to a Jr. Suite, which is 770 sq. feet on two floors, the second floor being a king size bed loft. A 20 foot tall window looking on the fountain in the plaza (with remote control blinds and drapery), daily breakfast served to us on a cart, in front of the window, and an enormous bathroom with separate shower and tub, all marble. We enjoyed the roof top bar and swimming pool, drinks on the terrace at the plaza level, and the food in the restaurant was really excellent (I usually avoid hotel restaurants, but since it was included in the package took advantage of it and found it spectacular. Besides the great accomodations, what was really fantastic was the welcome and wonderful treatment from the staff throughout the stay. The staff is consistent across visits, and Alberto at the front desk was pleasant and professional, Nico at the concierge/front area was extremely helpful and diligent in suggesting great restaurants and places to visit (and he did not push toward expensive restaurants, rather very authentic and reasonable character places, the head waiter at the restaurant was a really nice guy and very attentive and explanatory (sorry I forget his name!) and the limo driver, Michael, made a special effort to customize the tour and show us unique sites in Rome that you wouldn't normally know of - his pride in his city was very evident. The young women at the rooftop bar were very pleasant, and the bell staff and doormen were always there and responsive, as was the housekeeping service on any request. We left Rome for the French Riviera very satisfied, saying how kind and proud the Roman people were, determined to be accomodating and polite, and I received kudos from my spouse for my choice of hotels. I can't imagine how any fault is found with this classic yet modern luxury hotel, staffed by really friendly and accomodating people. In the past I have stayed at other hotels in Rome and have never found a better hotel than the Exedra, again, a comfortable oasis in the "Eternal City". We are renting a house in Tuscany with friends from France next summer, but going out of our way to start the trip with two nights again at the Exedra.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Claireylou24
Reviews.Content: Usually I don't bother writing reviews (but I do use them for prospecting holidays etc) but after reading the last review off this amazing hotel I felt obliged too! I stayed here in December 2006 for my boyfriends birthday and thought it was fantastic. In fact I would go as far to say that it is the best hotel that I have ever been to (a mean feet considering that I am quite a traveller). We arrived at the hotel and were greeted by a bell boy who took our luggage up to our room while we checked in. The check in staff were lovely, prompt and professional. They even made a point of wishing my boyfriend happy birthday 2 days in to our stay which I thought was very thoughtful. The room was great, the only down side was that we had no view what so ever it was literally a brick wall but the bathroom was gorgeous and the bedrooms were also fab. I thought that the power showers were particularly good as was the lighting (a girl needs good lighting!). The beds were also massive and sooo comfortable. The bar downstairs is VERY EXPENSIVE and to be honest we should of gone somewhere else but sitting there watching the world go by under the patio heater with a hot chocolate made us forget that we had just paid £7 each! As for people saying the hotel staff were rude the truth is the Italians were all slightly that way but as the stay progressed we began not to take it personally. Overall the hotel is expensive but I would stay there again and again - funds permitting!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MuchLoveForTravel
Reviews.Content: Tastefully decorated hotel in central area. Excellent location - near the hop-on-bus station, train station, restaurants, sights, etc. Service was good...but little pretentious. Room and bathroom are roomy. We even had in-room dinner with a table rolled into the room. However, we were charged $12US for a bottle of water so it may be a good idea to stop by elsewhere to load up on the water bottles. There was a grocery store nearby (about 10-15 min. walk). Would recommend this hotel for travelers looking for a central location and a nice room stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: PirateLola
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have been to Rome many times and every time we’d walk past this hotel my boyfriend would say, “Next time we come to Rome I’m going to take you to that hotel.” Well his birthday is in November and for our trip I decided to book this hotel as a little surprise for him. Where do I start? Staff were rude and abrupt during check-in, we were offered no help with our bags, the room was nice but nothing special (double bed, ordinary TV, decent bathroom) with a terrible view on to a side street off the piazza. We didn’t book breakfast with the hotel as we felt it was overpriced at €30 each. The Exedra is described as a luxury hotel, well we certainly didn’t get a luxury service. I have received better service from cheaper hotels all over the world. Don’t make the same mistake I did, only stay here if you’ve more money than sense.

Reviews.Title: “unstuffy luxury”
Reviews.Author: ksm100
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Exedra in Feburary for 4 nights for my boyfriend's birthday. I researched a lot of hotels before picking this one, and was very happy with my choice. The hotel is luxurious, but not in a stuffy way, and the staff were all friendly and approachable. The location is not particularly central to the sights, but it was within walking distance to everything (other than the Vatican, which was a bit too far for us and we hopped on a bus). The lobby was lovely, and there were 2 bar areas on the ground floor - unfortunately the bar prices appeared to put everyone off drinking there, as we popped in each night for a drink on our return from dinner, and were the only customers each time. The room was a standard double, and we felt large for a European city centre hotel. An absolutely huge bed, very high ceilings and luxurious contemporary furnishings. The bathroom was also a good size, with 2 sinks which always scores highly with me! Breakfast was included in our rate, but there did appear to be some confusion with the staff as to what was included. There is a breakfast buffet set up, with a great selection of cold items and not so great selection of hot items. We ordered omelettes 2 mornings, and had to pay an additional 22E one morning, but nothing the next, even when I queried it. coffee was good and refreshed regularly. We had 2 restaurant reccommendations from the front desk, one really great (Target, just around the corner) and one not so good (can't remember the name) Overall, I felt the hotel offered the level of luxury and service I was expecting.

Reviews.Title: “Exedra : + & -”
Reviews.Author: GeGa
Reviews.Content: The Exedra Hotel, Rome. A beautiful hotel. Great room – high ceiling and I mean high, very spacious, very clean, well appointed, big bathroom, safe, etc. The negatives; for a hotel of this standard the shower in the marble bathroom had a rather flimsy curtain and it was not properly fitted, hence the water sprayed into the bathroom. The bathroom was very large but it has to be one of the worst laid out bathrooms I have ever seen in a hotel of this standard. It is expensive to stay here, I knew that and I wanted to stay in a 5 star hotel in Rome. However the cost of breakfast was a jaw dropping €30, for that money I would expect a pretty good breakfast not just coffee, juice and croissant. We crossed the square to a small snack place with plenty of seating and enjoyed great breakfasts for €15 for two! One of the people who worked at the concierge desk, Nico, was great – very helpful in every way. The reception staff were, let’s say, ok!! Housekeeping service in the room was fair – I had to go out one day to get extra shampoo from the maids cart, she had been and had not replaced the empty bottles in the bathroom. The bathrobes disappeared on day 2 of our 5 day visit??? Overall I enjoyed staying in this hotel and would return; it is in a good location and has great connections - Metro station outside door and Termini around the corner as well as the starting point for the open top tour busses. It also has a good terrace out front where they serve great cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “overrated”
Reviews.Author: springingahead
Reviews.Content: the plusses: extremely beautiful lobby & furnishings, wide spacious well-lit stairways and hallways, location is super-convenient. the minusses: in spite of its convenience this location doesnt capture the full "ambiance" of Rome that you get in the pedestrian areas. The hotel is way over-staffed and you get the feeling that they are all falling over each other to get a tip - at the ground level bar the service is glacially-slow, the second glass of wine never came and then they brought the wrong bill, which took about 20 mns to correct, after which the waiter must have had a moment of enlightenment and asked if I still wanted the second glass of wine (about 45 mns had passed!) The next morning when I was on the way to the airport, the gentleman who helped me with the bags (he had to outsmart the other two porters to get to my bags) looked at the handful of change (it was about 4 euro) that I gave him like I had put a dead fish in his hand. Once you get 20 cms off the property, the street is severly littered with trash, plastic bags, empty cigarette packs and assorted junk that the 3 doormen didn't even seem to notice. Could be a very nice hotel but it's a phony.

Reviews.Title: “Business Travellers: Avoid”
Reviews.Author: agro
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, in a good location, very nicely decorated, but ... Business Travellers: Avoid!! The business centre was closed for a few days - how is that possible? If you have to re-decorate the walls, can you move the computers and the printers to another room? I asked for a shirt to be pressed overnight - because I arrived in the evening and my clean shirt in the bag needed some pressing - guess what, no such service offered overnight? Thanks god I had a late morning meeting the next day (10 am) so they were able to press the shirt at 8 am the next morning, but what if I had to run out of the hotel at 8 am?? I know these things are not relevant for the tourists, they would not even notice them, but for a business travellers they can change their life... Last but not least, a few imperfections here and there, there was no phone numbers list in the room, the shower jet wasn't perfect, the TV set was a bit small (les than 20 inches), and the view was not what I was expecting in Rome, the window faced an external ladder made of heavy metal - I wonder if that was the only room available in the whole hotel!! Overall, a very nice hotel, I would have enjoyed the stay if I were a tourist, the terrace looks amazing, but would not return back as a tourist

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Experience!”
Reviews.Author: SJNM
Reviews.Content: As this was our first visit to Rome and we wanted to see the new year in in style, after lengthy research, we splashed out and booked a Deluxe Room at the Exedra Hotel. We arrived at the hotel late in the evening to be told that they had no Deluxe Rooms left and that they were upgrading us to the Presidential Suite...wow whee!! This was out of this world. An apartment style suite over 2 floors, we were engulfed in pure luxury with 3 balconies, 3 bathrooms including huge jacuzzi tub, queen size bed, open plan living area which even included an 8 seat dining table and fully stocked bar. Our whole experience at the hotel including the service was fantastic, we couldn't fault it. We will definately be visiting again, although somehow I doubt we'll be as lucky with any future upgrades. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “A New year Treat...shame about the cocktails”
Reviews.Author: DINKYorkshire
Reviews.Content: It only seems fair that after the hours i pour over other peoples reviews on this site for Weekends away to full blown round the world tours I finally put my money where my mouth is and write a review. Iam a married thirtysomething with no kids and a lack of any real concept of the value of money. Im not loaded but I dont mind spending what I have. The Exedra was taken from a list of about 3 or 4 other 5stars in Rome that we decided to go to celebrate New Year and our second Wedding anniversary. Russie and Eden were booked up and the Exedra offered a better room with a New Year gala dinner thrown in so thats what we went for. Arranged for a car from the airport (Ciampino) which made a whole lot of sense particulalry as the queues for the Bus transfers looked ugly and the taxis werent too numerous. Arrived to a fabulous looking Crescent of a building facing the Pza de republica ( a big roundabout) . Checkin was a breeze and the customer Service director made a point of introducing himself, nice touch. teh room was a junior suite overlooking the roundabout, great views from enormous Windows. The suite was very nice although the upstairs/Mezzanine Lounge area wasnt much used. Dont know how much a normal room is but if you dont spend lots of time in the room maybe not worth the extra for a suite, although the view was great. The New Year gala dinner was great, 7 courses of very well cooked and presented contemporary Italian cuisine. This is the only meal we had at the Hotel but if this is the standard of the kitchen i would guess you are going to eat well here. Entrance lobby and Bar areas are nice places to be. We went to look at the Hassler on the Spanish steps and found it very old fashioned and a bit tired in comparison. Location - Literally 5 mins walk from Termini station ( once you know where you are going). Great for getting on the sightseeing buses that start here (make sure your headphones work before you settle on a seat, its long journey in silence) not so easy coming the other way from the station with luggage unless you know which way you are heading and dont mind dodging Roman Traffic. We caught the Metro once from directly outside the hotel, this has a limited service but is probably the quickest way fo getting you to the Vatican. We also walked down to Piazza Venezia which took about 10-15min of reasonably brisk walking downhill. All in all a great city break over the New Year Period, would recommend the hotel to anyone who likes a bit of luxury without all the stuffiness. Concierge were great recomended a fantastic Seafood restaurant 10 mins taxi ride away ( Hosteria de Pesce) Downsides - There are definetly nicer parts of town, not that its rough necessarily just not much going on and a bit of a trek to go anywhere. We should perhpas have used taxis and Metro more to save our aching feet. One other petty thing is the Cocktail particulalry the Martinis were not that great and a bit light on the alchohol for my taste but if that all i can complain about it cant have been that bad can it.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty good hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Gustafsson
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business in April for three days and it is one of the better hotels I have stayed at in Rome, (this one in comparison to the second Boscolo hotel Aleph, delivers.) However, it is a little pricy which shows the most at the breakfast table and in the bar. But after all it was expected, but sometimes you never experience how pricy it is in a hotel or a restaurant because of the atmosphere and service, that's not the case here. This is a good hotel but the type you have no relationship to but still would recommend, strange isn't it? Peter G

Reviews.Title: “A STUNNING Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hamish11
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Exedra to celebrate my 40th birthday and, based on the reviews that I'd read, I had very high expectations. We booked a Deluxe room as only this grade of room and Junior Suites have a view of the Piazza Della Republica, and this was important to me. The room was probably the best I have ever stayed in - very large and grand with extremely high ceilings, elegant furnishings, a balcony overlooking the Piazza & fountain. The bathroom was good, with marble, double sink, a huge bath, seperate shower cubicle and luxury toiletries. There is probably nothing I could suggest that would make the room any more perfect. The lobby is particularly stunning (I believe that it featured in the movie Oceans 12!) and the Tazio restaurant / champagne bar is classy in a more modern way. I would definitely recommend eating here once during a visit - service is excellent and the food is elegantly presented yet has fairly large portions and is not outrageously priced. Other reports mention extortionate drinks prices but we found them to be OK considering the class of hotel. We both had massages in the Spa, which is a beautifully relaxing and tranquil haven. However, due to the fact that I was expecting perfection, inevitably there were a couple of niggles: - based on the experiences of Tripadvisor reviewers, I had hoped that I may get some 'special' treatment as it was my 40th birthday. Although the receptionist congratulated me on check-in, there was no other token - even a card would have been nice. Previous travellers have talked of champagne, flowers, room upgrades etc. - our package included limo transfers from/to the airport, but the vehicle that collected us on our arrival was actually a mini-bus that smelled badly of smoke - not exactly the luxury arrival that I had expected. The return was better - a small Mercedes car. Strangely, the hotel seems to have it's own luxury limo service but had sub-contracted out our transfers (maybe being on a 'package' meant that we were not as important as other guests?) - No turn down service or scented candles that had been mentioned in other reviews. - Bloody Marys not available in the bar as some of the ingredients had run out. Not what you expect of a 5* hotel, have they not heard of shops? - Room service breakfast card was not replaced on the 2nd day so we went down to eat. We were about to be given an a la carte menu but this was withdrawn once we gave our room number (I guess because our package included breakfast). The guests at the next table were able to order a la carte and, again, I felt like a 2nd class citizen. Buffet breakfast was very good however. - One dinner was included in our package. To enable us to claim this we were required to pass a letter to the maitre d' in the restaurant. Surely this could have been handled in a way which made you feel less like you were 'getting something for nothing' - newspaper did not arrive on the 2nd day - although we had paid well over 1000 Euro for our 2 night package (and added another couple of hundred Euros in extras) I feel that maybe we were treated a little like 'bargain hunters' or 'economy guests'. Some of these are really small niggles and overall the Exedra made for a truly memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SouthwestDC
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 9 days at the Exedra in October, 2004. It was a great hotel--we would definitely stay there again and have recommended it to other people. The room and bathroom were very clean and had been recently redecorated. The room was very elegant. The room had a juliette-style balcony with views of the piazza. Housekeeping was very thorough. The lobby was very grand, and the 2 restaurants and lobby bar were pretty good. The covered arcade in front of the hotel has outdoor seating that is nice to use after dinner. A subway stop was located outside of the hotel, which was great because the sights in Rome are rather far flung--we used the subway system quite a bit. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel--there are places nearby for a light breakfast--located in the covered arcades near the train station. The concierge was helpful in getting us reservations at restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing honeymoon at the Exedra”
Reviews.Author: crippus
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights for our honeymoon from Nov. 22-24th. It was quite simply one of the most beautiful and pleasant hotels anywhere in the world. The conceirge service, spearheaded by Salvatore, is excellent, and the dining options including the restaurant Tazio are outstanding. Our room was spacious beyond belief and absolutely breathtaking. The hotel left a bottle of champagne with a congratulatory note on our honeymoon. The hotel is centrally located, and cannot be recommended enough by myself and my wife. 10 stars if possible. Craig and Elizabeth Davis

Reviews.Title: “Clean Bathroom (??)”
Reviews.Author: GE413648
Reviews.Content: Having checked into this 5* hotel I was surprised to find the toilet base was covered in vomit, I reported it to reception, although it was promptly cleaned they were not very apologetic. The location and building are very good but overall service is lacking for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay in Luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: KTEN
Reviews.Content: I found the staff friendly and efficient. When we arrived at the hotel we were upgraded to a deluxe room. The room was very spacious with a view a balcony view of the piazza. The spa facilites made my stay even more relaxing. The hotel is within walking distance of shops and main tourist attractions. Some hotel websites were expensive but I got a good rate by checking several web-sites.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: attygirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 night on my Honeymoon. We loved the Hotel. We stayed in a Double Deluxe Room. The room was very large, had a large bar and dressing area, and a huge bathroom with double sinks and seperate shower and jet tub. We had turn down service every night (included slippers and aroma candles with cute matches next to the bed). We found the hotel staff to be very helpful. The concierge purchased ES train tickets for me to Florence and was very nice. The roof top bar area is spectacular. The best seat is a little couch sitting on the very end of the pool that looks out over all of Rome. We enjoyed several glasses of wine here and each time recieved lovely little snacks with our drinks. Very Romantic! The location was perfect for us. We did not want to be right in the middle of all the touristy things but close enough to reach the sites with a 15 minute walk or 5 minute bus ride. There are plenty of places to eat near the hotel. Every morning i walked about 1/4 block down Via Nationale (i think this is right) to my favorite bar and enjoyed a Cafe Machioto. Loved the Hotel and would stay again. The large and beautiful rooms are a true retreat from the daily hustle and bustle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Cold service,cold showers!!”
Reviews.Author: ukateso
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Exedra for two nights at the begining of Oct. We had come from Venice where we had a wonderful hotel. The Exedra was one of the only hotels with availability and it sounded fine. First impressions were great. The room was very comfortable and the bathroom spacious. The location is o.k The concierge was really helpful and friendly. The breakfast was a help your self buffet and food o.k. Getting a hot cup of coffee difficult and our service was non -existant and rude. To top off our stay, we had to get up very early for a flight back to U.S. We were unable to get any hot water for our showers. When we called down to complain we asked for an adjustment to our bill . For these prices a hot shower is the minimum you would expect. At check out our bill was not adjusted and when we explained the situation to the woman at the desk she just ignored us. We told her that it was unacceptable to have to take cold showers. Her only response was that the hotel was full. In the end, she did deduct some from the bill, but her manner and attitude were so unpleasant that we would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Food poisoning”
Reviews.Author: whatever12
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at Exedra fo three nights. This was our first time in Rome and a last time at Hotel Exedra. Food is so un healthy and overpriced. We had a dinner at a Roof Top restaurant and we got sick the next day. We spent a whole day in bed trying to get better. We decided to let their Customer Relations Manager know about our experience and he said:"We should have contacted him while we were sick'! Sevice is way too slow,waiters are out of sight and DO NOT EAT BREAKFAST THERE. Eggs are runny, you'll have to chase a waiter to get a cup of coffee AND a BASKET OF HARD ROLLS. Good luck whatever you decide to do.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Amenities, 3 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: Hunterdown
Reviews.Content: The location is great and being a relatively new hotel, all amenities are new and clean as would be expected (Although our bathroom was pokey). Service is not five star, main re-occuring issues were; Our rate included breakfast (help yourself) which consisted of hot (Sauage, Bacon & Egg) and cold (Meats, Cheese & Pastries) BUT in order to get tea, salt, pepper, milk, teabags etc you had to ask three times and end up borrowing from another table.... you get the picture. We sussed in the end by ordering all these things prior to starting our breakfast we didn't end up with cold hot water and cold breakfast. Bar on the ground floor terrace, service is very slow, expect to wait for 10/15 mins to be served (wasn't busy) and expect to have to wave frantically at the staff to get anyone's attention. Drinks took an age, cost a fortune (£20 gin and tonic), 1 gin and tonic came with no gin, just a glass of ice, 1 Pinot Grigio came and clearly was Chardonnay. You will need to almost beg for olives or drink nibbles unless you are Italian. If you value good service from a 5 star hotel, steer clear... if you can work round these sort of issues then the hotel itself for location is great!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury style”
Reviews.Author: mpd1
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful 6 night stay here with wife and teenage son (had his own room). Loved the location as we took bus from Ciampino airport to the main terminal and walked with luggage to hotel. Not too bad a 10 minute walk. The hotel is fabulous and deserving of its status. From front desk/concierge to maid service all top notch. Breakfast buffet was included and was top notch. Good location for walking. We walked everywhere including the Vatican which was about a 45 minute journey but very fun to go through neighborhoods. We loved everything about the hotel. The pool on top is VERY cold but refreshing when Rome is 90 degrees. Very nice rooftop for drinks and watching sunset or night sky. Would definitely stay here again. Concierge was fantastic in recommending restaurants, which were all winners. One of our favorites was Target (that's right!) which was right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CarolynC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Exedra Boscolo Hotel from August 5th through the 12th 2006. My husband and I had a room,as well as my daughter and sister had a room... The hotel is beautiful, with very spacious and elegant rooms.. The staff is helpful and responsive... It is also in an excellent location,.. If I ever return to Rome that will be the only hotel I would ever consider..

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, comfortable rooms, but...”
Reviews.Author: BJFRITZ
Reviews.Content: The location was great due to easy access with the subway (outside the front door), the train station was a few blocks away & you could walk to many locations. NOTE: The subway station closed at 9:00PM. The room was comfortable - good beds, clean. The concierge was great in helping us locate our lost luggage (make sure you pack extra clothes in your carry on - at least two days worth). They gave good recommendations for restaurants - both reasonable & expensive. The older gentleman at the desk was our favorite & the nicest. But... This is the only hotel we stayed at (all 4 & 5 stars) that did not provide any breakfast. This is always a plus to starting any day in a new city. The only drawback was the bums & panhandlers at night. The hotel would chase them off, but it is a large building shared with other businesses that close at night. The bums would just move down a little.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious - Book it now!”
Reviews.Author: HJR75
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our honeymoon, it's a stunning hotel. Our room was huge and a bottle of champange was provided for us on our first evening. Like everywhere in Rome drinks were pricey (27 euros for a JD & Coke and a baileys) which is probably why the roof top bar was dead which is a shame as it was a lovely setting for a pre and post dinner drink. Roof top pool is small but theres a great sun terrace with a mix of loungers and seating which looked cool although we didn't get a chance to enjoy them. This is very easy to reach from the station, just a short walk. Equally you can walk to the main parts of town within about 15 minutes or a cab to Pz Navone etc. was about 7 - 10 Euros. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with very helpful concierge. Expensive but well worth the comfort and luxurious stay. Excellent breakfast buffet and room service (recommend the club sandwich). Cozy room with high ceilings and oversized bathroom, staff is very accomodating. What really made the stay so perfect was the concierge staff. They really helped make our stay fantastic with restaurant reservations, city recommendations, and tours. Make sure you know what you want out of your stay and what you want to see or do - they can help you make the most of your trip, even last minute details. You should know in advance if you want to see the city with a private guide, a limo service (self guided), or a group tour that way they can help book them for you if you haven't already. The spa also has a salon which can be a life savor after a long day around the city. City notes: If you are going to the Vatican go around 1-2pm when the lines sometimes are completely gone; the lines in the morning are crazy, especially on Wednesdays when the Pope is there. VIP access to the Vatican must be booked about 2 months prior, so don't get upset if you can't surpass the lines with your tour group or guide. Tivoli / Villa Adriana are a must! If you love the Roman Forum and Coloseum, you'll love these. It's a 30 - 45 minute ride but well worth it and fun side trip excursion outside the city. Best gelato in town - Giolitti near the Pantheon. Best romantic terrace view restaurant - Hotel Eden terrace with a view of the city and St. Peter's; excellent food and service! The concierge can book and recommend other restaurants for you.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite!!!”
Reviews.Author: jedilori
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for only 1 night, but I wish I had stayed longer. This is one of the most beautiful, pristine, luxury hotels I have ever stayed in. Highly Recommend. It's a very moder, clean, and luxurious hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in practically all ways. Wonderful reception and concerige service. Upgraded to Junior suite which was outstanding. Delicious breakfast buffet included. Room service was excellent one time but deficient the next although they tried to correct the problem. I have stayed at many hotels in Rome. This one stands above most others. Location is quite excellent for train station and Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: mjudaimi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a couple of nights at the Exedra when visiting Rome. The hotel is luxurious with a nice location. It is of 5 minutes walking distance from the train station. Do not make the same mistake I made and take a taxi from the train station (I was charged 12 Euros for nothing). I stayed at a superior room. I think it was spacious and fine. The bathroom is big and very clean, however, for some reason the tub did not have a curtain or a glass partition! When I asked for an upgrade in the check in, I was told I can get a deluxe room for an extra180 Euros per night!. Do not take it. The superior is fine with not much difference. The location is also great for Rome Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For Public Transit”
Reviews.Author: Tjockey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Exedra for 6 nights. Very happy with accomodations/service. Location is excellent for those wishing to use Metro/Bus to travel around Rome. My only complaint is that room service is way overpriced and really not very good. Room rates are also high for the area. Botom line is that if you know your way around Rome and you can get a good rate, then the Exedra may be the choice for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On our recent trip to Rome we stayed at the Exedra Hotel. After reviewing mostly 4/5 star hotels in the area we decided on the Exedra. We found the king size beds very comfortable, high celings, clean and nicely appointed bathrooms. Turn down service in the evening. The windows in our room must of been sound proof since we never heard any noise during the night. The breakfast buffet was not what I would consider "an American Buffet" but it suited our needs. Great location near the train terminal and close to buses and subway.Upon check-out the bill was correct. We had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking in atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: ELWilson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Exedra for a long weekend & had a lovely room overlooking the fountain in the middle of the road. The room was sumptuous & well appointed...............BUT the hote was totally lacking in character with nowhere remotely 'comfy' to sit and chill out. The 'lounge' in the enterance foyer is fairly austere & the terrace upstairs closed at this time of year. The staff were helpful, but frankly given the price I would expect more. We have stayed at many 5 star hotels around the world and unfortunately this does not rank highly with us.

Reviews.Title: “May not be the best but it's good enough”
Reviews.Author: L0ve2Tr4vel
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a weekend break and stayed at the Exedra. We arrived pretty late in the evening and chose to take the train in from Fiumiccino to Termini having read the reviews of how close the hotel is to the station. It IS close to the station entrance, but the airport link train stops a long way down in a far away platform so you do have a good 15-20min walk to the hotel if you go for this option. Also, don't be put off by the neighbourhood around the Termini Station it does get better once you get to the Piazza Republica. The hotel itself dominates half of what look like twin buildings on one side of the Piazza but is very well "signposted" on the outside with huge "Exedra Luxury Hotel" banners on the outside. Once through the revolving doors you are met by an imposing loby and check in area. I found the staff very curteous on our arrival but got none of the cocktails or special arrival treats mentioned in other reviews. The rooms itself was very nice. It had all the basics that you expect from a luxury hotel. It wasn't huge, but the ultra high cielings made it an airy space. The colours scheme is a very neutral brown and beige. The bathroom in our room was a little cramped and small glass door which separated the shower from the bathroom did nothing to prevent the bathroom getting soaked after every shower - a small design flaw. We did not have any meals at the hotel prefering to go out to the gems that Rome offers. As other reviewers suggest the mini bar prices are just ridiculous!! There is a small mini mart just down the road in the via Nazionale where you can buy 1.5l water for a fraction of the price to tide you over (unless you enjoyed getting your eyes gouged!)

Reviews.Title: “Overall good but you certainly pay for it”
Reviews.Author: Me_in_Milan
Reviews.Content: Undeniably the Exedra is a grand hotel in a good position with a lovely fountain in front and conveniently close to the train station. The bar on the top floor offers nice views and the rooms are large and very comfortable. However, cocktails in the bar are 15 euros each,water in the mini bar is 6 euros a bottle whilst breakfast is poor and offered no incentive to eat in the restaurant. Breakfast in your room is 26 euro a head and when my boiled egg arrived it was not cooked which made me think that if the kitchen cannot even boil an egg. . . Overall it is a good hotel and I will stay there again. I won't bother eating there and would recommend that you don't either.

Reviews.Title: “A Lil' Bit of Hollywood in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: UVA717
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Exedra for four days/three nights during our honeymoon in Italy in July of 2004. We worked with the online honeymoon planning travel agency, [-------], and our agent highly recommended The Exedra. It was new, at the time, and the informative website made The Exedra look out of this world . . . and it was. Just prior to our arrival, the cast and crew of Ocean's 12 stayed and filmed scenes for the movie in the hotel. We missed them by like a day! I was super bummed! Regardless, we knew we were in for quite a treat when we found out that fun piece of celebrity gossip! We arrived at The Exedra after a week in Positano and Capri, staying in small, quaint, boutique hotels. I think my draw literally dropped when I saw the lobby. It was like a museum. We stayed in a junior suite (I think) overlooking the Piazza del Republica. The room was, in a word, awesome! Modern luxury. It was large and spacious with all sorts of amenities like a large, plasma television and a wet bar. The bed was so comfortable, almost too comfortable. It was definitely hard to get out of it in the morning!! The bathroom was, again, large with fine marble details. We had champagne and cherries waiting for us every evening. Some of the reviews on this board have mentioned the poor, snobby service. Overall, we had a positive experience with the staff and concierge. On our final night, we chose the eat at the hotel's rooftop restaurant overlooking their small pool. The food was amazing. The service was insulting, insulting to the point where my husband went down to talk to the concierge about it at midnight. Extremely apologetic, we were sent a vast early-morning spread of fresh fruit and champagne to enjoy before our flight. One additional fun fact about The Exedra. It is located right on one of the Metro lines (Piazza del Republica stop), which comes in handy when you are tired of walking/don't want to search for a cab. The Exedra was luxurious, in style and in price. We would highly recommend it to travelers wanting a little piece of Hollywood elegance during their stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “poor for rome”
Reviews.Author: mexes
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend go to Rome every year, and each time we like to try a different luxury hotel. We stayed at the exedra in december and i have to say that the quality of service, the staff and the feel of the place in general do not come even remotely close to that of the st.regis grand, the de russie or the cavalieri hilton. On our next visit to the eternal city the exedra wont even be considered.

Reviews.Title: “Candid Thoughts”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stopped off in Rome on the second leg of a four leg honeymoon in Italy. We started in Tuscany and after Rome, went to Capri and Positano and stayed in 4 equally high end and pricey hotels and this was by far the worst hotel of the four, and one of the worst we have ever stayed in. As other people have written, the staff was very rude which is really not that big of a deal to us but they did 4 things that really upset us: 1. They sent us to the Sistine Chapel on a Saturday after it had closed. 2. They recommended a restaurant that we went to and it was Kosher. I have no problem with eating Kosher, but if I am in Rome for 3 nights, there is no way I am going to choose to eat in a Kosher restaurant. 3. They have a "complimentary" Mercedes taxi from the hotel to restaurants that is 20 Euros, most cabs are 10 at the most. 4. They had no hair conditioner in the room and then wanted to charge us 40 Euros to purchase from the spa! Make sure you get a room with a view of of the square, as opposed to the courtyard. Breakfast was good and the hotel lobby was very nice. In general, I am sure there are a lot better hotels to stay in in Rome for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Wales
Reviews.Content: I can't help wondering if some of the people who have slated this hotel are talking about the same 'Boscolo Exedra'. I thought this was a wonderful hotel, and regularly stay in some of Europe's best hotels. Staff - were friendly and extremly attentative. On check-in the lady at reception spotted it was my birthday when taking down the details from my passport. Within minutes of getting to our room a bottle of champagne arrived courtesy of the hotel. The consierge recommended some wonderful restraunts and arranged transportation from the hotel. On telling the bar staff we had just got engaged, the bar man bought us a round of drinks! Room - The room we had (in the new part of the hotel) was HUGE. The ceiling height was that of a two storey building. It was clean plesantly decorated and very quiet. Breakfast - was excellent. Really set us up for the day. Public areas - including reception were beautiful, and the carpeted covered walkway from the street really made you feel special. The exterior apperance of this hotel (especially at night)is breathtaking. Location - Fantastic, the metro stop is literally just outside reception, but there are many attractions within a 10 min walk. I honestly can't fault this hotel - visit its web site for some great rates.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Robert07
Reviews.Content: Having read all the previous reviews we went prepared. The rooms are spacious and well appointed and the location is ideal just a few minutes walk from the Termini station and above the metro. As predicted the welcome, such as it was, was curt and unsmiling. There was no price list for the room minibar until the final day.Fortunately we gave that and the bar a miss as there are loads of places in the immediate area to eat and drink. We had no problem walking out at night as the area was busy and well lit. Basically we didn't use any of the hotel's overpriced facilities at all - it was simply a room for the night,and a very comfortable one at that. We got a discounted rate of £140 per night on Expedia which we felt was good value for the room we had. If you want to avoid rip off taxis from the airport this hotel is an easy five minute walk from the drop off point of the coach shuttle from Ciampino airport.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good but not for the priec”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel sometime ago but unfortunately didnt get round to writing a review. The room I had had a great view as you can see and the room itself and spacious but some rooms dont actually have a view so ask if you can be put in a room with a view it makes all the diffrence (we were upgraded for free) and just what you need after a hard day walking around. Pros: Location - you are actually on top of a metro, station is 5 min walk but just far enough to be away from the hustle and bustle of Termini, lovely rooms, no need to eat Breakfast in the hotel as for 70% of the price ypu can go to the many cafes (good quality) opposite and around the corner, internet cafes nearby, mcdonalds (if thats your thing), post office, and rather than using the minibar I went to the off licence and stacked up the fridge with my own alcohol as it was ridiclously expensive Cons: If you are a seasoned traveller then you will realise the hotel is not "worth the price" maybe good for the special day but it is very corporately focussed, swimming pool -but too small to actually swim in, crazy prices in restuarant and the staff at helpdesk are fully trained but the others around the hotel are not really. Id give this place 6/10

Reviews.Title: “IL Motel Six?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I should not have been surprised having read the other reviews of this hotel from this site, but I was nevertheless appalled at the horrible service I received at this hotel. Staff were rude and unhelpful, the concierge sent us to a restaurant that had been closed for months, and the tiny pool mysteriously closes at different times each night. If I wanted a surly attitude mixed with bad service I'd be staying somewhere far cheaper(300+ Euros a night). If this is Boscolo's best, I’d hate to see their worst.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good experience”
Reviews.Author: Clouseau
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed at the Exedra from the 14th til the 18th of October and I have to say we really enjoyed our stay. Check in was incredibly quick - we were in our room within ten minutes of arriving at the hotel. Our room was in the new wing which was really peaceful. The room itself was very large by Rome standards, the bed was massive and all toiletries, bathrobes, slippers etc were great. Reading other reviews before we booked I was very undecided about the Exedra as it seemed to be a real case of pot luck as to whether you enjoyed your stay or not. I'm glad to say we got a fantastic room for a great price 260 euro per night including breakfast. Some-one made the point about there not being much hot food for brekkie - I have to say I thought the choice for breakfast was fine - loads of cold meats and cheeses, oodles of pastries, fresh fruit and your usual sausage, egg and bacon. Location wise the Exedra is perfect. There's a Metro right outside the front door and on Via Nazionale, just beside the hotel, you can get a bus pretty much to anywhere you want to go in Rome. That being said we found the Trevi and the Pantheon and Piazza Navona and the Colloseum all within walking distance. Overall I would have no hesitation in recommending the Exedra, if you're after a particular view then state that when booking so you won't be disappointed. The only thing I would warn about is the price of drinks in the bar - thirty euro for a baileys and a whiskey (gulp!).

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Exedra on 20th October for three nights, we had a deluxe, non-smoking room with an excellent view of the piazza exactly as we had requested. The room was lovely, better than we had expected, everywhere clean and fresh, no wear on the decor or furnishings as suggested in other reviews. We had a large impressive bathroom and though there were no bathrobes on our arrival, this was rectified as soon as we reported it to reception. We found all the staff throughout the hotel really friendly, we checked in and out really quickly and the reception staff and concierge couldn't have been more helpful. If I was looking to find a fault at all it would probably be that the breakfast selection wasn't as good as I expected, there again that was probably us being fussy as there was a great choice of cold things but hardly anything hot which is normally offered for 26 euros. We found the location of the hotel really convenient and fortunately didn't experience any problems with not feeling safe outside the hotel. We had a wonderful time at this hotel and believe me we are quite fussy, we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Does the Guest come first?”
Reviews.Author: Knowmygrub
Reviews.Content: We booked a truly superb Junior suite which overlooked the piazza and the fountain, this aspect was fantastic and the hotel itself looks and feels outstanding, it really is luxurious. But on our arrival the central lobby area was taken over by a car manufacturer for their Annual conference so the first 2 nights the top floor and restaurant was booked out and the hotel full of business people, then on the third day a film crew took over the whole entrance are to film a corporate TV advert for a phone company- this really got in the way of everyone and their security would not even allow us IN or OUT of the hotel- which is disgraceful for paying guests. This marred our whole experience and we felt very much that we were staying at a corporate conference centre rather than a luxury, exclusive Hotel. The staff were somewhat embarrased about the whole thing and the bars were good as were the concierge and front desk staff. It is a very convenient location but check if they are having corporate events- we will not go back there if they do!

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: ashk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night in September 2005, and i would warn anyone against staying in this hotel. The staff are incredibly rude and unhelpful. It took 40 minutes just to check in. The room was dirty, with black marks all over the walls, and stank of smoke (even though we had requested a non smoking room) Our view was of the fire exit and some laudry hanging out to dry. We had no towels or robes in the bathroom, and i had to call down for them. The bath / shower was tiny and sprayed water all over the bathroom. Our stay cost over £400 for room only, and was not worth even half that. I have stayed in hotels all over the world, and have never been treated so badly, or had such a dissapointing room.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Fowler4
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Exdra and loved it. Beautiful hotel - grand lobby. Our room was great - very spacious, good aircon etc. We know the pool isn't large but it is quite a luxury to have one in Rome - we spent one afternoon lounging around it & it was totally adequate. Breakfast was very good with a large selection of what you would expect at a 5 star. Yes the drinks etc are expensive but we expected that in Rome. Staff were very helpful. Location is great for walking everywhere especially to the train station. We had no problem with the area at night - no one bothered us and we felt quite safe. We will stay at the Exedra next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, a bit slow with service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel. It was worth every penny, especially after being disappointed with our stay at the Torre Guelfa in Florence. My only complaint is that when you call Housekeeping, you might not get someone who understands English very well-- but somewhat to be expected. Also, when we called to have our luggage brought down, no one came up with a cart. I asked a second time and, still, no one came to our door. My husband and I brought our luggage down ourselves. When we came down, the staff was very apologetic. The hotel is BEAUTIFUL. The rooftop dipping pool was awesome. I will absolutely stay here again. I can deal with the service being a bit slow when the hotel is as beautiful and comfortable as this place.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Expectations”
Reviews.Author: kyverdicts
Reviews.Content: Mixed, Mixed, Mixed. Positive -- The room was comfortable and elegant. The maid stole the soap and replaced it with bath foam. No hand towels. Otherwise, a nice and comfortable bed. No wireless connection. Location is excellent. (We took the train back to the airport.) Lots of room for an average room. Micoh at the concierge is excellent. Connected us with a guide for the Forum and Colesseum (Christina). Worth asking for. Negative There are several at this hotel that keep it from stepping up in class. To summarize, there is a propensity to say no, when to say no, there is no benefit. Examples. My wife asked for cappucino at the hotel bar on the top floor and to take it to your room. She was told no. (Why? Charge us accordingly. We'll pay.) Sat in the Lobby Bar. Never acknowledged. Asked to eat at the outside restaurant. Sunday 9-11-05. Told it would take twenty minutes. Lots of tables. Not busy. We passed and spent our 100 Euros elsewhere. Why? (Dumb, I think). Later we came to have drinks at the bar, Tazio (sic). Open table, not bussed. Ignored by staff beyond a curt Sera. Dumb. A little miffed, I asked to see the duty manager. It was 11:00 p.m. and I was told there was none. I asked if the girl (very nice) at the desk was the most senior person in the hotel that night. She answered that she was not, but could not identify any person who was above her. The Boscolo Exedra spends too much time telling guests they are a luxury hotel and not enough time actually being a luxury hotel. The things I've noted could be dealt with easily and result in increased hotel revenue. {Isn't that the idea Boscolo?} Stay here with the appreciation that there are some issues that it keep it from being a 5-Star hotel. That is not to say that if you book it at the right price, it might not be more than you expected. Top shelf? Not quite.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ruth05
Reviews.Content: My new husband & I stayed here for 3 nights on our honeymoon and I was overwhelmed by the stunning entrance and lobby area. The fountain and square outside is also stunning (despite the McDonalds!). The hotel is in a great location for sightseeing, with many attractions within walking distance, plus the Metro entrance right by the hotel. There is also the option of having a taxi hailed for you right outside which, although expensive, is worthwhile at night. The concierge made some excellent recommendations for dinner (and of course handled the reservations). I would definitely advise others to use this service. Only not-so-good parts of the hotel were; the tiny pool which was always freezing and not really suitable for swimming, the equally small sun deck area which can only accommodate about 20 people and finally, the price of the food and drinks on the hotel. In summary, a stunning hotel with extremely polite, friendly and accommodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “The Absolute Best!”
Reviews.Author: LAguru
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely breathtaking. Immediately as we entered our room, we were speechless. A regular double standard room is the equivalent to a grand suite in terms of size, comfort, luxury, and grandeur. The lobby is simply opulent and the concierge helps you with hints (his restaurant suggestions were superb!) the best he can. This is definitely a 5 star luxury hotel in a gorgeous location with gorgoues views of Piazza Republica. We checked out the St. Regis, Westin, Hassler, Intercontinental, and De Russie, and none of them even compared to the grandeur, style, and comfort of the Exedra! This is a wonderful hotel that relaxes you despite heavy days of tourist sightseeing. I absolutely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Exedra”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a very enjoyable four night stay at the Exedra in Rome. We would recommend this hotel without hesitation. We arrived at around 10:30am, not expecting our rooms to be available. The receptionist who checked us in was really helpful and made one of our two rooms available immediately and the second room (our children's which was right next door as requested) was available in 30 mins. We stayed in the standard superior rooms, which were really large, well furnished, with beautiful bathrooms. Our rate included breakfast which was great, good coffee, juice, cold meats, pastries, and a small selection of hot dishes. We dined out at recommendations and bookings made by the concierge which included one very special restaurant "Clemente della Magdalene". We ate lunch at a great pizza restaurant "La Gallina Bianca" frequented by locals within walking distance in Via Rossini. We used the (cold!) pool and sun deck on a couple of afternoons. The deck is well equiped with sun loungers. This was a great place to rest weary feet after the walking tours during the day. You should check out "Angel Tours" also reviewed on this site - very good. Our experience of the service at the Exedra was in complete contrast to some of the negative reviews on the site. Staff were very helpful, pleasant and normally greeted you with "Buongiorno" as they passed in the corridor. We had nothing but great service during our stay. One tip - if you want to see a clip of what the hotel lobby looks like - watch Ocean's Twelve - the scene where Julia Roberts arrives in Rome - the hotel she checks into is the Exedra.

Reviews.Title: “Xedra the Great !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Xedra 23rd to 27th August, 2005. First class huge rooms with high ceilings and palatial marble bathrooms ( room 353 ) and service with excellent views over the fountain in Piatzza Del Republica. My two teenage boys ( 15 and 18 ) stayed in room 357 which is vast . Stunning Hotel lobby. Well located for both good local resturants, shopping and historical sites. Rome is a very village like city in that most of the major historical sites are in a reasonable walking distance from the Hotel. Hired a car myself and am now an expert on the streets of Rome but maps do not indicate the vast number of one way streets. However, once you get to know the one way system all becomes clear.
