Excellent resturant with on street tables just around the corner ( turn left outside the hotel entrance onto the Via National ) if you have children as they make an excellent pizza etc; [and the owner speaks fluent English ] at a very reasonable price. Hotel resturant very good in the canopied area at the front of the hotel. V. good fillet steak, reasonable price, about £ 15, but hotel bar very expensive. About £ 5.50 for a bottle of lager. Best value is the homeymoon room rate which includes breakfast and dinner on the roof top resturant which is very expensive - about £ 26 for the main course alone - grand piano player included . The pool is long and narrow but very good for exercise and plenty of sunlongers with plenty of sun ! Again roof top bar very expensive! First class hotel with first class service. Tip ! do not disturb mini bar in bedrooms with bought in drinks as any movement of bottles is automatically recorded on your bill as a consumed item which at £ 4 per item plus moumts up quickly ! Finally on the Via National about 100 meters down turn right and on the left of that street is an excllent barber if any chaps feel like a slick Italian haircut by traditonal old fashioned expert italian barber using comb and razor. Fee 20 euros including tip ! Speaks no English but that does not matter as hand signals are quite sufficient !

Reviews.Title: “Exedra exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Cheshirechris
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from Honeymoon in Rome after four nights in the Exedra. Hotel was fabulous, the superior room was large with an enormous bathroom and was spotlessly clean. It was also very quiet. The bed linen and soft furnishings etc were all of the highest quality. The service was good, a request for ice resulted in a large ice bucket full being delivered to the room within 3 minutes. The maid and turndown services were consistent and wet towels etc were replaced. One small complaint - the concierge's advice regarding buses to certain parts of the city was awry (possibly trying to get us to use the hotel transport!). My wife used the pool a few times and loved it. She also liked the complimentary chocolates in the lobby (which was stunning) All in all, I would definitely recommend this hotel, particularly as I got a very good deal on the room rate! Make sure you shop around. Great for a special short break. Can't comment on the food etc as we always ate out and too full to have the breakfast! (26 euros each)

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Rooms, 2 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: Lankz
Reviews.Content: The rooms are absolutely great but service is barely 2 star. When you call the front desk or any other service area, more often than not, no one answers the phone. Gave my laundry in one morning and was told I will get it back the same day. After many phone calls and lots of transfers they told me it won't be ready to tomorrow and finally I was able to track it down the next day (Couldn't believe my eyes when I looked at the bill $$$). The rooms were absolutely incredible. High ceilings, very clean. Overall, 5 star rooms, 2 star service

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review for the Exedra”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just like my rating says, this hotel is okay, but has some problems...Like the other reviewers, I felt the Exedra had a great location and was quite beautiful. The lobby looked like it had just been decorated, with beautiful new cream colored couches and furnishings. But please be prepared for the GIANT tacky headboard in your room - crocodile embossed leather, a bit much for my taste. The rooms were very nice, extremely spacious for Italy and not too pricey for a 5 star hotel - EUR 230 including breakfast! The breakfast was good and offered a sophisticated spread (smoked swordfish which was pretty good). I had previously stayed at the St Regis down the street, which is more expensive but has smaller rooms - however, the St Regis is more elegant, less modern than the Exedra. During my stay at the Exedra, the internet connection in the room didn't work and they do not have a business center (I ended up going to the front desk to use the computer there at midnight!). When I had called earlier to ask about the internet connection, the man at the front desk was not apologetic but matter of fact - 'Nothing can be done. You can use the computer down here.' In the end, he was friendly as I left the area but until that point had not been terribly friendly, even though he should have been given the circumstances. The staff wasn't terrible but perhaps indifferent (the concierge didn't really help me when I asked about museum reservations - I could have called the same numbers myself so obviously they are not well connected with museum staff). The bellstaff took over an hour to get our luggage to our room so don't rely on them to bring your things in a timely fashion (they simply deposited the bags in an unlocked room to the side of the entrance and forgot about them - this is an obvious security hazard!). However, because I encountered so many rude and crazy taxi drivers in Rome, the staff at the Exedra didn't seem so bad! The bathroom was huge and also beautiful but I found bugs on two occasions. Two different types of bugs - one mini-roach and a sort of gnat. Not pleasant. Despite these problems, I will probably stay at the Exedra again because the rooms are pretty huge and it is worth it for the amount you are paying. However, I will remember to bring bug spray! Another note - on our last night there we smelled smoke in the lobby. Although we hesitated to go to our rooms, we were assured all was well despite the fact that we were told a 'towel fire' had gotten out of hand an hour before. As Italians always downplay these problems, please make sure to trust your instincts when concerned about your own safety! We were on the fourth floor and the burning smell was quite strong throughout the night.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in July and had a fantastic time. I regularly stay away both in the UK and on the continent and this hotel definitely ranks one of the best that I have stayed in. The rooms were superb and all the staff we had contact with were efficient, friendly and helpful at all times. The roof-top pool was one of the main reasons for choosing this hotel, given that we were there in the heat of July, and it certainly made the holiday being able to go back and relax after some very hectic and hot sightseeing. I think those people with a different experience must have been very unlucky. I would (and have) recommend it to anyone who wants a luxury break.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Italy and we stayed in Rome, Florence and the Amalfi coast. All our hotels were five stars. I have to admit this was the best 5 star hotel I stayed at. The rooms were just unbelieveable. The breakfast buffet the best and the location was great. Why this hotel is not ranked number 1 in Rome just amazes me.

Reviews.Title: “La Dolce Vita......”
Reviews.Author: TwinsAunt
Reviews.Content: Hsuband, 10 year old daughter and myself stayed here for 2 nights during a week-long trip to Rome (couldn't afford to stay every night!). The hotel is situated on a large piazza (Repubblica) which is less busy than some others in Rome with taxis close by. Close to the station (about a 5 min walk). It is about a 15min walk to Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain etc - also on main bus route to Vatican and Metro station is on the piazza. I found the area to be perfectly safe and no signs of any undesirables at night as posted by other reviewers. The frontage of the hotel is spectacular with bar and restaurant on terrace. The lobby is ornate and beautiful. The front of house reception staff were efficient and professional though I could understand some other reviewers mentioning perhaps a little intimidating. We had booked through Expedia and were upgraded to a deluxe room on check-in to give us more room with fold-away bed for daughter. Our room was lovely - 5 star with large and comfortable bed, table sofa, chairs and separate more than sufficient wardrobe space. Large floor to ceiling window which didn't have great view but that wasn't a big issue for us(advised at check-in that mega bucks required for rooms with view of piazza). The bathroom was absolutely beautiful with 2 vanity units miles apart, bath with shower, separate shower, quality towels and toiletries, bathrobes, slippers. Heaps of room. All high quality and absolutely spotless. Public areas were lovely - went to restaurant only for breakfast - 52 euros for the 3 of us - buffet style but first class. Main bonus in summer months may be roof top pool. This was attached to a bar area, sun terrace and restaurant. The prices for the restaurant were very high but seemed popular with business types at lunch. Menu was of fine dining standard. Bar drinks were c. 6 euros for a coke. Beer 8 euros. The pool and surrounding area offers spectacular views over Rome and the water (cold) offered haven for children and adults alike in the intense summer heat. Area was popular at night with people relaxing with a drink enjoying the city views. The pool is small but adequate and there are sunbathing areas round side of roof - however, minimal shade for those who wish to sit outside but not fry in the sun! The basement of the hotel offers conference facilities - however, go down to have a look - there are glass floors which allow you to view ancient Roman foundations that they discovered while building the hotel. In summary, a truly beautiful hotel, a worthwhile treat and a good choice for those that appreciate luxury.

Reviews.Title: “My stay with Claudia”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The surroundings of the hotel are five-star in every respect. The hotel is housed in a beautifully restored Palazzo that is very conveniently located with regards to the train station and the sights of ancient Rome. The rooms are well appointed and generally smoke-free, although the latter came with much insistence. The only problem with this hotel, one that has been noted by some other guests, is the inconsistency of its staff. Some of the staff members, including the concierge and the bellmen were very polite and generally helpful. However others, like the receptionist who checked me into the hotel, Claudia, were most certainly not. I traveled through Italy for two weeks prior to my stay in Rome and stayed at half- a-dozen fine hotels but this woman, Claudia, was so unbelievably disrespectful to me that I remember her and my negative experience at the Exedra above all others. Claudia, and some others, made every effort to make my stay at the hotel most unpleasant. This was not just a single case either, as this type of disservice was provided to me for each of the five days I spent at the hotel. It seems that Claudia, whose foul attitude became almost comical towards the end, could find new and inventive ways to be utterly rude to me on a daily basis. This hotel has only been open a short time and in certain areas this shows; these little ‘kinks’ that hopefully will be worked out with time, like Claudia, are still painfully apparent. Until the people at Boscolo get their new flagship hotel running a little more smoothly, for my money, I’ll be staying at the Excelsior.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for a Treat”
Reviews.Author: lismain
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Exedra for two nights at the end of a two week honeymoon in Italy and it was a brilliant finale! The hotel itself is beautifully maintained and decorated and the location is fantastic - literally just a five minute walk from Termini Station. The staff were pleasant and efficient, and although the swimming pool was unheated, we found it very refreshing, considering how hot Rome gets in June. Our room and bathroom were amazing, the beds are huge and the most comfortable ever. The only complaint I would have, is the price of drinks in the hotel - we paid 30 euro one evening for two drinks in the hotel bar - you couldn't avoid to get drunk on those prices!

Reviews.Title: “This is truly a beautiful hotel........”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a suprise birthday trip to Rome for my partners birthday. I actually booked to stay at the Grand Palace Hotel (another Boscolo Hotel) but when we arrived we were transferred to the Exedra as the air con wasn't working. Well...when we arrived our breathe was taken away. It looked magnificent and it truly was. We were greated by warm and very friendly hotel staff - nearly all of which spoke perfect English - our room was much larger than was expected and we had a lovely balcony too. The service we received was truly 5 star. The hotel is situated within walking distance of pretty much every major site, 15 mins walk from the colossem, 10-15 min walk from the Trevi but the Vatican was the fathest at around 30-40 mins. I would recommend this hotel to absolutely anyone and I wouldn't hesitate going back there!

Reviews.Title: “Roman Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Exedra was everything we wanted and more! The rooms are beautiful with very large and the most comfortable beds I've ever slept on and the bathrooms are spacious and just beautiful! Make the most of the buffet for breakfast with outstanding food, you never want to leave it! We had the oportunity of being at the hotel whilst Ocean's 12 was being filmed in the gorgeous lobby, so we got to see Julia Roberts, Matt Damon, George Clooney and Bruce Willis! If that is an indication of how beautiful it is. The hotel is in a prime location right next to the terminal and the great shopping is only a walk away! I highly recomomend this hotel to anyone who would like to experience travelling in Rome in Style!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Excedra hotel for 3 nights in June. This hotel is definately a luxurious hotel. Our room was a standard room, but was large and had a separate sitting area away from the bed. The bathrooms are large, have nice showers and are decorated in marble. The staff was friendly, polite and helpful. The location was great. It is right across the street from the metro and the Termini train station, which is nice if you are taking a train to other regions of Italy. Many of the tourist attractions are within walking distance, but I would highly recommend taking the metro. I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As far as top international hotels go, this one is right up there with the best. We took a three day honeymoon to Rome and decided to stay here as we were looking for a touch of luxury, and we found it! The room was great, and we had been given an automatic upgrade due to our newly-wed status. Located near the central train station, and very close to one of the metro stations, the hotel is idealy situated. The concierge were very helpful and booked lovely restaurants for us. We found the best rate was via the company itself rather than any internet reseller. Do have a look at the Boscolo site before you book. If we ever return to Rome, we'll look to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and worth the price”
Reviews.Author: PDXviajero
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Exedra for Christmas 2003 and it was just lovely. The hotel is opulent and refinded. Although the breakfast is not cheap, it was cheaper than every other hotel in which we stayed in Italy. We had a triple room that was just HUGE! The marble bathroom is fabulous. The service was very good. We did get a recommendation from the concierge to have dinner at their sister property, The Aleph. That place was an eye sore, overpriced and the food was mediocre at best. Apart from that, we truly enjoyed our stay and will return to the Exedra.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: salsera123
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from a weekend in Rome with our baby son and we couldn't have asked for a better time. Although our baggage took over an hour to come through at the airport we took a train direct to the main Termini which was less than a 5 minute walk from the Exedra. The Termini has a lot of shops there, including a supermarket, and so everything you would need is right on your doorstep. We were made to feel very welcome at the hotel and a great fuss was made of the baby, not just by the staff, but by a lot of people we met whilst in Rome, something us reserved Brits don't tend to do, so it made a nice change. The staff were polite, spoke excellent English and couldn't have been more helpful. The Concierge was happy to recommend restaurants to visit and although one was great (Target) the other (Flavia) was awful, and not content with the tiniest portions of food i've seen, tried to overcharge us by 40 Euros! Our hotel room was beautiful, complete with tall ceilings, lounge area and spacious marble bathroom. A cot was happily provided as was bowls of fresh fruit each day (I think we stayed in a Deluxe room). Although the hotel is situated next to a McDonalds and cinema, you would never have known as the hotel is so grand. The location was great, right next to a Metro stop, although we chose to walk everywhere, with lots of restaurants right on your doorstep. The high point for us, however, was the rooftop terrace complete with swimming pool, bar and restaurant. We had cocktails up there one evening whilst watching the sun set - food and drink at the hotel were very expensive but for a treat it was well worth the money. I wouldn't hesitate to go back to Rome and especially the Exedra.

Reviews.Title: “Real luxury - but at a price!”
Reviews.Author: valdy
Reviews.Content: The Exedra is a truly luxurious hotel in a beautiful setting. We booked a twin non-smoking room, but were told on arrival that only a smoking room was available; luckily it did not smell of cigarettes! The room was exactly as depicted on the hotel's website - high ceiling, quality furnishings, gorgeous pink marble bathroom, excellent linens and toiletries. Breakfast was good, but overpriced at 26 euros. Restaurants at the hotel are also very expensive, but there are lots of excellent restaurants nearby in the Via Nazionale. Staff at reception were helpful and friendly; the only glitch was the rather snooty concierge who seemed to think that only the rich and famous were deserving of his time and effort! The roof top pool is smaller than you might think and is not heated. Overall, an excellent hotel, but I'm not sure I would spend this kind of money on it again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a physician form the NYC area, USA. I stayed at the Exedra for 5 nights 2 weeks ago, with 2 teenage children. I can honestly say, it was the finest hotel I have ever encountered, (and I have stayed at THE BEST). For the price, I can tell you that the service was extraordinary: The room sublime, with 20 foot ceilings; marble bath with tub, shower and stall shower. Dual sinks with dual toilets and bidet. The staff was warm, intelligent, and friendly. LOVED Americans, too-which was a plus considering the current world climate. Compared to other hotels I have stayed at in Rome, this was the best for the price, ever. Anyone who wrote a bad review for this hotel is either an idiot, has no travel or life experience, or it was a fluke. This was world class in every way. (The room doors alone must have cost $10,000.00 each!) I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat. Don' t believe any negative reviews!! JJM

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Exedra”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel63
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Exedra with my wife, 2 daughters, another couple and their two children. We really enjoyed our stay. The room was very spacious and well appointed. The bathroom was wonderful but as other have said a real challenge to keep the water in the shower. We had a roll-away for one child and the other slept on two chairs pushed together. Although we booked our room through travelocity for 2 adults and two children I don't think the hotel would normally allow four to a room. The room was not ready when we arrived but they upgraded us to a superior room for no extra charge. The location was great and we were able to walk everywhere. The hotel is not right by the spanish steps but very walkable. We had no problems with gypsies as others have said. The pool was small and was not heated so our kids did not use it. The tv had three english channels. BBC, CNN and MTV which is typical for europe. The concierge was unhelpful and often made peculiar suggestions for meals so we usually found places to eat on our own. My only complaint about the room was the bed was fairly hard for my taste and was two twin beds made up as a king. The linens were very nice and the towels and bath products first rate (however they did not have a separate conditioner so bring your own if you use it). We did not eat the breakfast as it was not included in our rate. It was about 26 euros per person including children so we found pastries nearby. The hotel offers complimentary snacks in the lobby all day which was real nice. They would usually have biscotti, white and dark chocolate, dried fruit and nuts out to eat all day. Our families loved Rome. We went on a day trip to Pompeii and to Positano which was a real treat. We used Armando from Italyprivatetours. He was very nice and knowledgable. He took us to the vatican and the colliseum as well. At times he had a little too much info for our kids but definately made our trip more fun. Our children are 10 and 13 and they all had a great time. The Exedra was a great place to stay. The services were a little lacking but the room was great and very clean. It may not be a 5 star by U.S. standards but for Europe it is very nice. We got a great rate and would stay there again if we got a good rate again. Attached is a photo from our room. The room itself looks just like the picture on the web site. Very high ceilings, beautiful moldings, fabric walls and marble bathroom. David

Reviews.Title: “The Exedra and Rome”
Reviews.Author: mhallLondon
Reviews.Content: Returned from a 7 night stay at the Exedra. It is a 5 star hotel. The staff are friendly and laid back, not obtrusive but attentive to your needs at the same time. The rooms and facilities in general are excellent. The bar is a little lifeless but I've found that in all 5 star hotels I've stayed in. Must be because they are exclusive and pricey. Nevertheless it's a great place to stay. There are a couple of shady characters who loiter in the surrounds of the hotel. I was approached by a pimp. But the area is busy and I happened to be stood alone at the corner of the hotel, a single man late at night. It was all relatively harmless, I just brushed him off. The hotel is a 5 - 10 min walk from Termini. The station area is well lit and very busy at all times with people coming and going and not in the least bit intimidating. Unlike Kings Cross in London for example. Taxi's in Rome are relatively cheap which was contrary to what I was led to believe. You can get anywhere in the centre for 7 euro. We used the cab to cross the river to Trastevere at night and were charged a little over 7 euro which was good value. They are all metered anyway. Rome itself is a great place to go. Lots to see and do. The Italians are relaxed and friendly. Food is generally cheap. Meal for three, three courses (pasta, pizza, ice cream) and wine and water and tea for about 70 euro in total in a nearby restaurant. Don't eat at Flann O'Brien's, it's a dump. It's popular but Irish and British theme pubs when abroad are generally poor value. Overpriced, bad service. We did several day trips the one I would recommend most is Naples/Capri with Gray Line/Panorama tours. Ferry to Capri, motorboat to Blue Grotto, chairlift to top of mountain on Anacapri through the mist with spectacular views at the top. Great fun. I'd recommend a guided tour of the Vatican Museums and Cistine Chapel. A guide brings it to life. One note of caution. Forewarned I kept a close eye on my wallet. However, on Easter Sunday myself, younger brother and mum took the metro towards the Vatican. The metro was jam packed. When we got off my mum discovered her handbag was open and her purse was missing. She suspected a young girl of 14 who was with hher mother and they both got off one stop after we got on. It wasn't a disaster 50 euro and £30 sterling so could have been much worse but don't drop your guard on the metro particularly if it is crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Traveller”
Reviews.Author: traveller55555
Reviews.Content: It is NOT a 5 star hotel. People in the reception were very rude and unpolite. The room in historical wing was WITHOUT window and we had to wait and wait for our coffee and sandwiches from the room service. But the main problem was service - very unprofessional and rude.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: enchantedemma
Reviews.Content: this is a wonderful hotel in the heart of Rome. The rooms are huge, especially by European standards, very modern and convenient. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly, and make you feel very welcome. This is also a good location if you have a car with you, since you can drop the car off at the front and the valets park it for you (for 35 EU a day, which is fairly reasonable in Rome).

Reviews.Title: “A Must Stay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adisgruntledcustomer
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Exedra in March 2005 and were really impressed. As soon as we walked in we found the foyer and the whole ambience breathtaking. The staff were friendly, helpful and couldnt do enough to help. The room was large and beautiful and the breakfast and service out of this world. It is perfectly located for all the attractions and so was easy see all the sights on foot. If you get chance check out the rooftop bar - its stunning! Id also visit the Spa if you get chance - I had a wonderful massage in there with hot stones (Im still raving about it two weeks later)! We had such a lovely time we have booked a Boscolo hotel in Prague!

Reviews.Title: “not a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Exedra whith my boyfriend in mid september 2004. I must say i wasn`t impressed at all with this hotel. We booked a celebration package but we didn`t receved the upgrade or the wine and fruit that were promissed in it. The staff from the front reception desk was very rude in attitude and unprofessional.The room was very nice, the bathroom nice and a good size. Location-not very good (25- 30 min walk to center). In the same building with Exedra there is a McDonalds- something you will never find at a real 5 star hotel...and, by the way, if what you are looking for is a 5 star hotel, well, this is not. I wouldn`t reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bellissimo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 days and i must admit i was feeling a little apprehensive after reading the mixed reveiws. I am pleased to say we had nothing to worry about. The hotel is beautiful and our room was truly amazing. It was by far the largest hotel room i have ever stayed in and the most comfortable. The service was excellent and we did not encounter any staff who could not speak perfect English. We would stay here again on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed at the exedra for four nights in feb 2005, it is a luxury hotel with an amazing first impression, staff were very helpful and friendly,the metro stop is just outside the entrance, 2 nice sopts for eating close by are target and flann o briens on via nazionale, all in all a perfect spot to explore rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: chefdiane
Reviews.Content: Location - 2 blocks from the train station, and next to a Metro stop. Next to the Opera and across from a magnificent fountain. The facade and entrance is breathtaking. The loby is magnificent, the staff wonderful, the rooms large, the bathrooms very large , the restaurants fabulous. If you stay three days, you get breakfast which makes this a bargain. Breakfast is a buffet of meats, salads, fruit, pastries, etc. and available til 11 for late sleepers. The floor plan can be confusing so be observant if you are taken to the 3rd floor, there are elevators and one story stair cases everywhere and you can get lost, but around every confusing corner is another magnificent section. Enjoy !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for several nights in August 2004 and it was wonderful. The room was lovely and although our television was not working initially, they changed it out and everything was perfect. The room was of good size and beautifully decorated. Next door to this brilliant hotel is a McDonald's for those who need a quick snack. There is a subway stop right in front of the hotel, very convenient. I am a travel agent and would recommend this property to all my clients.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful New Year in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Dawn94
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night break at this hotel, We agreed with all the positive comments about rooms, splendour etc. It was extremely quiet especially considering it was New Year, on our last day we wondered if we were the only guests on fourth floor, as we hadn't seen anyone, having said that we then saw an English family coming out of their room. Our room was huge: a corner superior with his/hers balconies! Although expensive 700 pounds for 3 nights (we organised our own flights) we thought that was pretty good considering the time of year and for a 5* hotel in Rome, I'm sure the equivalent in UK would've been more. We found staff very helpful. The restaurants were very expensive, so we didn't eat there and we decided not to book the New Year's Eve Celebration meal at 300 Euros each! Loved Rome and certainly would return. Like a previous reviewer really missed the tea/coffee making facilities that we are so used to in UK. Desperately wanted to order tea but wasn't prepared to pay 7.5 euros!! Plus tip for room service!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have had a wonderful weekend of sheer luxury at the Exedra, not sure if we stayed at the same as some reviews as we experienced nothing but a first class service, marvellous reception (champagne on arrival), immaculate room, superb service by everyone within the hotel and certainly worth every single penny. The location is superb within walking distance of all the must see's, only one thing to watch out for is taxi's - you may have money to spend on the Luxurious Exedra but we are not stupid enough to pay the 18 Euros requested for a taxi ride from Termini raliway station to the hotel !!!!! don't be fooled the distance it is a very managable stroll down the street (we know that now of course !!). One of the best served hotels I have ever had the privelidge to stay in and it would come highly recommended to all I know.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but......”
Reviews.Author: HUTCH1113
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Rome on our honeymoon and decided to stay in a 5 star hotel. The hotel was convenient to the main train station (walking distance) and it was central to all the major sites. Not to mention there was a metro stop right at the Piazza where the hotel was (Repubblica). Inside the Exedra was gorgeous with a very grand lobby area and the staff was friendly to us at check in and found the concierge to be helpful. We were more than pleased with our room (Double Superior). Very big and beautiful with amazing crown moulding and beautiful mahogony wood in the foyer with a very nice mini-bar area. The bathroom was polished marble with a fabulous jet tub and a stand up shower. The stand up shower was a little small and water got everywhere as you are climbing into it. We thought that breakfast would be included in the price, but we were disappointed to discover that it was 26 euro for a continental breakfast ($35). Outrageous! Also, the prices of room service and the spa were so expensive that we didnt even bother to use them, even on our honeymoon! Overall, it was a nice stay but we are suer there are better hotels in room for a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Enormously impressive hotel - we stayed here for our honeymoon and were overawed by the quality and luxury. Our room was only standard but that in itself was very elegant - and the view was lovely. The staff spoke perfect English and were very polite and friendly. They even provided us with complementary champagne to celebrate our honeymoon! The only bad thing about the Exedra was all the hidden costs - ironing etc. And the mini-bar is computerised - don't touch anything unless you're prepared to pay for it! On the whole - a wonderful hotel - very pretty and in a quite central location. I would love to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay at the Exedra again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked "The Celebration" Package. Upon arrival we were told we could not upgrade our room. We were given a room which was a long walk and the view of someones laundry. We complained and were told no other rooms were available unless we upgraded to a junior suite. We ended up paying a great deal more to move to a better room. Never received any of the other items included in the celebration package (VIP welcome sparkling wine & fruit) When we booked the Celebration package taxes and service were included. When we left we were charged additional taxes. When we stated that all taxes we included they had no explaination and charged us the additional taxes. I would not stay at this hotel ever again!

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Exedra is a magnificant building and an adequate hotel - at prices for which one would expect better. Pros - the room was spacious and well equiped. - the bed was comfortable Cons - the staff at all levels were unhelpful - a 15 minute wait just to get into breakfast - simply no-one answering the phone when I tried to call the hotel - the telephones in the rooms are all mislablled (try pressing 1 for switchboard as suggested and all you will get is hiss). - an absurd policy about not providing guests with irons and ironing boards (as mentioned in an earlier review) - front desk were unable to get us a taxi - long queues at the check-in desk In addition the location 20-30 minutes walk from anywhere useful (except the Termini central railway station) can hardly be described as a plus although of course you know this before you book. So, in conclusion, lacking not just some of the touches you would expect from a 5* hotel, but pretty much all of them.

Reviews.Title: “Superb 5 star luxury hotel (that's a clue).”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I honestly don't what the recent previous reviewers were on. Admittedly I had a deluxe room with a stunning view of the piazza and its own upstairs gallery for the sleeping area but I found the service friendly, helpful (the concierge rang me after checking out some sightseeing details without any chasing) and efficient. The giveaway is probably the 'no vouchers' comment - this is the kind of hotel that if breakfast is included all you have to do is give your room no. and it's sorted. There is music in the lifts, big deal. Overall it's incredibly quiet - no neighbour noise or corridor noise and very little from an endlessly busy street outside. The bathroom was immaculate - pure marble and granite and cleaned spotlessly everyday, the room tastefully furnished with electonically controlled curtains (as they are 30 ft high this is necessary), soft pillows and a huge comfy beds - TV in the bed area and the sitting area. The location is extremely good -= right by a Metro and a short walk from some cheaper pizzerias, cafes to offset the 5 star room rates. The only criticism I can come up with is that there are no tea/coffee facilities other than the room service and/or minibar so for refreshment you've got to go out. I'd go back here again or try their other hotel the Aleph which is handier for the via Condotti, Spanish Steps area. Perhaps others have found a different Exedra somewhere. I'd go back to this one again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, loved the room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Exedra is an impressive hotel: marble floor in the bathroom, crocodile skin covered furniture, etc. but, despite that we were very disappointed with our week long stay there. Our room on the third floor overlooked a car park and was a very long walk and then a marble staircase to the lift. Not too good for those with mobility problems. We tried using a staircase that was closer to our room but it was filthy: very dusty, the floor strewn with cigarette ends. The facilities are pretty good. Our room was serviced twice a day, as you would expect in this kind of hotel, and the lobby and lounge were impressive, but in our room standards fell: we had to ask four times for our bathroom floor to be cleaned. By the time the cleaner finally appeared, two days after our first request, I had washed them off myself but still insisted she cleaned the floor on principle! The price of the room also included breakfast. We were not offered breakfast vouchers when we checked in and had to ask for them. Had we not known breakfast was included in the price we would have paid for breakfast without knowing it was included. Breakfast was in a lovely modern room and there was a well stocked buffet; if only they had used locally cooked bread rather than the partially baked bread rolls that you take home to bake yourself. It is the little things that count in a good hotel. My husband became really annoyed by the TV screens that are everywhere in the building and the same piece of music they play repeatedly in the corridors. Someone please tell hotel management to change the tape. It really grates after a few days. When we arrived we asked the desk for an iron and ironing board. We were told they did not supply one, and that we had to ask the concierge to iron our clothes - at a price - plus tip, no doubt. It cost 8 euros for one shirt to be ironed, so we went out and bought an iron for the same money and ironed our own clothes on a towel. On our penultimate day, we were phoned around 11.00pm in our room by the front desk who wanted to know if we wanted to book a car to the airport the following day. We were told it would cost 50 Euros, which we said was too much. We asked for a taxi to be provided and they did everything they could to persuade us not to book one, but to go for the more expensive option. In the end, after two or three more phone calls, we told them not to bother: it was late and we just wanted to go to bed. (The following day we travelled to the airport by train - the station is only a short walk away). However, before leaving the hotel we left our luggage with the concierge so we could do some last minute shopping. When we returned we were handed our coats and bags in an absolutely filthy state. I think they must have been thrown on a dusty floor - but what annoyed me even more was there was neither an apology nor any attempt to clean them for us. The woman at the desk saw the dust, heard me complain to my husband and put her head down and pretended she hadn't seen it. The look of sorrow when we wouldn't tip the concierge had to be seen to be believed. Our overwhelming feeling on leaving the hotel was that this was a missed opportunity. The building and the facilities are excellent but the staff could do with some serious training in customer care before they can be said to give more than a 2* service. Staying at the Exedra isn't a cheap option and we will not be staying there on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel at inflated prices”
Reviews.Author: brooksz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights here in Ocotber, 2004. I have to agree with some of the recent reviews that this is a beautiful hotel with very average service. Several mornings we had to call for towels, the amenities were nice but not great and the maid service showed up at strange times. Not to mention a call at midnight (yes, we were in our room and not out enjoying the nightlife) to ask if we wanted to set-up limo service for our departure the next day. We can take a hint! The concierge was niether helpful nor friendly. The upside is that our room was lovely and the topfloor bar is a beautiful place to watch the sunset. That said, we'll stay somewhere else next time. Try the Eden or the Grand...you'll be very happy!

Reviews.Title: “4 star at 5 star prices”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful both inside and out. The rooms are very nice we stayed in a converted abby part of the hotel that was quiet and relaxing but a far walk to the front door. We did find it annoying that flat screen monitors where placed around the hotel and in the elevators advertising mercededes. We felt we should receive an advertising credit. We did sample the food it was mediocre with high prices attached. The staff is young and beautiful but lacked in attentiveness of a five star crew. Don't get me wrong it is a nice place close to all trains but the price was not comparable to the quality and service. Plus it is a about a 20 25 minute walk from the Coliseum and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 nights at the Exedra where the wonderful staff at the front desk worked two last-minute rooms for us. From the time we arrived everyone from the doorman to the front desk to the maid was helpful. We did have a couple glitches (broken shower head in one room, late room make up another day) but they were insignificant to the overall stay. It was probably the best sleep I had while in Europe. Next time I'm going directly to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel with the worst service, worst restaurants, and so many problems”
Reviews.Author: samcraig33
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 nights stay. The hotel has the impression of a 5star hotel - large rooms, beautiful lobby area, and beautiful restaurants. However, once you start to use your room and the restaurants everything starts to go wrong. We had 4 rooms at this hotel and in all 4 the mini bars did not work. Shower rails fell off of 3 of the showers in the bathrooms (the 4th had glass doors!!). The phone system is a mess with no speed dialing to conceirge, reception, spa etc. Do not use room service- your food will arrive cold. We walked out of breakfast twice and went next door to Mc Donalds!!! The food was terrible. We had terrible service at their lunch restuarant twice from an arrogant manager and the food was hurrendous. All in all this hotel was not of a 5star category and we are speaking with BA holidays to make sure this hotel is taken off their brochure. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL- it will make your stay in Rome unenjoyable. It is the most frustrating place i have ever stayed in anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel-Terrible Service!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that I travel often both for business and pleasure always staying at 5 star properties. We just returned from 4 day stay at the Exedra and would NOT recommend it to anyone. My first complaint is that I waited in line for 15 minutes to check in but I must say the staff was quite nice when I finally did deal with them. That is the staff at the front desk, the rest of the staff if basically worthless. I asked the concierge to get us tickets for Cirque du Soliel on any of the 3 nights we was there. (Note I always tip and am ready to pay a bit more for the convenience of having them get me the tickets or whatever else I need) The concierge told me they were sold out but she could get me some "off the street". She wanted to charge me 85 Euros for each ticket for seats in the back plus a "something for them" for getting me the tickets. No problem-right. Wrong, tickets were not sold out, every place I looked after walking around for a few hours was selling them on either Friday or Saturday night!!! The day we visited the Vatican we headed downstairs at 7:00am for breakfast as you need to get to the Vatican by 8:00am in order to avoid the long lines. Upon my return at 4:00pm our room was still in need of housekeeping. I called the front desk and was told that the hotel was full; my bad I guess. The breakfast buffet is great! Best part of the hotel. No business center for checking emails but they do have a computer available in the lobby. However it was down for my entire stay! Dinner was OK, terribly expensive though. Service in restaruant just OK. Although inside the hotel is very clean the red carpet outside is filthy and garbage all around the entrance. When I asked the bell hop to call a taxi he argued with the driver about his commission in front of me. Beautiful hotel, terrible service. Could be 5 stars but needs not to change management but find management. Lucky to get 3 stars. Stay at either of the Westin properties not here.

Reviews.Title: “Celebration Package Deal - Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fantastico! This hotel is worth staying at especially if you are celebrating a special occasion. We stayed for 3 nights in August 2004 and were more than pleased with our choice. The room (were upgraded to a Deluxe in front) was spacious (huge), wonderfully decorated and very confortable bed and sofa/furnishings. We almost didn't want to leave such a beautiful and comfortable room. No noise was ever heard from the piazza below. The bathroom was very spacious as well and the maids came in to clean twice during the day. Turn down in the evenings as well as slippers and a linen was layed down on the rug beside each side of the bed each evening. Nice touch! We arrived at 10:00 in the AM and were in our room by 10:30 and the staff were very helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet in the morning was a buffet that was nowhere near standard fare. This buffet was top notch with Crepes, fresh salads, fruits, fresh squeezed juices on demand not just sitting there, homemade pastries of all sorts, Espresso or any other type of cafe you would ask for.. all cheeses including fresh Buffalo Mozzarella, and Parmesan in plentiful supply, salami and other meats smoked etc. Pool on roof was a wonderful retreat during the scortching hot Rome afternoons. If you are going to Rome in the summer beware of the heat, it is brutal and most stores close during this time so having a rooftop pool was truly a plus. The view during the day and in the evening was fantastic. Drinks in the bar Tazio in front and sitting outside were expensive but worth the extra treat. If you have a special occasion coming up and can spend a few extra $$'s this is a place that will not disappoint. Go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: Skippy64
Reviews.Content: This hotel far exceeded my expectations. We were upgraded through our travel agent to a jr. suite facing the Piazza and the beautiful fountain below. Unbelievablely the windows were so soundproof and the black out curtains so thick that you would never hear the busy traffic circle below at night.... The location is great, we walked to all our destinations. The Vatican being the farthest from the hotel, we bought a metro ticket right outside at the newsstand for only 1 euro and rode the train there. (The metro stop is right at the hotel!) We left on a Saturday morning which is slow for the taxi's so we were offered only 40 euro to go to the airport which is usually 60 euro. We had originally planned to take the train to the airport..

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: NMG
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Exedra for 5 days in late July '04. The staff was extremely attentive and helpful. They were excellent with restaurant recommendations and where to shop! The hotel was one of the best luxury hotels we have ever stayed in! On par with the nicest of the Four Seasons. Worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at its finest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Definitely a great place to stay. Centrally located and a fabulous hotel. It is a little pricey, but not more than I'd expect for that type of opulence. Staff and service were great. The room is what magnificent. We were on the back, so the view was poor, but we booked at a bargain rate. Views from rooms on the front are spectacular overlooking a beautiful fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Luxury Hotel - higly recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Stayed for 4 nights in May, paid £616 each including flights and private transfer from the airport for room only accomodation. The transfer was quick and easy, also higly recommended. Can not comment on the food as we did not eat there, however the room was of a very high standard with not one complaint from us. Sights are a walk away therefore a taxi or bus is required for the less able walkers. If you want lively nightlife on your door step then this is not the place because the main piazzas are at a good 30mins walk. There are however, great resturants within 3 mins walk down alley ways so there is no real need to travel far.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: johnnie_r
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Exedra twice in July. Its phenomenal - but not without the odd glitch. The main glitch being room 232 because of its lack of a view - but even that has the compensation of being massive. The rooftop pool is great (though its only open till 7 not 11 as the in room hotel guide says!) Other than that - concierge, front desk and valet staff are superb. Housekeeping is excellent. The rooms are superbly finished and fantastically comfortable. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful rooms.... unprofessional staff”
Reviews.Author: wendysudu
Reviews.Content: There is no question that the room we had at Exedra was beautiful.... very large, well-appointed, fabulous bed, great linens, great view on the Piazza Del Republica. ALl of the hotel's shortcomings concern the service staff. THe concierge was only vaguely helpful. When we asked for a recommendation for a good restaurant within walking distance, he made a rservation at quite possibly the worst restaurant in our two week trip. We were among four diners in a restaurant that could easily accomodate 100. THe hotel's restaurant (on the roof, alongside the pool) was outrageously expensive, with onlyl TWO choices for first and second courses. At 9:00PM on a FRiday night we were the only diners. It is, however a beautiful spot for a drink after dinner. We had problems with our phone (it could not make outgoing calls) and no attempts were made to fix the problem. Also, when the bathroom lights no longer worked, there were faint-hearted promises of sometone getting to it at some point (at 11PM!) WIthout a window, the bathroom had NO light. When we attempted to obtain a candle from the restaurant off the lobby, we met with enormous resistance. I nearly grabbed one off a table, but was prevented from doing that. ALl in all... the staff was ill-equipped to handle some very typical requests of guests. Still... the rooms were nice!!!! IT would be a great place if you could guarantee that you would never need the assisstance of the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “The Exedra is the Best Hotel I have been in !!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have never been to a Hotel where the people where so nice. From checking in to needing a Taxi. They are always willing to help, and the rooms, are breath taking!!! Another nice thing is that the Hotel was just used for the filming of Oceans 12, So if in Rome a must stay place.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Welshtorchy
Reviews.Content: My wife & I have just returned from a 3 night "Celebration Package" stay at the Exedra. The deluxe room was extremely spacious and very well appointed with a tremendous view overlooking the piazza. All the staff were very polite & helpful, and made us feel welcome. The menus were - interesting- drinks expensive, even for a 5* property in Rome. Breakfast was good and set you up for the day. The roof top bar & pool were delightful, especially after a long day walking around this beautiful city. If you are looking for somewhere special to stay in Rome there is no other place!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible room experience but crazy prices”
Reviews.Author: kikipou
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Rome last May. We chose the Boscolo because it was well located though not in Old Rome (we were afraid of the noise). In fact, we found out the location was perfect for us : close to the city's historic center, with choice for restaurants and bars and shops (including the train and bus station mall). But what really made it for me, beside the silence, the gorgeous modern decoration, was the room : 40 sq meter with an incredible ceiling at least 6 to 8 meters high (with a matching bay-window overlooking the abbey on Piazza della Reppublica) ! I stayed 6 days and could not get enough of this crazy impression getting in my room - and I have been in a lot of 5 stars before. The beds were grand, comfortable, perfect, like the marble bathroom and the dressing room. One critic though : ridiculous prices (even for a 5 stars hotel). An example : a regular basic continental breakfast for around 25 euros ! So, if your ok with being outside historic Rome in a typical international hotel : get a good deal on the hotel room (I got the best rate from their own internet site), ask for the high ceiling rooms and only use it as a base eg leave in the morning and come back at night after your hard day of fun visiting one of the most incredible cities ever ! You'll get incredible rest.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shauneen
Reviews.Content: The Exedra hotel was lovely, out room was excellent, lovely room with a wooden beam ceiling, dissapointed in the restaurant though, my partner and myself both ordered the same 3 courses, but when the food arrived we recieved one meal between us. 1 starter, 1 bowl of rice and 1 steak. very strange. Hotel is very central and the concierge was excellent in booking us train tickets unward to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harristravel
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in rome staying at the exedra. The hotel is absoultely beautiful and in a very good location. All the staff were very helpful. The roof top pool is a great advantage when the weather is hot. our room was superb. One big disadvantage in staying here was the cost of drinks £4 for a coca cola and £4 for a coffee. The exedra needs to look into this overcharging of tourists staying with them charges for drinks and foods is obviously targetted at business travellers with an open budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - eventually”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Exedra 2-4 July. Booked the Celebration Special, with Deluxe upgrade and Tazio bar meal. Arrived in the lobby at 12pm to be told our room wasn't ready, but we could either wait 30 minutes or have a twin room - we told them we would wait. We walked into a lovely big room, but opened the curtains to find a view of.... a huge air conditioning unit. That's right, dreaded room 232. We immediately phoned reception to ask for a different room as I definitely didn't class this as a "deluxe" room. After a 2 hour wait (I guess the late checkout offered on these rooms has it's disadvantages too), we were finally given a gorgeous room with a Piazza view. This was more like it. I found all the staff pleasant and helpful, and the public areas of the hotel were lovely. Breakfast was awesome, dinner in the Tazio was deserted (just us) and food was err.... interesting. Overall, an excellent stay - just don't be fobbed off with a substandard room.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our 3 night stay”
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay July 1, 2 and 3. Also had the special $210/night w/ breakfast, welcome drink and one dinner. Yes, dinner took a long time, but they placed no limits on the order, and the food and drink were very good. The Piazza Republica is very nice, plenty of activity, extremely clean, people were out at all hours walking, so it seems rather safe. Has its own subway stop. We thought the place was central enough to everything. We only really took a cab from the Vatican ... and one morning to do a sort of 'historical sites tour' before getting out to walk around. We actually walked to the train station with our bags (two or three blocks). Our room was great! View of the piazza, huge bath with separate shower, double sinks. Breakfast was the best we had in Italy ... really a brunch. The pool was perfect after a day of touring. Yes, the towels were usually gone, but there was always someone to ask and just try and find a hotel in Rome with a pool. Plus ... It was rooftop!! You get to swim and watch the city. I would go back ...

Reviews.Title: “Ok, not perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I liked the front of the hotel, it is shared with a McD and a cinema but these are not obtrusive. The reception was nicely done, if a bit too clinical. I wouldn't say it was the friendliest welcome I had ever had. I was upgraded to a deluxe room but this was disappointing - a luxury room should surely have a separate shower and bath (?). The room was adequate in size but not spectacular, the view was of the bins. My package (euro 210 a night inc breakfast) included a meal at the restaurant Tazio. Service here was a disgrace, 25 minutes to get a drink to the table (from a bar 20 yards away), food ok but not cooked as ordered, 2 people walked out while I ordered. Overall it's a nice looking hotel in a good location for the sights without being too central, but it's spoilt by a cold attitude, friendly enough but not sincere. Stay here if you get a bargain price, it's not as good as the reviews have said.

Reviews.Title: “Superficial”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Whilst the decor is nice, inside and outside the rooms, and the pool is a nice feature when it's a hot day, the service in the hotel is 2nd rate. The carpet to the lower floor had dirt marks on it and looked like it had not been cleaned for weeks. Room service took 1 1/2 hours to deliver a fruit plate. Also, watch out for the old pay TV channel cheap trick - a simple flick of the wrong button and you've been charged for (you guessed it) porn. This is not the sort of practice one expects from a highly rated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “recent visit”
Reviews.Author: DublinYvonne
Reviews.Content: Visisted the Exedra on June 1 and 2 lovely hotel but sadly Main Dining Room, Pool and Roof Garden closed for the duration of our stay , I felt we should have had prior notice of the missing facilities

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Exedra is a very good hotel, but I would not quite put it in the highest regard of other reviewers. To be sure, the hotel is new and well done. The rooms are very spacious and tastefully decorated. The rooms' high ceilings accented the space. The staff was courteous, but the language skills were a bit short of what i would expect of a hotel of this class. I would compare the Exedra to a beautiful home that had been built on a lot with all the trees taken out. The hotel itself is beautiful, but the surroundings are not at the same level. The piazza that the hotel sits has very heavy traffic..not unlike many in Rome. The hotel itself is in the same building as a newly opened movie theater and there is significant pedestrian traffic wandering by. It may be a matter of preference and the hotel itself is very nice, but I thought the setting as a whole lacked a certain charm. My wife and I had dinner one evening at Hotel Eden (highly reccommend) in the Via Venetto neighborhood and the difference was striking. I give the hotel itself a five and the setting a three leading to my overall rating of a four.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: mclachlan4321
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend for a short break. The lobby is amazing, great place for a drink. The rooms are very nice, although we have stayed in better. We found the worst point was the level of English spoken; It varied greatly between staff. Some understood so much, whereas others were very basic. I think this is wrong in a capital city and in an upper class hotel such as this. They made mistakes with nearly every one of our food and drinks orders.

Reviews.Title: “highly over rated”
Reviews.Author: pbery
Reviews.Content: this is a highly over rated and expensive hotel. the rooms are gaudy an have limited ammenties. the service is very poor. the concierge is forever trying to get you to go on privat guided tours. the restraunt they reccomended was closed! the guide they sent us to the Vatican with could hardly speak any English. we stayed for 4 days and except for the location there is nothing to reccomend. a Bit of a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Want to go back, now!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't want to replicate everything that's already been said, but I certainly will validate that the Exedra is a magnificent hotel. My mother and I stayed there May 9-17th. We had a large room overlooking the park and the basilica; it was extremely quiet! We did have minor glitches, my very American mother could not get washcloths, and one ice machine on our hall was broken. And, the doorman told our cabbie to take us to the wrong destination, costing us twice the price the trip should have taken. These tiny flaws were WAY overriden by the super helpful staff; Roberta at the front desk went above and beyond to help us many times. I also loved the lack of pretention for a five-star hotel; we had all the amenities and service, yet the staff remained friendly and willing to help non-Italian speaking Americans. (We tried to speak as much Italian as we could...) Anyway, I want to take my husband next time. The location is absolutely superb! Shopping, food and the killer Diocletian baths under your feet and across the street. (Go down to the business center and wander over the glass floors that look down into the ruins of the baths...amazing!)

Reviews.Title: “Good but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Exedra over New Year 2003/4 and, although we enjoyed our stay, I can't say we felt it was as amazing as other reviewers. Though we booked a superior room our room was very small and looked out onto the inner courtyard over wheelie bins, a/c units etc (probably to be expected as we picked up a discounted rate on lastminute). The pool was shut and we also found the housekeeping service to be rather slow. However, it is a beautiful hotel and the lobby is a great place to enjoy a glass or wine or three while people watching. Plus the beds are unbelievably comfortable - we slept for 12 hours on our first night there!

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned last week from a wonderful trip in Rome ,we read about the Exedra hotel at the Tripadvisor, every word that was written about it, is true: extraordinary hotel! beautifull room, amazing bathroom, one of the best in europe.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read an article in the paper that recommended this hotel and so we stayed there for 2 nights. I had a hard time leaving this place because it was so nice. Our room was fit for a king. After walking all throughout Rome it was perfect to come back too. The Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. I would pay the extra money for this great Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Egregiously
Reviews.Content: Superb Hotel from start to finish. Excellent facilities, staff and very comfortable beds. Good location on the edge of the historic centre and good metro access to vatican museums north and colloseum to the south. Having stayed in many hotels across the world this ranks amongst the best. The Piazza de Republica is pleasant so disregard any comments in AA guide which in my opinion is not the most useful guide to Rome( it does not mention this hotel ) and its maps are hard to read.

Reviews.Title: “5-star Luxury at Roman 4-star prices”
Reviews.Author: GlobalVenturer
Reviews.Content: We spent Easter 2004 in Rome and opted for this hotel based on the great reviews on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. We were given a fabulous room on the 4th floor overlooking the fountain in the Piazza de la Republicca. The room and hotel is exactly what you would expect of a 5-star luxury property... plenty or marble, comfortable bed (the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever had!), huge room, great views, excellent service etc etc. The only problem we had was with our door lock - the key card did not work. Upon notifying the reception staff, this was remedied immediately. Highly recommended and will definitely go back. Final note - the in-room minibar prices are outrageous (Euro 9 for a Coke?!) but the lobby bar abd restaurant downstairs had competitive prices with external restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at great value!”
Reviews.Author: Londonfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Exedra in February half term and would strongly recommend it to anyone. The room rate was much cheaper than any of the othr luxury hotels in Rome and they were quite happy for our 10 and 13 year old children share our room. Quite rare in Europe, especially where kids are over 12. Otherwise we would have needed two rooms...very expensive. The decor was stylish and the room was huge. Bathroom beautiful. We tended to eat out. The concierge was most helpful and directed us to some great restaurants, although one was a little strange....sadly can't remember its name...not helpful I know. Breakfast buffet in restaurant was not too goo and overpriced. Fra better to have breakfast in champagne bar on ground floor. Croissants juice and coffee for 7 euros. We asked for more of everything and they didn't charge any extra! All the staff are very helpful and pleasant. We did find that we had to get taxis to most places but it was worth it becuase the htoel was much better value than those which were slightly more central.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Exedra the weekend of 10 April 2004. As a travel professional I have stayed in many, many hotels all over the world. This one surely compares with the best. The room was absolutely beautiful and extremely comfortable. The beds were perfect and the linnen luxurious. Staff is very accommodating, friendly and efficient. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Europe......”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at some beautiful hotels around the world......and this is now our equal favourite (along with Palazzo Versace on the Gold Coast in Australia). Absoutley gorgeous. Beautiful room, foyer, flowers, location, staff and restaurants/bars. The attention to detail is wonderful and we got a great rate booking directly through the hotel website ie. 3 night package with breakfast and 1 dinner included. Sensational stay and can't wait to go back. Quiet and luxurious. Treat yourself...you'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the rave reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I visited Rome this past weekend and stayed at the Exedra. Despite the rave reviews on this site that set our expectations high, we were truly surprised and delighted: the service was top-notch, the room unusually spacious (by Rome standards), the bathroom a delight and the decor refreshingly 'classical' modern. The concierge couldn't have been more helpful - booking us in to the most fabulous restaurants, arranging transport and representing my interests very strongly with an airline that had managed to lose my luggage. On that subject, I experienced wonderful service - overnight tailoring - from Angelo at the Esedra boutique across the piazza from the hotel. I will definitely be returning to the Exedra soon - if only to luxuriate in the roof-top swimming pool when the weather warms up a little.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Exedra in March 2004. The hotel is beautiful with friendly and helpful staff. The buffet breakfast is impressive (although at €22 per person it should be). One could not ask more from a hotel. It was a pleasure to come back after walking all over Rome to relax in the huge sofas near the lobby over with a refreshing drink. The hotel is well located: a metro station is just outside the front door It takes approximately 15-20 minutes to get to the Vatican by metro (including a walk at the other end). And the hotel is about 10-15 minute walk from the Forum. (As an aside the best form of public transport in Rome is the bus given that the metro has only two lines, so is somewhat limited. However, we ended up working most of the time!) It was too cold to swim in the hotel's outside swimming pool, but it is located on the roof terrace on the fifth floor and is well desgined. The roof terrace is surrounded by a glass-barrier giving you an unrestricted view over Rome and giving you the impression that you could swim off the roof. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother looking elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Absolutely flawless.Incredibly helpful, friendly, smart staff. Amazing bedrooms, gorgeous bathrooms, quiet, great location, superb restaurant.Perfect.
